description:
"Be kind to pigeons. A statue one day will be made of you" - My Fortune Cookie Saying

Red Jade has been my go-to Chinese restaurant since pre-Yelp! Yup over a decade of loyalty here! 
Is Red Jade the best ever? Nope. Yet if you combine quality + quantity + presentation = a happy customer! And why I keep returning.

Red Jade is located on the corner of Church St. & Market St. On my latest visit, after a year hiatus, I enter remembering to go during lunch special time. Basically specials under $9 that include soup, hot tea, a sesame ball, and fortune cookie! And it's not like they only have a handful of lunch specials, in fact, I think it's closer to 25-30 choices! My favorites include the Lemon Chicken, General Tso's Chicken, Mongolian Beef, and Sweet & Sour Pork. 

On my last visit I ordered the Lemon Chicken which includes freshly steamed broccoli, a bed of steamed rice, egg drop soup, and the extras I mentioned above. I have zero complaints here. I wouldn't exactly call the specials authentic as it's more targeting us Americans with huge appetites lol, but it really does hit the spot. More authentic dishes can be had on their very large menu offerings. For American me, the specials are just fine! And under $9! Oh baby! Keep the Hamilton! 

All in all, I recommend Red Jade to all. Families or solo communist diners too. It's clean, furnished with care, hey it's a "real" restaurant that uses "real" dishes & table clothes! I've been coming here for over a decade and have always been treated with respect and taken care of, maybe it's my tattoo of Chairman Mao, but who really knows, eh?
author: Eric R.

description:
Surprising my first time here. The food I ordered was very scrumptious and tasty. Was recommended by BBs mother.. Crispy tofu were screaming beans the flavor was so great lots of garlic and the tofu taste almost like salt and pepper tofu. The beef chow mein with al dente..
Need to come back n try items from the large menu.
author: Crisy G.

description:
Solid, if a little uninspired. 

If, like me, you fancy objects in glow-in-the-dark sauce every so often, then this is your place. 

One note of warning: if you call at 9.31 pm, they're closed. That last 60 seconds is fatal.
author: Tim N.

description:
I've only ordered the hot and sour soup here and it seems really solid as a Chinese joint. Their lunch specials are your standard deals for less than $10 while all their other stuff seems pretty expensive but given the area it's located in, not too bad.

I live nearby and I'm a huge fan of this place. Ordering food again for tonight's dinner!
author: Mimi T.

description:
Ordered in with a food delivery. I ordered Vegetarian Delight. I requested spicy (not an option but on side note had made the request).
I would say that it was a damn good dish.
This was probably the best vegetarian dish I've had at a Chinese restaurant. Portions were not great but a hair on acceptable. The rice had good texture and moisture balance though had to be ordered as a separate dish.
I would have this meal again as I enjoyed it immensely.  The added spice was critical to the success of the dish for me but the Sauce carried it well also. With that said, the meal is a 4 and portions, 3.5 stars. The dinner was $10 for a small container of veggies in sauce and should have included a small rice. Other than that, high marks for flavor and the veggies were cooked well. Rice was acceptable. Overall, good meal! Would return.
author: John B.

description: We ordered to be delivered. Delivery was was about 20 mins late after waiting already for about an hour. The delivery was correct but the food made us ill!
author: Lucille V.

description:
Fast and free delivery (with a $20 order) that comes with free pork buns and red bean dessert balls. 

The food is decent, except pass on the tomato beef chow mein- it tastes like ketchup.
author: Leeyen R.

description: This is strictly for delivery. It seems as though every time I order delivery the order is completely wrong. It's really a shame because the food is really good.
author: NaKita H.

description: We've been coming here to eat and ordering for delivery. The service and food has always been great. Unfortunately earlier today we ordered for delivery and in the  door my friend almost swallowed a tiny metal thing, looks like a place eve from the metal dish scrubber. Please be careful when you're cooking the food :(
author: Claudia G.

description: I am repulsed. I ordered a black bean chow fun take out and I found a fly inside. Photo s for itself.
author: Alex A.

description: I'm stoked - since moving to California from the East Coast 4 years ago, my one complaint has been the Chinese food. I've just never found a place that measured up to NY style General Tso Chicken or Shrimp Fried Rice. I've tried a few places in SF, but didn't find the spot until today. Granted, I did not try the General Tsos (yet) but I got Egg Flower soup & shrimp fried rice delivered. It arrived piping hot and well packaged. The rice is bomb! Shrimp, carrots, peas, onion & egg. Seasoned well. The egg flower soup has snap peas and carrots - great texture - not too thin or too thick. Yay! I'll be back!
author: Alexa S.

description:
I feel like I'm cheating on Kung Food, but this place has become our go-to place for Chinese delivery. The usual order is the wonton soup ($10, but they give you two containers of it!) and general tsos chicken (sauce on the side to keep the chicken crispy). They always give free bbq bao buns which is nice, overall dinner is always a great value.

The only thing that sucks is I generally haven't enjoyed any of their chow meins...the regular one just has a slight hint of soy sauce and is kinda boring, and the tomato beef chow mein doesn't have any flavor at all.
author: Chanel H.

description: Bomb. I get delivery from here all the time! I love that they throw in free pork buns and sesame balls as well...my faves!
author: Julianna B.

description: Came here after a day of walking the city and happy hour and the Sugar Lounge (loved!). The appetizers were better than the meal for sure and I wish I would have filled on the pot stickers as they were so good. We had the Mongolian beef and shrimp as well as the Shrimp and Broccoli with brown rice. It served its purpose.
author: K. C.

description: It's my new go-to delivery place for Chinese take-out, and they're consistently good at getting the order correctly and fast. They're prices are reasonable with decent if not huge portions, and it great how their food arrives piping hot, with the extra goodies they include as a bonus. I particularly enjoy their soups and vegetarian dishes, and my kids like their noodle dishes, and it's one of the few places that doesn't deep fry their sesame chicken which make it a lighter yet still very tasty option. Their filet of beef is super tender and succulent with just a bit of heat, perfect with rice or those steamed buns. It's quite good for Chinese delivery given quality, portions and price.
author: Lou S.

description: The pictures do not do this place justice. A random guy on the street recommend this place to me, and to my pleasant surprise, it was pretty great. Everyone was really tasty and had a nice fresh taste. The place is nice and quiet. Tea was ok, but overall a great place for nice quality food for cheap in SF.
author: Marcus-Alex G.

description:
The lunch special can't be beat. For ten bucks including tip you get most entrees with rice, soup and a sesame ball for dessert. My go to is the vegetarian delight! Yum! A plate full of veggies that are still crisp! The beef broccoli is consistently good as well. 

Warning to you chicken eaters: specify white meat. You'll get thigh meat if you don't.
author: Tim P.

description:
Food hits the spot. However , Don't expect anything more than that.

it's like that episode of Miranda in Sex And The  City ordering Chinese food but in this case they don't seem to be happy you're a repeat customer.
author: Stephen K.

description:
Yelp played us. Prob one of the worst tasting Chinese joints in SF which is unfortunate as this city is known for great food. Large portion of food so you'll definitely get full. However, quality of food is lacking. 

I ordered the dim sum and wanted to substitute the Siu Mai for the shrimp dumpling. They charged me an extra buck which is odd, but not a big deal. My bf ordered the kung pao chicken. It didn't taste like actual chicken lol but maybe just me. The only vegetables accompanied in the dish was celery (also had baby peanuts).
author: Deb L.

description: Lunch special is a good price for sub-$10 meal with large portion sizes and available pretty late into the afternoon. I just wish it tasted like something though. Everything tastes exactly the same - and not in a good way unfortunately. Maybe we just ordered the worst items on the menu. I guess if there's no other options, then I would consider trying it again but pick different items.
author: Amanda C.

description:
If there's one thing I can tell you about SF, it's to eat at places you see cops and city workers on their lunch break - they know all the great hole in the wall spots that are hella good and don't break the bank. Red Jade is one of those places, and it doesn't disappoint.

They have the best General Chicken I've found in SF. Hands down.

Obviously eating in is better than delivery or take out, so dine in to get the best experience.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Nothing extraordinary but not horrible either. 

- The hot and sour soup was very flavorful and tasted very peppery vs spicy although still edible.
- Shrimp chow mein was also very flavorful but not wow-ing.
- Spicy salt and pepper soft crab shell special was extremely disappointing. Very skinny crab and very little portion--there was more batter than there was crab!! So not worth it.
author: Hello E.

description: A favorite delivery go-to! Great service and prices for consistently good food. The portions are huge, too.
author: Liz G.

description: Make sure to add this to part of your lunch rotation if you work in the area. Lunch specials are cheap with large portions. Also comes with a bowl of soup and sesame balls/fortune cookies at the end of the meal.
author: Patrick L.

description: Fast delivery and steaming-hot food! Absolutely delicious and i got free order of dumplings. Will order again soon!!!
author: Niko R.

description: DONT EVER COME HERE. Worst Chinese food in the world. Manager was horrible. I asked for my money back and he hung up and cussed me out. Chicken wasn't orange, wasn't chicken. Chow Leon was dry. Don't ever come here. Save the headache and go to Panda Express instead. Lucky yelp has to give them one star cause i would give them none.
author: Jeffrey M.

description:
I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could, because I do like their food - it's been my go-to Chinese place for years. But recently, right around the time that House of Chen closed, they raised their prices $2-3 across the board, so what used to be a reasonable evening out has suddenly turned into a Castro-priced evening out. 

I'll still visit, but not as often.
author: Peter H.

description: I like this Chinese food restaurant. Food was all fresh and delicious. Wonderful, warm, and friendly.
author: Carla Z.

description: Ordered delivery from this place through yelp and the food came fairly quickly so my food was still warm.  I ordered General Tsao chicken,  fried shrimp,  and sauteed spinach with garlic.  Everything was delicious except I wish the chicken was crispier as I requested but it was a little soggy.  The spinach and fried shrimp was delicious though.  They even give you little sesame balls,  fortune cookies and 2 little pork buns for free which is a very nice FREE addition.  I'd order from here again and maybe try the lemon chicken next time.
author: Lennie G.

description: Best Chinese delivery in SF. They are quick, everything arrived hot, and prices are reasonable. The rice was perfect and veggie egg rolls were larger than average. Everything is well prepared and fresh. I love that they include a few little extras, too! Will order again.
author: Ashley C.

description: I have been coming here since 2007. The owner is super sweet and always remembers my family and I when we come in or order out and greets us with a smile. Food is delicious and made fresh every time. Have recommended it to so many people and is always a hit.
author: Denise G.

description: Best Chinese in SF that I've had. General chicken is bomb! Pot stickers are great as well! I would recommend eating in its a lot better fresh then delivered but the delivery is still top notch.
author: William O.

description: Solid for delivery. You don't expect michelin star quality when you order chinese food for delivery but this hits the spot when you're craving flavorful comfort chinese food
author: Derrick W.

description: I have been coming here for years!!! The pot stickers and sesame chicken are the best!!!
author: DEANNA W.

description: Red Jade is our GO-TO fast, reliable & delicious Chinese spot! I can't speak for everything on the menu, but I will tell you that: 1) The food is twice as good (fresh from the wok) when you dine in, 2) The lunch special is fantastic, and 3) you'll never go wrong with: Sesame Chicken, Mongolian Beef, Veggie Fried Rice, Egg Drop Soup (with hot oil), Veggie Chow Mein, Green Onion Pancake & Crab Rangoon's!
author: Carlos H.

description: Chop Suey ! Mant of us growing up  remember eating  that awful Chung King Express Chop Suey. There  use to be many Chop Suey places in the U.S. and San Francisco, now there are only couple of restaurants in San Francisco that have CHOP SUEY. Red Jade is one of these restaurants. They do a great Chop Suey.
author: Stash P.

description: Wow I can't believe how great this Mandarin style Chinese restaurant is! My hubby and I decided to meet up on Church street for a drink turned out we were hungry too. I been to this place before but not in a while. I forgot that they had lunch specials until 5 which is so unheard of in any place but I will never complain! Your meal starts with a great sweet & sour soup and a good size portion too. I ordered the General Tso's Chicken lunch special and wow such a massive plate of goodness! the portion made my eyes grow bigger and also the amount of garlic, I was in heaven! As I write this review I am craving some great food from here. I'll have to update with what I have next here.
author: Troy R.

description: Very very good the the appetizers combo always hot good and great service. Combination wonton soup is hearty and filled with a veritable selection on meats.
author: RICHARD J.

description: Ordered on Postmates and it was all really gross. General chicken, house special chow mein, mabo tofu....gross.
author: Taylor K.

description: Unbelievably rude service, greasy and bland food, turn-and-burn mentality. That being said, you get what you pay for - it's cheap, quick, and will fill you up.
author: Tessa M.

description: Just ate here for my first time. Ordered Mu Shu Pork (my fav Chinese dish) Pork Fried Rice and Sweet and Sour Pork. 10/10 this is now my FAVORITE Mu Shu Pork ever and I am PICKY!!! The pork fried rice was amazing I do wish the Pork pieces were a little bigger. Also they give a TINY amount of plum sauce I had to ask for extra TWICE so a star off for that. The inside is VERY clean and nice and seems to be updated. The tables were nice and I felt the napkins were of good quality. They do put lemons in the water so heads up there. Waiter was nice but not very good English had to repeat all my order at least twice. Would absolutely recommend and I plan I coming back to try other dishes as well as the Mu Shu Pork OF COURSE!!!
author: Joe M.

description:
Upon entering their business, the staff was very welcoming and also gave us the desire to sit where we feel would suit us best. After getting seated, we were presented with a double sided menu, and they kept it fairly simple and easy to read... sadly no pictures on the menus but I ain't mad at it! We had a total of four in our party in picked what we wanted as a dish, but did not know it was gonna be an Al La Carte style, which turned out even better with more servings for a good price! The staff/waiter was very prompt, responsive, and had patience with our orders since it took us all a little longer to decide what we really wanted, so the waiter happily came back a couple times without showing any agitation or distress. Once we finally decided what we wanted, the wait time for our food was about ten to fifteen minutes which isn't bad at all... but my God was the food amazing. Fun fact, they do put a little zing of spice upon request and know how to jazz it up just to correct amount! We all really enjoyed our meal and left with happy stomachs. Left a good tip to show our thanks to the awesome staff and amazing food! Keep doing what your doing!!

Oh and my favorite dish was the 'Princess Prawns'! Hope you guys enjoy and we will definitely be comin' back!!
author: Ruce U.

description: I work nearby and needed a quick lunch.  My brother mentioned this restaurant before and that they had lunch specials, so I gave it a try.  For $7.75 I had a bowl of Sweet and Sour soup, Mongolian Beef with steamed rice, a hot pot of tea and a fortune cookie accompanied by another Chinese cookie.  Everything came out quickly, hot and was very fresh.  Seasoned perfectly, I will definitely be back to try another dish.  It's nice to know that, with a very rigid timeframe for lunch, I can trust Red Jade to serve up wonderful food, saving me from resorting to unhealthy fast food.  My go to place during my work week.
author: Frances B.

description: Greasy greasy greasy a** vegetable chow mein. I'm really disappointed in Red Jade thought they could be my go to Chinese food spot.
author: Monica D.

description: Ladies and gentlemen, it's with a heavy heart that I say my once-upon-a-time favorite restauant Red Jade Restaurant has treated me badly for some time now, it's been more than once in the occasion that I would call or order online, and when those once in awhile moments would happen, the lady with the short red hair would always yell at me for not ordering my order right. First of all, when someone puts in an order, they know what they want otherwise how could they mess up on what they crave? It's not the customer's fault, it's your fault for mixing up the order. It's also your fault for not having many customers since I am sure that you practically yell at all of them over the phone or even in person for the wrong order. Today will be marked as the last day my family and I order from there again, this is an end of being a customer after so many years.
author: Giovana C.

description: Food delivered cold and missing items I called the manager who could careless. My advice stay clear of this place shorty attitude. I simply asked them to rectify they did not.
author: Nicholas W.

description: Really just didn't like anything about it. Food wasn't great and was cold, staff was super rude. Not recommended.
author: Michael C.

description: Bland, bland, bland. Every dish had zero flavor and nothing was fresh. Clearly the vegetables were older and the chicken was suspect.
author: Dan D.

description: I can't begin to tell you how much I love this restaurant and I should be eating here more often than I do.  The service is impeccable. All the wait staff works in conjunction to make sure you get your meal hot and fresh. There is no chit chat with your server which is fine.  It seemed like only two minutes(yes a little longer probably) that I got my Crab Rangoon appetizer. Crispy and gooey as usual and with abundant sweet and sour sauce and hot mustard. The servers are quick fire but I always ask to leave the sweet and sour sauce and hot mustard for my sweet and sour pork because they move so fast. They do. The food is f'ing amazing and anyone who wants good cheap Chinese should hit this place up.
author: RD R.

description: Do not order orange chicken from here! SO, SO gross. The chicken is white and stale, and the sauce (that they don't mix in) is sickeningly sweet. One bite (that I spit out) and it went straight to the trash. I'm in the middle of my meal writing this because it's so gross. YUCK. Everything else was average. ORDER ELSEWHERE! You're doing your taste buds a favor.
author: Kristyn G.

description:
Classic American Chinese Food at the crossing of multiple neighborhoods. The hot and Sour soup is really good, that keeps me coming back. I mention the location, it's important. When crossing town this place is easy to hit without being to far out of the way. I don't believe I've ever actually eaten in but I've picked up take out here for over a decade. 

Most of all, this place doesn't take huge shortcuts. The quality of meat and vegetables is higher then some places. You know that unchewable beef that has not the best flavor with an attempted over cook and flavor cover up. Never found that to be the case at Red Jade.

Total Americanized beef broccoli and fried rice, that makes my child happy. The chow main is never too greasy and they give you sesame balls for desert.

 I've never been disappointed.
author: Ben M.

description: I really like eating here because there's always available seats and the service is always nice and fast, last time I was here I ordered the kung pao chicken and I loveeeed it, it was tasty and they serve good portions, and I almost forgot the best part the price!!! I didn't spend much for a whole meal that includes the soup of the day.
author: Fabricio V.

description: The past few years eating here probably once every 2 weeks, this place has been consistently good.
author: Robb K.

description:
Food is decent ish. Super cheap good service
Won't recommend trying anything fancy here, just the normal Chinese food at a great price
author: Ramin A.

description: Do not order the orange chicken from here! The chicken is white and stale, and the sauce isn't mixed in and is overly sweet. Save yourself the trouble and order from anywhere else.
author: Garrett A.

description: This is one of the best Chinese restaurants in the area. Very polite, very tasty, highly recommended. Try the dim sum, its up there with the best!
author: Chris H.

description:
By no means top of the line Chinese food, but this is my go-to American-Chinese delivery place. Love that they include free pork buns and sesame balls with your order :) They're also really reliable and come within the time estimate they quote.

I've ordered from Red Jade on multiple occasions:

Crab rangoons: they were a little soggy by the time we ate it but it tasted good. Mm fried cream cheese
Sweet and sour chicken: satisfied unhealthy cravings for this. I also got the pork version and both were equally good. Comes with pineapple chunks and peppers!
General Tso's Chicken: i don't recommend this. For some reason, the way they put way too much breading and there's not enough meat. The sauce is just okay
Szechuan / spicy eggplant: oily, but good for delivery
Mapo tofu: Was a weird brown sauce instead of what I imagine with red chili.
author: Claudia C.

description:
Very mediocre Chinese food.  How did everyone get free pork buns?  I'm a bit sad we didn't.  

Dinner:
Prawns in mobster sauce (bbt anyone?)
Hot and sour soup

The food was fine, but very underwhelming.  Not a place I would highly recommend, but if it's slim pickings...you'd be fine getting your Chinese food fix here.  We ordered on Eat 24 and it took an hour.  No pork buns but we did get free sesame balls.
author: Lyn C.

description:
Well I've .done a  review before but that was on my last account so here is my second review. it's been a couple years I think they hv new employees the restaurant I think. Remodeled I don't know it just looks bigger brighter really nice bathroom was clean. very friendly employees the manager was very nice seat yourself anywhere you could take your time very attentive towards you will keep asking if you need anything how is everything food came fast hot just the way I like it and it's very cheap to eat here the lunch special from 11am to 5pm.
the last time I was here I eat with my sister and we had the child Maine fried rice and shrimp walnut which was really good so I've tried a few dishes so if you're looking for a cheap place come check it out want to come for lunch or dinner,and it's good for a big party they have one big table that I think Sits 6ppl
author: Lizzie G.

description: This place is not customer oriented. I have been eating at this restaurant for years. I recently stopped because they became rude when they messed up an order that I placed. And this is not the first time they have made mistakes and not fixed it.
author: Crystal F.

description: I ordered a pork egg foo young and the worst egg foo young i had. Food looked like a deep fried hash brown and no pork at all or no trace of other vegetables at all. They mixed the shredded pork in sauce (never saw shredded meat in sauce before- only at this place).
author: Don P.

description: I needed a new Chinese place to order from and this place fits my needs. It is very affordable and I have not ordered anything that I have not liked so far. I am a big fan of their fried rice as well since they put a good amount of veggies in it.
author: Max W.

description:
Middle-of-the-Silk-Road-Mandarin. The restaurant is clean, the service is fine, and the food is of decent quality, if a bit bland. Ate here family style so I got to try the Mongolian beef, sea food chow fun, a tofu dish that I've already forgotten, broccoli cashew chicken, and shrimp fried rice. The chow fun was easily the best dish, and the fried rice was pretty good. The rest was just alright, and tasted better doctored with soy sauce and chili paste.

I'd consider coming back here to try their appetizers or tomato beef chow mein if I were nearby and pressed for time. The price was decent for the location and quality of the food. There's better Chinese food in SF, but you'd be paying more or waiting more than an hour to sit down at peak mealtimes elsewhere. Red Jade is a nice compromise where you'll be seated quickly, and affordable if you're treating a group to dinner. We were treated t
o sesame balls after dinner, and they were very tasty!
author: Mike G.

description: Delivery took kind of long but it was definitely worth the wait! i'm a big fan of dim sum and have tried it countless times before, it was great! and for my boyfriends first time trying it i was happy we got something so good! it was a random search coming across this place because we were actually staying in the city and needed something to eat so glad they deliver. and we did get some free pork buns, delicious! would definitely order again!
author: Amanda Z.

description:
Food came out fast... literally in 5 minutes. It was scary it came out that fast.
Orange chicken was crunchy batter, no chicken topped with yellow sauce.  When we told them we didn't enjoy the dish at all the waiter responded with "we always make them like this"  
Broccoli chicken, chicken wings were just okay.  Not amazing.  .
Spinach chicken soup was really good.
Customer service was great until we asked them to take the orange chicken back and asked for receipt in English so we could read it.  
Receipt was written in chinese.
author: Rascha C.

description: Been looking for a new Chinese food place and found it! Ordered delivery a few times and they have yet to disappoint. The food was delivered hot and tasty with freebies. We are looking forward to eating at this location soon and will leave follow up feedback soon after. I say check it out! :) Crispy noodle with beef, half chicken, sweet & sour pork and the won ton soup. Yummy!!
author: Wayne A.

description: This used to be my go-to place but on my recent order (Nov17) of potstickers, fried rice, mongolian lamb and chow mein the food quality had dipped significantly.  The mongolian lamb was particularly bland and tough and the potstickers were more starchy and less savory than I rmember.  I'm disappointed I need to find a new place.
author: J. O.

description:
We often get delivery from Red Jade and are always still pretty satisfied.  It's definitely the best option in the area that delivers.  Their best dishes are the fried rice, wor won ton soup, crispy chicken, salt and pepper pork chops, and the string beans w/ pork.
The delivery itself seems to have gotten a little worse.  It can be hit or miss: they always say it takes 45 minutes, but I've gotten it as soon as 30 mins. and sometimes as late as 60 mins.  Sometimes the drivers get lost, and sometimes they're apologetic for being late or for delivery cold food; other times, they act like nothing's wrong.  I guess it's just par for the course for food delivery!
author: Carlo A.

description: Our favorite place for Chinese food delivery. They have yummy dim sum too!
author: Brad M.

description: My go place in the past as been Erics Chinese, but they don't deliver, and their prices are starting to rise. So I was looking for a local dinner place that would deliver to me. I came across Red Jade, so I ordered thru yelp. The food came within 30 minutes, which is very fast. The delivery was free, and my order came to just over $20, which was a deal considering that I ordered 1 main chicken course, 1 won ton soup, and rice. They threw in 2 steamed pork buns, which was also delicious and a very generous add. The food was all excellent. The delivery was smooth as could be, and very quick. Thanks!
author: Zach S.

description: Special shout out to the peeps at Yelp Eat24. The online ordering was easy and fast. Although  Red Jade dropped the ball and delivered 45 min past the agreed delivery time. Of course the food tastes like cold leftovers.  But Yelp Eat24 offered a 50% refund because the food was inedible. Shame on Red Jade for shrugging their shoulders. Kudos to Yelp Eat24 for picking up half of the cost of the cold horrible food. Red Jade simply said. That's what happens when we are busy. I said I'm in a hotel and can't reheat food that was delivered late and cold. They said next time it hopefully would be better. I said there won't be a next time for Red Jade.
author: Luna S.

description:
My go-to for good-quality, reasonable Chinese lunch. Always fresh vegetables and hearty portions. Soups are very good, too. Love the bean paste-filled sesame ball at the end.

Very clean and excellent service. What more could you want?
author: Crabcakes C.

description: This is an everyday sort of restaurant: economical, large enough menu, efficient, clean and delicious!
author: Peter H.

description:
The Red Jade is great value for what you pay. Especially in The Castro. 
Service is prompt, wait staff is knowledgeable. 
When in The City usually make a visit here. 
Good selection of classic Chinese!  Served Hot. 
Also, they do a lot of Take Away business
author: Trey W.

description: My favorite Chinese food place! Delicious, inexpensive, good quality and good service. Parking can be a little tricky but it's worth it! I come here at least once a month, love it!
author: Jo M.

description: This is my go-to Chinese food place. It was there for me the time that I thought I had brought my lifting gloves to the gym, but didn't. It was there that time my ex-boyfriend cheated on me with that awful man, Chad. It was there for me that time when I stupidly thought Nikola Zrinski's role in the Siege Of Szigetvár was less crucial than that of Suleiman the Magnificent. It's been there for me a lot, and I especially recommend the sweet and sour chicken.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Nothing outstanding, but basically got what I was expecting and they followed my order instructions for the most part.  Only glitch was trying to get the order canceled for delivery when my order went through Eat24 w/o me getting a chance to check it or even apply my $2 off coupon.  Everything worked out in the end.  The wait staff were also nice and helpful.

One item I don't get the popularity of is the doughy grease bomb onion pancake - I thought maybe it had some egg omelet in it to make up the thickness, but no, just layers of grease soaked dough w/ very scant green onion - why?  Green onions are cheap!  I'm having a hard time forgetting it.  Ugghhh.

Soup broth was too salty,  my fried rice ok, the wontons good, the vegetable dish also good.  Will have to explore their menu.  Guess I never tried this place before due to it's totally awkward location across from a muni platform so parking, even double parking for pick-up, is out of the question.  Unfortunate.
author: Rose B.

description: Better than the average Chinese restaurant. Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Forgot my sweet and sour sauce, food was cold
This restaurant used to be so much better.  I am not sure what happened, but super disappointing.  Have started going elsewhere
author: Elizabeth C.

description: I love the Chinese restaurant I think it's the best Chinese restaurant in the city that I've been to. I love The Wonton combination soup delicious. Love the general spicy chicken and the shrimp fried rice my favorite order it all the time. I love to go there for lunch time. I highly recommend this place to everyone give it at least one chance if you go there and it's not so good give it another chance I always get delivery unless I go there for lunch.
author: Hector O.

description: This is close to.my workplace n it's my go to Chinese place.  The food is good n not too greasy like other places.  prices r reasonable too! I like the sesame balls they give with the meals.
author: Linh G.

description: This was a favorite inexpensive go to place...WAS...until I found a cockroach in the pork dish. I am speechless.
author: Thomas B.

description:
If you like Chinese food, don't like noisy restaurants, and are put off by the unreasonably high prices charged by most restaurants in the Castro Street area of San Francisco, then you should give Red Jade a try.

I eat at Red Jade with my spouse and friends several times each month and make use of their take-out service just as often. The food is excellent and the portions are substantial - when we go there we always order more than we expect to eat so that we can take the rest home for future meals.

Service at the Red Jade is friendly and efficient. Even when most of the tables are occupied, the noise level is low enough for comfortable conversation - not like most San Francisco restaurants, where you have to shout to talk to the person across the table from you.

My favorite dishes at Red Jade are the Yee Wor Wonton Soup ($9.50), the Happy Family Special (Jumbo prawns, fresh fruits, and glazed walnuts) at $12.95, and the Chicken Chow Fun with Black Bean Sauce ($8.95).
author: Clayton L.

description:
Second time here diner 
This time was not good the
Food smell rancid maybe it's the oil 
The food was bland as can be 
Sloppy looking food 
The chicken meat smells
Like it was left out and not refridge properly 
This maybe the last time
The server was quick and nice tho
author: Hieu N.

description: The food was good and plentiful. Unexpectedly there were bell peppers in the asparagus chicken but I didn't check what vegetables went into it. Other than that, the food was good. I ordered delivery and it took about an hour to get here so it wasn't hot but it wasn't cold either. And the food was still tasty. I'm trying pick up this time. Hopefully food will still be warm since the hubby is coming to pick it up and bring it to me. :)
author: Kristine S.

description:
Love Red Jade.  Cheap and indulgent. They hook it up with exactly what you want from Chinese food in this price range. Heck, I'd say they over-deliver considering the price point.

Hot and sour sour soup is killer.

Beef with garlic sauce very tasty, and Genral Tso's up to snuff for the price range.

They're super generous, always throw in pork buns and sesame rolls with any decent size order. That's what really keeps me coming back.
author: Chris C.

description: Well, although this has happened before, I thought I'd give Red Jade one more chance...I ordered delivery and specifically, in ALL CAPS, requested the sauce on the side of the Princess Prawns. But what arrived was a gloppy, disgusting mess. Called the restaurant, as soon as I discovered it, and suddenly, no one speaks English there. NEVER again will I darken the doorway or pick up the phone. There are too many decent competitors to put up with this treatment. All those contemplating continued patronage, this is a cautionary tale, if ever one was uttered.
author: Doug W.

description: This used to be a favorite, until I saw the roach on the wall.  Clean it up!  What a disgusting thing to deal with when I am eating lunch!  Yuck!!
author: Harris A.

description: I mean, my grandma orders her Chinese food from here. Been eating Red Jade for years. The combination wor Won-ton soup and the potstickers are my faves. I love the beef chow fun as well. They also deliver and hook u up with sesame balls and pork buns!
author: April S.

description:
Fairly large, fairly standard Chinese restaurant with pretty middle-of-the-road fare.

Server was all-business, took my order and walked away, expressionless. Food was served fast and way very hot. Flavors and textures of my Kung Pao Chicken were completely standard. 

Nothing bad to say. Nothing good to say. Hungry for Chinese food and you're walking past? Pop in. You won't rave about it, but it'll satiate your hunger.

Lunch specials appeared to be reasonably priced and are probably the way to go, over dinner.
author: Sean B.

description: Delicious fresh food and a killer lunch special that lasts until 5 pm! Great atmosphere and fast service.
author: Peter S.

description: I recommend the shrimp egg foo young. Hard to find in the Bay Area but it is so good!  One of my favorite dishes here.
author: Frequent T.

description: Ordered through Eat24. This restaurant used flour tortillas for their mu shu wrappers... again, used FLOUR TORTILLAS in stead of rice wrappers. I can't stand sushiritto and wouldn't have expected this Chinese restaurant to use tortillas!!! Also, when you order delivery, and pay for it and still tip, I expect it at my door, NOT on the street because you can't find parking!
author: Eddy L.

description: You can't go wrong with Red Jade. I ordered through Eat24 and the delivery took over an hour but when the food was delivered it was still hot. I went simple this time Wonton Soup, Pork Fried Rice, and Chicken with Green Beans.
author: CinDee M.

description: Mixed feelings. Their food is sometimes quite good, portions large and inexpensive. On the other hand, they just want you to eat and get out. I've never felt like a welcome customer. It's not part of their DNA.
author: Robert S.

description: Food here is poor quality. Service is good - attentive staff, but not a whole lot more worth going for.
author: Lisa G.

description:
I don't normally review but I'm going out of my way on this one. 

I ordered the sweet and sour pork and wonton soup. The soup broth was good but for both dishes the meet was terrible and whatever was covering them was super floury and gross. 

This was at 9pm on a Friday so I would have thought everything was pretty fresh and decent. It's not often I get bad Chinese food so this was surprising.
author: Marshall J.

description: I loooove this place!! I can't say that enough! Been coming here for over 5 years.. I always get the same thing (orange chicken). To me it's the best I've ever had!!  Service is extremely speedy. The staff all know me now which is nice. Potstickers are amazing as well!! Super crispy n delicious:). Lunch goes till 5pm -I love that! The egg flower soup is off the chain!! All around my fav. Chinese restaurant in the bay!!!!!:)
author: Natasha P.

description: Did delivery , won ton chicken souo and otstickers with 2 drinks .it seemed like forever to get to me lol but the food was delicious , i would wait that long again . I ordered from bamboo and that was a big bust. This is my new go to
author: Maribel M.

description:
On a whim while strolling I decided to try Red Jade for takeout. The vibe is warm and friendly the place is very clean, too. The counterstaff is nice. The food. OMG. Lobster shrimp, curry chicken and brown rice!! I will be ordering their take out and when in the neighborhood would eat in.

Nice to see a Chinese resturant that understands customer service since there is an embarassment of riches in San Francisco good food isn't enough.
author: SF T.

description:
I have been a fan of red jade since FOREVER. Their lunch specials are pretty decent. 

Get the egg and shrimp on the lunch menu. It was seasoned really well.
author: Julia Q.

description: Such a bad place to order food for your delivery. Takes them 2 hrs to deliver my food (this was after the fact that i called repeatedly to remind them) I think they might have forgotten. The food was not that good too, my sweet and sour pork was dry. The owner was rude when I called them. Make sure to get delivery from here. Maybe the food is good if you dine there but Im definitely not making the drive.
author: Cavin T.

description:
Always have been coming here for lunch. I did t bothering reading the rest of the reviews and I've been coming here for years and the quality has always been consistent and the prices are very good. I recommend coming in for lunch which is from 11 to 5. 

My favorite is the lemon chicken but others may not like the sweet and tartness. Overall a great place in the area.
author: Amir M.

description:
30-November, Saturday:
Both the Chow Mien, and 5-Spice Chicken were utterly bland, as I was only able to forced to swallow my disdain because this meal was so depressing and greasy. The flavor profile could be captured simply as: saturated fat, polyunsaturated fat, and mono-saturated fat.

I would not even recommended this to people I disliked.
author: Ty T.

description: Took a business trip to San Fran, which is supposed to be known for awesome Chinese. While I was far too exhausted from traveling to venture through the streets of Chinatown, I thought I'd try delivery from Red Jade. I ordered chicken fried rice and sweet and sour chicken. The food was delivered promptly so that was nice. I opened the containers and noted a side dish that I had not ordered had come with my meal. They were pork buns but the aroma and visual was completely unappealing so I placed them back in the bag. The rice was seasoned very well, but the chicken pieces were indistinguishable. The sweet and sour chicken was basically inedible for the same reason. It's clear that this place does not use high quality meats. Disappointed with my first Chinese food experience in San Francisco. I'll need to venture directly to Chinatown. Take a pass on this place.
author: Andrea B.

description: Geez, how have I never reviewed Red Jade before? We order pretty much every month. Judging it on the "Do we want to eat it over and over?" again scale, I'd say that's five out of five.
author: Laurie N.

description: Food did not have a whole lot of flavor, very generic. I can get better quality Chinese Food at the food court at most airports. Very sad for a city that has such a large and vibrant Chinese community.
author: Maia R.

description:
Dear Red Jade (A love letter),

Hey there Red Jade... You were an unassuming Chinese restaurant conveniently located two blocks from my boyfriend's apartment. I was a hungry lady desperate for some Seamless oriented delivery foods. You never failed me in the last 2 years of service. You were there for us, time and again. When we first ordered your potstickers it was a revelation and is the #1 thing I require of every order. It wasn't like your food was mindblowing, but it has always been fucking solid good Chinese food... that is... until last Friday night.

MIND. FUCKING. BLOWN.

It was the best Red Jade order/delivery ever. It was the best Chinese food of my life. To put things in perspective - I have always lived in the Bay Area. I am a Berkeley native and I know good Chinese food of all levels of quality.

This was the best Chinese food of my life (so far!)

We ordered potstickers (of course), sesame chicken, shrimp fried rice, and princess prawns. As always, it came with 2 complimentary pork buns, sesame balls and fortune cookies. We ate everything together in a big bowl. We could not shut up at eachother about how it was the best order we had placed and everything was done to perfection.

(It probably helps we live 2 blocks away!)

I don't think we'll stray from this order for a long time, and I'm going to be thinking Red Jade every time the BF asks me what to order for delivery...for at least a while.

Forever yours,

Jane
author: Jane H.

description:
Ordered the General Tso's chicken along with the orange beef, and egg rolls.  All tastes like oil from the fryer and were soggy by the time I got them.  

Really wouldn't order from them again
author: F G.

description: You know the feeling when you're really hungry and eat something quick and convenient and then feel like crap for hours after because the food was so awful? That's what happened to us! The food quality was HORRIBLE. We ordered the general chicken which was basically just a lot of chunks of over fried batter and barely any chicken.
author: Batool R.

description:
I remember the days when I ordered from Red Jade and the quality was good.  Last couple of take-out orders have been crap.  No, literally.  Absolute, over fried (ie. burned) crap.  Chow mein was mangy; double checked that I wanted to this word to describe it.  Sauce was burned and thick.  My mini corn cobs looked like innocent victims from the BP oil spill.  I watched my 3 year old take a bit of cabbage and grimace.  Also ordered what they call sesame chicken, but I call fried chicken strips thrown into a takeout container pre-filled with random sauce that was laying close to the fry vat.  My basil chicken was similar to the chow mein.  Lots of mushrooms, bits of chicken & fried strands of basil.  

Bye bye Red Jade... Bye bye.
author: Matt D.

description: It's cheap, plenty of seating, and you get complimentary tea, fortune cookie, and sesame ball. I like the lunch deals here. It comes with the soup du jour, which is usually a sour and spicy or egg drop. Both are delicious. I enjoy the mapo tofu. The general tso's chicken is okay if you like fried meat covered in a mysterious sauce. The spicy eggplant and twice cooked pork is yummy. The lunch specials come with a giant heap of rice. I usually can't finish so it's like 1.5 meals. Food is fast and service is excellent. No frills kind of place.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
The good: Cheap, fast service, minimal additional cost for brown rice. Good place for lunch

The so-so: This place is really mediocre. Many of the dishes seem to come with the same brown sauce and they all taste somewhat the same. I love my chicken tender, but the chicken here is SO tender that it doesn't really taste right. And what's up with baby corns in the food?
author: Demin G.

description: I've always loved this place for the inexpensive and good quality food. I usually order the won ton soup which I like because unlike other Chinese restaurants I've been to its packed with veggies. Unfortunately I'm never ordering from here again because 2 nights ago I ordered combination won ton soup and found 3 bugs floating inside. Now I have a fever which I'm not positive is from the soup, but don't really have any other explanation. I just called the restaurant to inform them about the bugs and they said "uhh okay you have a fever? Go to the doctor then." Soooo since that didn't do anything I decided to write a Yelp review. Time to find a new Chinese delivery.
author: Lu C.

description:
I always order delivery from this place so can't speak in regards to the dine-in experience, but the takeout experience is generally and consistently fantastic!

Their phone number is memorized in my phone that's how often I call this place. I also can recite my order off the top of my head: chicken chow mein, chicken fried rice, potstickers, lemon chicken and sesame chicken.

The delivery is always prompt, and the food is always warm. They also always include free sticky buns and fortune cookies which I love. 

No need to look elsewhere for chinese delivery!
author: Sami F.

description: At first equal to any Chinese restaurant I have been to.     Gracious attentive but not overly so service.  Very tasty General Tso.   V tasty hot and sour soup.   This is my new go to Chinese in SF.   Flawless.  And a tasty plate of yummy complimentary Chinese candies to finish off.   It would be impossible to better this whole experience
author: Chris S.

description: In SF this is good Chinese food that is inexpensive. Parking is bad but who needs to drive in SF. The food is good and you can also get it to go if need be it's right in Castro district, so after eating grate food you can walk around a nice Area of San Francisco.
author: Nuria R.

description: My boyfriend and I love Chinese food. We wanted to try them out. Never again. My boyfriends orange beef wasn't even edible and my lemon chicken wasn't great either. He couldn't even take more than one bite of his food. I called them and let them know that his food was off. The lady berated me and blamed us because we asked for his beef to be spicy.  I let her know that we have ordered his beef spicy from other places before and it was good. She kept blaming us and being rude so I hung up on her. I don't recommend this place at all.
author: Svetlana K.

description: Love this place, I've been walking by for months came in today. The food was well priced, fast, and good. For the price I was a little shock on how much food I got. I would say come here for the lunch special! Also they are very quick!
author: Cory T.

description:
I came here due to Check Please review, where they said it was authentic Chinese.
However when I saw the menu and "Egg Fu Yung" was loudly pronounced, I was really concerned that it aint that authentic.

Had the winter melon pork (AWESOME), but not detailed in the menu.
When I asked where it was and why, they said they had to cater the taste to the locals in Church Street... and that ain't Chinese.  Fortunately that dish was authentic, but people who run the place claimed that there aren't that many authentic Chinese dishes that are not detailed on the menu.

Every item I asked for that are Chinese and would be found on many other Chinese restaurants aren't available (ie. water dumplings..;. specialty of the Mandarin as they claim to be) and many other items... all not available... sigh...

Had their pot stickers, a NON-Event... mediocre at best.
Will try again.  But if they want Chinese in SF to come and frequent, they have got to get more "real".
author: David H.

description: Ordered the cashew chicken with broccoli and the potstickers. The pot stickers were great but the cashew chicken was not good. The sauce it was cooked in had no flavor but the chicken was even worse. It was soft and almost rubbery in a very weird way, I questioned whether it was chicken at one point because I've never had any like that. Wouldn't go back
author: Doug A.

description: Shrimp fried rice is amazing! Tasted super fresh & the shrimp were cooked to perfection.  I'll be returning to this place!
author: Roger A.

description:
I can't comment on service since I tried their food via delivery used Eat24.  Fast service.  Things I got:  the Yang Chow Fried Rice, Mongolian Beef and Kung Pao Shrimp was it was decent Chinese food but was disappointed at  how bland the dishes were.  I got two spicy dishes and asked for medium spicy but it was very mild to me.  I wanted flavor and spice but no kick! Was so disappointed.  Yes I expect Chinese food to be oily but swiming in oil, uug not very appetizing.  I really wanted to like it coz I was so hungry.  And you know how any first bite of anything should leave you satisfied and wanting more, nope I was like really I'm going to have another bite of that.

Props for free pork buns and sesame balls.  But those too were dry and forgetful.  My quest for good chinese delivery goes on!
author: Maria M.

description:
Ughhhh 
I have found my new favorite Chinese takeout place.  
-lemon chicken
-beef chow fun
-FREE PORK BUNS & SESAME BALLS?!?
We used their online ordering system and it was delivered within in 45min.
The Chinese Broccoli with ginger sauce was a bit intense with ginger flavor-I liked it but my boyfriend wasn't into it. 

Hands down-my new go-to for takeout. It helps that everyone I know loves this place as well
author: Mandy F.

description:
Loove. Compared to any other Chinese place, the chicken and beef dishes are effing Fabulous. Pot stickers too. And the sesame ball at the end yay. 
Haters Laters!
author: Styn V.

description:
For a chinese restaurant this place is rather clean. Food is ok.

We ordered 
1. lettuce wraps
2. fried tofu
3. garlic chicken
4. mushu shrimp? or something. Well, it had shrimp
5. sizzling rice soup

My favorite was the soup. It tasted really savory. The other dishes, well, I ate it because i was so damn hungry but all of the stir fried dishes tasted like it had the same sauce on it. I was hoping to have a little variety, or at least for the dishes to have a little more kick to it.
author: Kenson K.

description: Terrible experience. Sesame chicken and orange chicken were terrible - they do orange chicken by providing extremely soggy, tasteless fried chicken and a tub of sauce on the side that has the consistency of coke and tastes like overly sweet candy syrup. Gross! Sesame chicken was flavorless and cold. We called to at least replace the orange chicken order bc its BIZARRE they would serve it that way and with such a low quality. They promptly started yelling and said they could charge us more and send us different food. Yea right! I recommend no customers do business with them just on how they treat their customers alone.
author: Steven M.

description: I come here for dinner once a week for the past two years because it's close to where my gym and apartment.  Just like many other reviewers, this is an above average Chinese restaurant when comes to cleanliness and dine-in service.  The selection consists of what a typical Cantonese style Chinese and I find the dishes I try, all have full flavor.  The price is very reasonable given we live in the city.  I will keep coming back here...
author: Tom V.

description:
3.5 stars is very accurate...

I liked this spot - definitely one of the better options in the Castro area...I had the Cashew Chicken and Fried Pork Ribs along with the Onion Pancakes and all was great...straight-forward Chinese food, but not as greasy as most other spots I've been too.  The ambiance is a bit dated, but you don't come here for an evening out - you come here for Chinese comfort food.
author: Ken G.

description: Met some previous coworkers here last night for dinner. I was a little worried because of the varied Yelp reviews. Pleasantly surprised: Service was good, food was good, price was good. I really liked the pot stickers, lemon chicken and Mu Shu. the Hoisin String beans were nicely done with some onions. And there was a lot of food which was good for this table of 7 sharing. All in all, I'd go back and may do so today for lunch: pot stickers!  ;-)
author: Richard A.

description: I remembered why I'm not a fan that much of Chinese food and this place is a reason why.Why two stars?They do have really great Hot and Sour soup,and they are very fast service wise. Other than that not very friendly,not very appetizing when you do get your food,and very oily.
author: Lauren V.

description: Horrible customer service! I walked out, the waitress at was extremely rude as if I owed her something. No courtesy
author: Talley B.

description: My husband and I had the food delivered to us it came at a good time, but the food wasn't good. At first we thought we should take a couple more bites to see if it  got better but it didn't. We just stopped and threw it away and felt disgusted after. Wouldn't recommend it.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
We got delivery, and it was fast, fresh, and overall pretty good. 

I mean, it's not like "wow real chinese food from the street stalls of China," but it's good for Chinese delivery in a City where kung pao chicken is still the norm for many. And that's totally fine, 

I got the spinach mushroom and chicken soup, and while very simple, it was comforting on a hungover Sunday. I also got the tomato beef chow mein, which was good but I wish there were more pieces of beef. 

The BF got the Mongolian Beef and Yang Chow fried rice. He said it was good, Mongolian Beef with good flavor, and the yang chow fried rice simple. Good for what it is.

So if you want fast simple and alright Chinese food for a hungover Sunday (or any day, I don't judge), this is a good bet. Also they gave us free BBQ steam buns and fried sesame rice balls. nice touch. 

Total $32. Not bad at all.
author: Christina L.

description:
I'm a sucker for general tso's chicken delivery from here when I feel like being naughty and cheating on Gym.  They used to offer delivery lunch specials, but not anymore.  

One time I ordered a lunch special but they actually bought me an a la carte full portion instead.  I didn't have any rice to eat with it, so I call the restaurant.  The lady on the phone did give me somewhat of a hard time, but she ended up having the delivery driver come back with a serving of rice to make up for it.  RESPECT.
author: Clarissa P.

description: Great food at a great price. I I haven't been here for 10 years and used to go to it when I work near the restaurant so I decided to try it again because I was craving Chinese and had it delivered. Not only was the delivery fast the food was excellent at a very reasonable price. I got the Mongolian beef and a chicken fried rice. You get huge portions and everything was delicious. I don't know why I didn't go here more often but I will start going again or at least getting it delivered. The restaurant has been here as long as I've lived in San Francisco since 2002 so that's saying something a restaurant that's been around this long must be good.
author: Mark A.

description:
This is my go to place for Chinese Take Out. 
Standard Chinese Restaurant that's quick, clean, and hits the spot. 
I really enjoy the sizzling rice and seafood soup, BBQ pork fried rice, fried chicken wings, and cream cheese fried dumplings. 
What do you know, everything I like is fried.
I don't recommend the seafood birds nest. 
They don't make a noodle basket like most places, instead it's some sort of dough paper basket. Odd and not fulfilling. 
What really sets this place apart is that with everyone of my take out orders are 2 steam BBQ Pork Buns, Sesame Balls, and Fortune cookies. 
It's like a little dim sum dessert of awesomeness with every meal. 
Most Chinese restaurants are not this generous. 
Check it out!
author: Charlie L.

description: Not worth the money at all. Pot stickers were still pink on the inside so there's $7.00 down the drain, let's be honest I'm not trying to get food poisoning my first time in SF. About 7 pieces of decent pork in the sweet and sour pork, the bottom was soggy with sauce and mushy so another $8.00 gone. My chicken lettuce wrap and crab rangoon were the only decent things we got, but I've had better elsewhere for cheaper. The sad thing was the Parc 55 recommended them to us, saying they have the best Chinese delivery close. They included some free pork buns (they were cold) and some sesame fried desert (also cold), but all our containers were slightly wet from the rain. Even our fortune cookies were rained on and soggy. DEFINITELY wouldn't recommend it.
author: Samantha F.

description: We ordered a variety of items and the best one was mediocre.  Wontons in the soup seemed to have been there for 97 hours, food was tasteless or  it was too spicey with no flavor but spice.  Kung poa shrimp had four shrimp
author: Janet B.

description:
Thank you for the efficiency on your food delivery which is very important to a
Discerning customer. For the extra effort of saying thank you back with free steamed pork buns and the ever so uplifting fortune cookies, I had a perfect Sunday supper!
author: Paulina L.

description:
We, as 2 extremely experienced Asian eater, I am a United States Navy veteran and a kind, friendly, and loving Vietnamese lady, both of us traveled all over Asia, USA, Europe, met a mid-aged male waiter in this restaurant was "most" unpleasant, ignorant, and just extremely rude, and we both were waiters before.  We will never go there again, and below is why!!

1.  A stressful, constantly moving, always chatting quietly away, perhaps with ADHD mid-aged male waiter gave us the bill before we were not even finish the meal, distracted our conversation, derailed our conversation topic, and ruined our appetite.    (hence we chatted and talked about the proper waiter's etiquette - they overheard us)  

2.  My female friend, who is extremely friend, kind, and has a soft spoken words kindly requested for a box for left-over, she asked directly in front of same waiter who gave us the bill as he passed by, completely ignored her with self-righteous pride, ignorant, and hate, more importantly, rolling his eyes away, extremely rude to the point that we both felt distasteful!    I asked "loudly" with force as a younger-waiter came by!  He gave us the box.

The BEST PART is Below!!

3.  Lastly, while we were still chatting away our conversation, trying to ignorant the extremely bad etiquette of that mid-aged waiter.  He was staring at me with the eyes of lion, with negative force, ignorant, and self-righteous.  Made me extremely comfortable to the point I felt i am not safe!  He stared at me like he was going to do something harmful to me and the lady.   He stared at me every chance he could, perhaps 5x plus times, each time i looked at him, he stared me like he was going to swallow me.  I felt extremely uncomfortable, not safe, and felt danger.  

So, I stared him back for more than 10 seconds, with BIGGEST eyes i can stare, and he stared me also, but he backed down!  I make sure he gets my unspoken message!  

I will never go back there again!  All this happened simply because 1 person was in the hurry for no reason by giving us the bill while we were still enjoying our meal!  plenty people still enjoying their meals, and plenty empty seats around, and plenty time perhaps 30 minutes + before close!!!

Distasteful bad etiquette from the waiter, not only he ruined our meal, he also poisoned rest the waiters with his atrocious words, brained-washed rest of the waiters in the restaurant to against us!
author: Hung F.

description:
Pros - House special Eggplant (sweet and savory eggplant served with shrimp and chicken) is the best thing on the menu. You get a fortune cookie and a black bean ball when you get the check.

Cons - Parking is horrible in the area. (Church & Market)

I rarely eat Chinese food, but when i do i prefer Red Jade! Everything on the menu taste pretty good. Although they do not offer a lot of chow mein options. Prices are about standard $9-$11 per entree. Size is pretty big. 1 dish is more than enough for one person. Rice does not come standard with all dishes, unless you get their lunch specials. 


The restaurant looks like a normal Chinese restaurant (clean). I recommend parking at Chase bank down the street after 6PM.
author: Ryan R.

description: Ordered delivery service - no charge for delivery fee and comes with free sesame balls, bbq pork buns and fortune cookies! Hostess who took my order was patient and gave a reliable time estimate (much appreciated given how impatient / rude so many SF eateries are!) Food was hot upon arrival and very affordable for large portions. Definitely will be ordering from here again!
author: Taryn Q.

description: The food seemed really rushed. It was very distasteful and not filling. I have dined in plenty of times but never have I ever had horrible food. It was definitely not worth $30 at all i want a refund forreal
author: Theresa H.

description: It took my husband and I a long time to find a good Chinese food place that delivers.   We continuously order from red jade. Nothing fancy,  but consistently good.   If you are craving Chinese,  this is the place.   I've never been disappointed with the food.
author: mindy r.

description:
I ordered a pick up. That's the worse Chinese food that I have ever had. I swear!!!! Chow main was burned Chicken carry just didn't have a taste . Really??how 
This restaurant is still open ??!!
Just a big mistake. I'm sorry get a new chef cuz this one is sucks.
author: Carmit D.

description: If you eat Chinese food because of the quintessential saltiness and over-breaded, sugar-soaked chicken, then look no further. If you don't enjoy tasting natural flavors of food, you've come to the right place. Bites of sesame chicken are 1/5 meat, 4/5 goo saturated batter. After my mu shu pork, I'll be lucky if my finger doesn't amputate past my engagement ring.
author: Jessica D.

description:
3.5 Stars but I'll round up for free food! Ordered delivery through Eat24 and I was semi-pleasantly surprised. Quoted time was 45-60min and they were definitely within that window. Driver was friendly enough and they packed up forks/chopsticks/napkins/etc.

WHAT WE ORDERED:
~Fried Crab Meat Rangoon (6pcs for $6.25): For the love of god I do not know why this has a "what's good" mark on Eat24. I've never had rangoons, but my coworker ordered this for her appetizer. It tasted like cream cheese and green onion in a fried wonton skin. Granted it was tasty with the sweet and sour dipping sauce, however for being called CRAB MEAT rangoon there was ZERO crab meat except for flecks of red which is assumed was artificial crab meat. Call it deep fried cream cheese & green onion rangoon and you got yourself a winner! Crab meat rangoon-- complete and utter fail. However, I blame the people of Eat24 who gave this a "what's good" ranking. (2/5)

~Mango Special with Chicken ($9.95): For being a "Special" there was nothing special about it. First time having cooked hot mango in a dish, and I'm not sure how I feel about it. Again this was a coworker's choice.(2/5)

~Green Onion Pancake ($5.25): Yum. A bit dense, a bit greasy, but still very tasty. (4/5)

~Tomato Beef Chow Mein ($7.25): OH. MY. GOD. A place that does a good tomato beef chow mein AND lists it on the menu?! I frequently order this with my family when we want chinese take out on the weekends for lunch, and our usual go-to is inconsistent. (We noticed they make it better on the weekdays--must be different chefs) I digress. ANYWAYS, I was pleasantly surprised how well this turned out. (5/5)

~Sesame Balls (Free with order over $15): They gave us 3. Taste better eating them fresh rather than hours later. Nothing special, but it's free!

~Steamed BBQ pork buns: This was a pleasant surprise! We knew we would get the free sesame balls, but the buns were an added bonus! Standard steamed cha siu bao.

Definitely would order the tomato beef chow mein again to see if they are consistently good.
author: Jenna H.

description:
So one of my coworkers asked me if I wanted to order lunch from Red Jade Restaurant. I never heard of the place, but I was willing to try it out. Of course I decided to Yelp it, so it seemed to me that they were well known for their Onion Pancakes. They had $5.00 lunch specials, which was cheap but I didn't feel like eating rice.

When I got my order, my coworker gave me Hot & Sour soup, my huge Onion pancake and a sesame ball. The results? Disappointed =(  The soup was okay but a little too tart for me, onion pancake was too greasy but I did eat 3 pieces of it and my tummy was feeling sick, my sesame ball was A-OK. I won't be ordering from there anymore.
author: Kathy V.

description: We love Red Jade! It is our local spot and we go almost weekly.
author: Chad S.

description:
Service: Pretty decent - friendly & attentive waiters w/o being too pushy or standoff ish.
Food: Mediocre at best. The green onion pancake was waaay too thick, so the center was chewy and uncooked. Mongolian beef was heavily sauced, but otherwise tender and flavorful. The Chinese broccoli was very fresh and tasty. They forgot to pack the ginger sauce I asked for (the ginger sauce actually tasted more like a peanut sauce).
Price: 4 items (above 3 + steamed rice) came out to be $27. A bit more than what I had expected. 
I keep forgetting how disappointing Chinese food places are in the city. :-(
author: Camie K.

description:
This was my first time ordering delivery (that wasn't a pizza) in my entire life AND this was the first time since I moved to SF 2 years go I've had ANYTHING delivered (including pizza) so this was kind of a big moment for me. I was a little nervous... what first timer isn't?!

Delivery guy was nice, food was hot. 

My BFs mongolian beef was a solid 3 stars- it definitely needed more spice, though.

My garlic chicken was so spicy and really pretty good- minus the MSG attack I'm having today and the fact it had baby corn. Look everyone, baby corn is not a vegetable. Its just not.
author: Emily D.

description:
I have been coming here for years. Since it has opened the food has always been consistently delicious! The staff is very nice and the restaurant is always very clean. 

My family and I have ordered almost everything on the menu, everything has always been delicious!
author: Sandra R.

description: This place is excellent the dude who was waiting to get served water was a cheap assed dude you get very generous portions and the price is right chow fun is great so is their pan fried chicken chow main everything is excellent we come all the way from Oakland to eat here service is wonderful and to the dude who was tripping off of not being served water go eat at Panda Express! I hate cheap people like that! Thanks for the great food!
author: Jeff F.

description:
After seeing this restaurant on KQED's Check Please show, I bookmarked it. I waited and waited for months before I stopped by because I have so many bookmarked restaurants and it takes awhile to go try all of them. Anyways, I finally made the trek over to Red Jade and as soon as my friend and I were seated, the table was already full of tea, plates, silverware, ice water, condiments and a cloth napkin. 

The staff told us, when we are ready to order, just let them know. Oh boy, their menu was huge! It took us awhile to figure out what we wanted because everything sounded so good. We finally settled on lemon chicken, sweet and sour pork and the famous green onion pancake. The lemon chicken was huge! It was perfectly fried and has a great thick lemon sauce on it. It was full of real chicken unlike other Chinese restaurants I have been to where it is just fried dough.

The sweet and sour pork was similar, fried pork and doused with sweet and sour sauce. You can't go wrong with anything fried right? We didn't realize we had ordered all the fried stuff till we realized we had no veggies. Oh wells, everything was good so was the fried green onion pancake which was heavenly. It comes with a peanut sauce which you can dip or spoon onto your pancake. The restaurant was very spotless and I enjoyed getting sesame balls and fortune cookies at the end. I would definitely come back to the restaurant because for 2 dishes and 1 appetizer for less than $22, that is a steal!
author: Danster L.

description:
Specify that you want Chinese broccoli not American. Always order the potstickers - after 20 years these have not changed. What Chinese restaurant can you say that about?
They do a good job of beef dishes and stir fries. Its best to come in to dine for the afternoon lunch special. This place is always busy with locals and the kitchen chef and team perform consistently. 
My personal favorite is the shrimp with Jade Greens.
author: Nan L.

description:
Just got DELIVERY from Red Jade for the first time.  Once again, these guys ROCK!  Honestly, this is how a Chinese restaurant is supposed to be.  If other Chinese restaurants COPIED THESE GUYS our city would be a better place.

1) Delivery in 20 minutes!!!  Are you kidding?  Unbelievable, but true.  I must've caught them at the perfect time.  Amazing, when you think about it.  He even told me on the phone "40 minutes", so I was SHOCKED when I heard the doorbell ring.  

2) Delivery dude was friendly, personable, spoke English just fine.  Not in a hurry to leave, told me to "Enjoy my meal!".  Why can't more delivery guys be like this?

3) FREE STEAMED PORK BUNS!!  Didn't have to ask for them, didn't have present a coupon, they just showed up with the order.  Nice.  Thank you.

4) Chinese Broccoli with Ginger Sauce.  Man, you can actually feel REALLY GOOD about eating this.  Super healthy.  Clean, light, not dripping in cornstarch sauce.  Thumbs up.

No wonder this place has been around for at least 20 years.  They KNOW WHAT THEY'RE DOING!  Props!!
author: FoodDudeS F.

description: Two words for you: $2.25 Pork Chow Fun.  Not at all 2 words.  They do a really good job of cheap Chinese food.
author: Scott R.

description:
First time experience.

My girlfriend and I were shopping around the Castro area, and we were on the verge of going nuts wanting something to eat. We were pacing around undecided not knowing what we wanted. After many attempts at coming to a conclusion, we went inside the Red Jade really craving Chinese food.
For a Wednesday night, they were very busy.
Since it was busy, it took a little longer to get our water and to be served.
Our waiter was a little standoffish and cold.

Since it was a little chilly outside, I had decided to try their hot and sour soup.
The soup was good and hit the spot. It had the right amount of flavor and warmth that I was looking for.
Despite it being busy, our food came out in a timely manner.
My girlfriend chose to have the sweet & sour chicken.
I wanted some a little spicy so I went with the General Tso's Spicy Boneless Chicken.

The food was good but nothing spectacular. 
I guess the whole experience just left us lukewarm.
We seem much happier and more satisfied at  Castro Brandy Ho's.

Red Jade does have a nice location with it being close by to several cool places like Sweet Inspirations and Aardvark Books.

Restaurants can't be for everybody.
This one isn't for us, but maybe it will be for you.
author: John S.

description: I don't like Chinese food regarding being asian but this place is an exception. After eating Chinese foods at other places it leaves me feeling with the greasiness but here it's just fresh and good. I also love the lunch special because it's affordable and it goes on for a very long time. I used to go here at least one to twice a week when I had time and I miss going here. This is the only place I look for when wanting Chinese food no matter where I'm at.
author: Sul L.

description: Red Jade serves first-rate Mandarin and Cantonese style Chinese food. The service is quick and the price is right. We are fans of the Wor Wonton soup, the hot and sour soup, the hot spicy green beans and pork, the hunan fish, salmon and asparagus in black bean sauce, and many others. You really can't go wrong here.
author: David K.

description:
So "food quality" gets 3 stars (A-okay) but overall bang for your buck brings it up to 4 stars.

for the lunch special: I got soup, a pot of tea, General tso's chicken (with brown rice for a $0.25 up charge), a fortune cookie and a GREAT sesame ball.  Total: including tax AND tip $7.50.  

You cannot beat that with a stick.  

I do question how the food comes out about 2 minutes after you order it (pre-made?) AND the ratio of breading to chicken was higher than I would like.  Still though, that is a lot of food in a clean place with nice (and fast) servers. 4 solid stars.

I wanna get that scallion pancake!
author: Amy W.

description: Great Chinese food for eating in. It's definitely been our go to for delivery. Nothing too special about it but have found it's not easy finding decent Chinese food in SF and this place has been good.
author: Shaun M.

description: This place is great! Well, in terms of the quality of food for the buck! NOT the "greatest" place for the ultimate Customer Service experience, LOL! But if you're looking for a half-decent or even better quality meal for a reasonable price, then this is definitely a GO!
author: Joe M.

description:
Took an hour 15 min for delivery... Not surprisingly arrived cold. Order was also inaccurate: no potstickers as requested, but instead a really disappointing surprise deep fried "crab" salad item. Terrible. 

Would only refund the pot stickers, no show of good will or sympathy for arriving late and cold.

Better options in the city exist.
author: Anne M.

description:
Ordered:

Fire House Spicy String Beans with Minced Pork - so minced I didn't see them but the string beans were very good.

Chicken Chow Fun with Black Bean Sauce - normally my favorite dish at Chinese places but will never order this again here.  Noodles were all slimy.

Pot Stickers - only order if you like them soft.  Not crispy whatsoever.

Green Onion Pancake - very good

Sesame Ball - very good

Overall, will never order from again as the city has too many better Chinese restaurants.
author: Angela D.

description:
Our usual standby Wonderland, was running crazy wait times due to the rainy Sunday, so we decided to give Red Jade a shot. We made a HUGE mistake. We ordered three relatively simple items, Sizzling Rice Soup (w/ Chicken),  Beef & Broccoli, and Mu Shu Pork. They added free Pork Buns (not very good) and free sesame balls (decent) to the order, a nice touch, but not enough to raise them above the minimum 1 star.

Sizzling Rice Soup - this was the most edible of the three items, although the chicken was anything but white meat, however the broth, veggies and rice were good.

Mu Shu Pork - this was decent, however the pancakes were basically tortillas, not at all proper mu shu pancakes.

Beef & Broccoli - this is what truly inspired me to write this review. It was awful, mushy overcooked broccoli that tasted like it had been sitting cooked for hours, and flavorless beef. 

The whole meal left us feeling terrible and very unsatisfied, save yourself the stomach ache and order from somewhere else.
author: T B.

description: This is an addition to my review from last fall. I just ordered their Ma-Po Bean Curd and it is something so unusual and flavorful.  Ten times better than the usual offering of this dish at other restaurants.  The tiny slices of pork with perfectly-shaped tofu squares in a sauce that has a hint of hot and it is not gummy like so many are at other places. Fantastic.  My wonderful hubby ordered the spicy green beans and THAT dish was a revelation.  Those chefs really know how to cook--I would love to watch them perform their magic, but I am afraid of cleavers and knives!  Again, as I mentioned in my previous review, the little "appetizer" dish is fresh and really sweetly presented at the table if you just can't decide.
author: Elle W.

description: A forensic of mine who comes from a family that owns a Chinese restaurant in Queens turned me on to this place. Best green onion pancakes in SF. Soft shell crab is also excellent. Fast delivery too!
author: Dennis M.

description:
Not impressed at all.
