Was here last week with 2 friends for dinner. We had not been here and they picked this place. Service was quick. But that is about it.

Food wise: greasy with oil, heavy with starch. The spinach veggie dish was bland and the spinach was old and chewy.

Will not ever come here again. NOT recommended.
author: Mango M.

description: Loved the Kung Pao and the Chicken and Broccoli with cashews! The Crab Rangoon was great too! Very fast delivery! The only thing I thought was strange was that you had to order rice because it doesn't automatically come with your order. Overall, would recommend to anyone wanting to try good Chinese food in San Francisco, CA.
author: Patricia T.

description:
The delivery service was very quick and the complimentary pork buns were great. The egg rolls were fresh and warm and are worth ordering.

The downside of this food experience was the other half of my order. We had orange chicken and the broccoli bok choi beef. The orange chicken smelled of seafood like it was deep fried in the same oil. I'm not a big seafood fan and I couldn't eat it. The orange sauce comes on the side and was very sweet and thin. I would avoid ordering the dish. The meat in the beef dish was chewy and tough, but the vegetables and sauce were good.
author: Charlie C.

description:
Excellent Customer Service and on time delivery.  Awful food.  

This evening my daughter and I finally got around to giving Red Jade a try after seeing it favorably show cased on Check Please Bay Area.   I can't for the life of me figure out the disparity between the positive responses on that show, numerous rave Yelp reviews and what was delivered this evening.  My food was edible but I'm not keeping the leftovers for tomorrow's lunch.  And, there are a lot of leftovers.  All three of the dishes ordered were almost identical in taste.

*Jumbo Prawns in a Spicy Szechuan Sauce - although the menu stated "spicy" there was no spice, no heat.  

*House Eggplant with Shrimp, chicken, fresh basil, and chili peppers - barely edible, and again, no flavor.

*String Bean Chicken - Edible and tasted like the other two dishes.

Positive note: They sent a couple of complimentary pork buns with the order, which was rather nice.

There are far better Chinese restaurants in the city.
author: Donna P.

description:
Would not recommend this place, there's much better food in this City.

Adding a star for the service as it was prompt and good, so was the speed of our orders arriving at our table even though it was a Friday night and looking at the 12+ plastic bags of to go orders waiting for delivery on their counter they were busy if not in the restaurant, which was fairly empty.

1. Green Onion Pancakes. Do you like greasy bland dough with Sweet Peanut Butter? Order these. 

2. Seafood Chow Fun. My friend ordered the Chow Fun with Gravy not on the side. Found this nearly inedible. Love Chow Fun, this is the worst example that I've ever had, also the seafood content is a joke, possibly 3 of the tiniest shrimp(nickle sized) in the whole order, slight presence of Calimari and scraps of scallops. Way to greasy.

3. Golden Calimari Wok Fried with Spicy Garlic Salt. Was expecting something different, Calimari was cooked well, but breaded. Although marked as spicy it had no heat, the Garlic Salt most likely had flavor enhancers.

Left with an upset stomach and deep regret, that a friend brought me here. This place has good service, and is clean but can think of at least 50 different food options more enjoyable for less money.

This review would be one star but the service was fine.
author: Crispin M.

description:
This review is for their delivery service and catering only. 

Every time my boyfriend and I feel like ordering in Chinese food, Red Jade is the only option we'll consider. Ordering online is incredibly easy, and the deliveries are usually prompt. They always throw in free sesame buns or pork buns, which is much appreciated!

As for the catering, I can't say enough good things about them. I had a party of 20 people to feed, so I called in Red Jade stating specifically what my budget was and how many people I needed to feed. The lady asked to call me back to prepare my order, and within 15 minutes, she called back with an order that fit my needs perfectly. I came to pick up my order the next day, and their servers graciously helped me move everything to my car. And once again, an entire dish was thrown in for free!

Sure, the food isn't amazing, but for cheap Chinese food and amazing service, this is the place to go.
author: Leslie S.

description: Consistent, reasonably priced and good.  Always have lunch special- served with soup, steamed rice and something... Today was chicken basil- one day I'll crack the code on this menu.  Also had pot stickers which are very good. This place is just great deal for lunch.
author: R G.

description:
We had the House Chicken and the Szechuan Pork .  Both were ok--the chicken was a little tough from being overcooked although the flavor was pretty good.  The pork dish was ok too--nothing to really rave about though.
Service was very attentive--almost to the point of being overly attentive. I think we had the entire waitstaff visit our table at one time or another.  (6 people)
author: Thomas D.

description:
I never thought I would do this, but I have write a bad review for Red Jade Restaurant.  While the staff was courteous and friendly enough, I write a bad review because I got FOOD POISONING!  I believe it was from the chicken as it had a fishy taste to it.  Cleary it was spoiled.  I didn't think to spit it out during chewing because at the time  I thought it was actually fish.  (It was pointed out  to me later by my friend that there was no fish in the dish).

I hope the manager reads this because I think they need to work on keeping their food fresh to prevent serving chicken with salmonella.  I'm rather pissed off about it because in this day and age restaurants really need to be more concerned about their quality control.

Alas, I will not be returning to eat here.  NOT RECOMMENDED!
author: Sahad P.

description: What a great place delivery.  Extra's are fantastic and everything we've ordered has been fantastic.  Looking forward to my next order.
author: Jason M.

description: I usually love just about all chinese food but I took a few bites of each of my items and threw them both out.  Got the general chicken lunch special, extremely bland.  The chow mein had no flavor either.  They also forgot to deliver my soda.  Extremely disappointed, not sure how anyone rated this place 5 stars tbh.
author: mike w.

description:
I love me some good delivery Chinese food.  This place delivers for free, and quickly.  Took about 25 minutes from order to food-in-mouth.  Gotta love that I can order this on the Eat24 app, the ultimate tool in lazy ordering for fat Chinese movie nights with m'lady.  The wonton soup order is 2 giant containers, definitely enough for leftovers.

My favorites are: Mongolian Beef and Mushu Pork
author: Justin F.

description:
I now take this back.  After having used these guys for several years now, we recently had a really bad experience with the way we were treated by their staff.

Having ordered food for delivery, our chicken & broccoli came with just broccoli.  I rang to see if there had been a mistake and was instantly yelled at by the woman on the phone.  I asked here why she was yelling at me and could she simply speak to me several times, which seemed to make her annoyed.  That, and the fact that she barely stopped talking herself to let me speak when she asked a questions, got me really annoyed.

They offered to send something straight away or give credit for next time.  When I replied that based on the way I was currently being spoken to I wasn't sure if I would order there again, this seemed to infuriate and confuse here more.  She just kept asking me if I wanted to them to deliver it now or get a credit.  I said several times that I did not want to wait (I am 8 months pregnant and hungry - so just wanted to eat what we had by that time) and that I would not be ordering again given the customer service experienced.  

As she continued to yell at me on the phone, I just decided to hang up because there was no talking to the woman on the phone.  Two minutes later they rang back and I let it go to voice mail.  This time someone else placed the call wanting to know if I wanted the incorrect item to be redelivered.  Clearly the amount of times I said "No, I don't want to have you deliver it again" didn't get through the sound of the woman on the phone yelling at me.  

Disappointing to say the least, as we really liked their food, but am moving on to new horizons where I don't get yelled at for checking on an incorrect order that was not my fault.
author: Danae R.

description: Great food and great service to be honest really fast service it only took them like 5 minutes to bring my food out and I was on a 30 mins lunch I still had 15 mins to spare after I was done and their lunch especial is good too some really cheap prices for great food :)
author: Prerna V.

description:
Standard Mandarin Food in the Castro. The  restaurant is clean and the decor  is Chinese inspired.  The waitstaff is fast and efficient.

Free Pot of hot tea!
Pot Stickers- delicious ginger pork filling in standard a pot sticker 
Seaweed Salad- standard Seaweed salad.  May not be authentic, but it is tasty.
Original Dry Fried Chicken- fried chicken thighs that have been coated in a spicy red pepper sauce.  Not what I expected, but I liked it!
Fire House Spicy String Beans with Minced Pork-huge sting beans sauteed in red pepper and pork.  
Vegetarian Delight- Standard steamed and sauteed vegetable mix.  Good to get your daily serving of mixed vegetables.

The check came with fortune cookies and red bean sesame buns.  I love red bean buns!  And I love sesame buns!  I double love the  red bean sesame buns!!!

Enough food to feed 4 or 5 and I left with boxes of left overs for about $50.  I will be coming back for takeout!
author: Nicole R.

description:
General Tso's chicken and combination fried rice put me to sleep. They claim that their food is MSG free but my headache and thirst would tell me different.

Beside that point the combination fried rice was tasty but the chicken a bit bland. This is my first pass at Red Jade, so I'll try it again to explore the menu. Their service was great and fast - they had my food in 5 mins.

3.5 stars
author: Michael G.

description: It was ok.. We ordered vegetarian spring rolls, broccoli with garlic sauce, foo young vegetarian and vegetable delight. A friend had the lemon chicken. Service was quick and efficient. Came with free soup, tea and sesame balls for dessert with fortune cookies. Food was affordable, but nothing great. As others have mentioned, seemed to have the same brown sauce for everything! Doubt if i would visit again.
author: Sara V.

description:
This place is worth 3.5 stars..it was not delicious, but it was on the decent side as far as Chinese food I have had in the city so far. I worked at a Chinese restaurant in college so my expectations are also high :)

We ordered:
Wonton soup - 2.5 stars. It was spicy, which I love, but I didn't prefer the flavor. Not bad, but not great either

Vegetable Spring Roll - 2 stars. The flavor was a bit off for me here as well. They also had an underlying sweet taste which I didn't really enjoy

Sesame Chicken - 4 stars Really good. I wish that the chicken pieces had more...chicken, but the flavor was great

Szechuan Shrimp - 4 stars great flavor and great sauce and not oily at all. I enjoyed it!

We received two free dumplings which were sweeter, which I don't like but they weren't bad! They also gave us some sesame balls which were good. 

All in All, the delivery was speedy, delivery guy was nice, just not my first choice!
author: Jazmyn W.

description: This place is crazy good. Everything is so flavorful! I love it! Definitely recommend to other visitors. Try the Generals chicken!
author: Andres R.

description:
Totally and completely unacceptable!!! AGAIN over an hour and 1/2 for deliver on a freaking Wednesday night!
I told the girl answering that she better tell the owner to read these reviews or they may not be in business in the next year. I am an understanding person that believes in second chances but they BLEW it. 
Absolutely do not order or eat here ever! You will be sorry. Don't believe the freak good reviews. You will be consistently disappointed. No amount of free food make up for bad service. 

Dine at your own risk!
author: Eden F.

description:
This has become one of my regular lunch stops. It's a little bit outta the way for me, but totally worth the drive when I get that rare extendo lunch.

I visited one time for dinner and the ambience is fairly upscale for a Chinese place. It's a nice change of pace from your typical fast food type place. I really only eat one thing off of the menu, Kung Pao tofu 'cuz it's so good and there really isn't anything better vegan-wise. I'm sure they'd be willing to veganize other items but it's not worth it unless I was gonna eat in again. The Kung Pao is good enough for a tasty lunch.  The lunch special price is pretty good with rice and all included. The spring rolls are really good too, with just the right amount of peppery bite.

I'll be eating here again soon!
author: John B.

description:
The food is here not that bad, I tend to get the fried rice for my Chinese delivery. So!

Delivery: good timing less than an hour
Food: Not the worst quality but not the most delicious.

The scrambled egg with chicken is the weird because they give big old hunks of chicken. 

Extra stuff: They gave me napkins, utensils, fortune cookies (the fortunes suck), and sesame balls. Not bad
author: Rohan D.

description:
Heard about this place a while back on a tv show and decided to check it out a couple weeks ago.  ordered the chicken wings, fried rice and seafood panfried noodles.  the food was good although i wish there had been more chicken wings on the plate and a little bit more seafood and vegetables in the panfried noodles.  A nice touch was the dessert not only came with fortune cookies, but  also seasame balls which were absoutely delicious.  They were warm and gooey, sweet and chewy with a very nice texture.

The service was good.
author: Amy L.

description:
This has become our go-to restaurant whenever we're craving Chinese food. It's nothing fancy, but it's clean and service is decent. They don't use MSG and the food isn't super greasy. I recommend the lunch specials which includes a cup of soup, rice, and an entree for less than $7. Good portions for the price you pay.

We usually stick with the General Tso's Chicken, Hot & Sour Soup, sometimes the Combo Wor Wonton Soup, and the Hong Kong Style Noodles. Tried a couple other dishes, but these never disappoint.
author: Zell C.

description:
The delivery was easy, prompt, and pleasant, which is more than I can say for many delivery options I've dealt with. And they threw in a bunch of free stuff, as is routinely mentioned - the two big bbq pork buns and some sesame balls. But the food was just ok. 

Part of the problem was that we order the lemon chicken, which was fried. By the time it got to us, it was lukewarm and starting to get soggy. The string beans and bean curd faired a lot better, although I found the dish to be on the bland side. We probably enjoyed the appetizer combination the best - a hearty assortment of 2 each of chicken wings, potstickers, egg rolls, and crab rangoon. They were all pretty tasty.

I wouldn't rule it out for delivery again, but we'll probably continue our quest for Decent Chinese Delivery.
author: Lisa K.

description: Solid. Generally a take out choice. Dined in for the first time recently. Really good food. Reasonable prices. Attentive service. Decent ambiance. Good for a modest, reliable not-meant-to-impress-your-date dinner experience. Will continue to get their take out and go again for dining.
author: Scott C.

description:
24 of May 2014. We were there for diner. We ordered  -sweet and sour pork, ( there was no pork, the majority of the dish was all more batter then pork, they were small pieces of pork over battered, fried and hard.
Chicken fired rice - they are using the short grain, cheaper rice, sorry, but you do not use short grain rice to prepare a chicken fried rice, wrong, very cheap. 
Ordered green beers - some of the green beers were rotten.  Bad and nasty flavor. No wondering this place got an 87 on they it health score card. I woke up

this morning with a terrible headache, maybe they are still using MSG? We'll, 
I won't go back to this place.
author: Joe V.

description:
Oily onion pancakes.   Uncooked pork in the pot stickers.  And the list goes on.
I have eaten here several times. I keep giving it a chance. I will not take another chance.  I opened the fortune cookie. Lottery number on one side, saying on the other.  Old Chinese proverb. If it's not good food, don't eat there. Stick foot in mouth is better.
 However,  the service was great.
author: P G.

description:
Delivery. We had not ordered from Red Jade for a few years since their last really excellent chef left a few years ago. I picked up some soup and potstickers a while back and they were excellent. Potstickers gingery and herbacious. 
Ordered  last night craving dim sum after watching a Wayne Wang movie and these guys knocked it out of the park.Great char siu bao! The flavors were right on. Vey happy with red Jade!!
author: Edward C.

description:
Went back again tonight, WHOOO HOOO!!!! 

Food is the best folks, you can't go wrong here. My tummy is full of yummy.

THANKS AGAIN RED JADE!!!!
author: Bobby J.

description:
Have never dined-in at the restaurant,  but it's easily the best Chinese food delivery I've had in the city. 

My favorites are the sesame chicken, the green onion pancake, and the chow fun with black bean sauce. The only thing that hasn't been too impressive is the chow mein. 

They're pretty good about substitutions if you call and order over the phone, plus any order over $20 comes with free pork buns and sesame buns. Free delivery and they seem to delivery to a pretty large area, which is a big plus. 

For the sake of my own health, I'm sure I shouldn't order from here as often as I do, but it's just so consistently good and easy, I can't help myself.
author: Will A.

description: The food is good, I eat here regularly. But I mostly get the food delivered. The service in the restaurant is atrocious. They rush the hell out of you and only come by to drop off food or the check.
author: Tyler B.

description: I'm a San Franciscan so it's obvious that I am a #foodie. I've been coming here for years and would never base my reveiw on one visit. I love it and haven't had a bad experience yet... (Delivery also a plus)
author: Michael P.

description:
Im a city full of Chinese restaurants  this one is definite MEH.  Food was just OK. 

I called in an order and was told it would be ready for pickup in 10 minutes.  I arrived 20 mins later and it wasnt ready.  It took another 10 minutes! 

Service was decent enough other wise but come on folks - you gotta be a little more accurate in these days of Yelp!

ThumbsUP - nothing really.. i mean why should I come back?  Nothing stand out here.

ThumbDOWN - WTF is up with Chinese restaurants LYING about completion times?  You may satisfy my in the short term but I wont be back
author: Jeff C.

description: I've never even eaten here and I'll tell you why: I made a reservation and had to cancel it. I called to cancel and the lady HUNG UP ON ME. Then when I called back, thinking we got disconnected, she screamed, "YA I GOT IT OK?!?!" Seriously? I wasn't being rude in the SLIGHTEST, I genuinely thought we got disconnected. If you hate your job so much, then quit. And make yourself and probably everyone else that has to deal with your unprovoked attitude much much happier. She has single-handedly insured that I will never eat here, reservation or not.
author: Chris R.

description:
Just  ordered  delivery after i saw this  place  on  check please.  onion pancake was great as well as hot and sour soup.   orange beef was  good but not amazing.  delivery was fast and efficient  and i got two free items.  All food was fresh.  Will come back again.

Food 4 stars
Service/Delivery  5  Stars
Value  5 Stars
Decor in Actual  Restaurant 3 Stars
author: Christopher T.

description:
I used to live in the area, and my roommate frequently ordered delivery from this establishment. I wasn't really a fan but had a good amount of their food. Not the best, but decent for delivery options in the area.

I've tried...

Tofu & Mixed Vegetables
Beef & Broccoli 
Garlic Sauteed Pea Sprouts 
Garlic Sauteed Chinese Broccoli 
Shrimp & Mixed Vegetables

Everything lacks in flavor.

Prices are standard.

Portions are generous.

Delivery is prompt.
author: Natasha S.

description:
I really don't love this restaurant, but I know I'm in the minority.  I have now eaten here 4 times as I keep hoping I'll like it better the next time....

No.  Doesn't happen.  Every time the waitstaff is marginally ok,  the decor is ok, and there are things on the menu I think I'll be happy eating.  Every time I get unidentifiable meat bits that don't taste like the kind of meat they are representing.  So then I start imagining not good things and have to stop eating.  Husband, who is even thriftier than I (Ok, he's the Ruler of Cheap) really really really wants us to like this place because it's close to home, and cheap....

But he can't do it either.  Same issue (Ruler of Cheap:  "Uhm, I ordered lamb...I dont think this tastes like lamb.  I'm not sure what it is...Did you drink my water?  Well, I need water.  It tasted like water, right?  Ok, let's go.")

If I ever go again, I'm going to order vegetarian.  Maybe that's been my problem the whole time.
author: El B.

description:
On a lazy Saturday morning, a group of my friends agreed to make our get-together a foodie doubleheader.  The first stop was the seafood house around the corner for their famed lobster roll.  This was the second and final stop.  We all watdched the Check Please Bay Area episode that featured this restaurant.  Clean, nicely decorated, and having a laid back vibe, we combined several tables for our party.  Following the episodes recommendations, we ordered the following:
a) Pot stickers - They looked great with crispy skins, but the flavor was just okay.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0w6dNMrpBQFLxhVYqx_J5Q?select=3wNiPOX1pN0Q5DGXG2KfSA)
b) Green Onion Pancake - Served with two dipping sauces (peanut and sweet/sour), the pancakes also were browned well and the flavor was good; however, it wasa bit thick and doughy.  Not bad and not quite "the Bomb" as it was described on the show.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0w6dNMrpBQFLxhVYqx_J5Q?select=poDaMgtJYUUJ9SfgXIHLQw)
c) Fried Chicken Wings appetizer - Your basic salt/pepper flavored fried wings.  I probably misordered as I expected the San Tung style wings that Euge mentioned.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0w6dNMrpBQFLxhVYqx_J5Q?select=5RUSLrPKzGwbohnSCRu5pA)
d) Chicken and Black Bean Sauce Chow Fun - This was probably my favorite dish as the flavors were good and a good portion of tender chicken pieces, green peppers, and onions in a mild black bean sauce.  The portions were very generous.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0w6dNMrpBQFLxhVYqx_J5Q?select=dpBX0uAyDrIoq-Cu5mProA)
We came here with open minds and the restaurant did not disappoint.  Service was very good as they explained the various dipping sauces and even entertained my friend's baby girl as we ate.  However, the food was okay and the portions were pretty generous; they also provide sesame balls and fortune cookies as complimentary desserts.  Good spot to dine if you're craving Chinese food or the lines at Woodhouse or Chow are too long.
author: Mike C.

description: delivery is horribly inconsistent... sitting here wondering if it'll ever show.... 40+ mins later and I'm done - will cancel this order -they can eat their cold delivery !
author: C S.

description: 3 1/2 stars.  Pretty decent stuff!  They do awesome Kung Pao Chicken.  I also like the Eggplant Tofu.  I tried their General Tso's Chicken the other day and was impressed.
author: Lawree S.

description:
Got delivery for seven people... not a single person was disappointed with the food.

I think that's pretty commendable.
author: Stephanie F.

description: We ordered delivery and it was great! We had the orange chicken, kung pao chicken, crispy chicken, and vegetable chow mein. They all had good flavor and weren't super greasy or too drenched in sauce. We probably would not order the crispy chicken again because it wasn't actually crispy.
author: Amy L.

description: Szechuan fish....extra hot. Huge portion on the lunch special and delicious. Took what I could not finish home and it provided 2 more meals!
author: Bleep S.

description:
I've only ordered take-out so my review doesn't really cater to the dine-in experience.

The food is mediocre at best. I wouldn't say it's bland, but usually seems too saucy or greasy.

I also find it strange that they give you sesame ball that isn't covered or anything. It's like they just throw it in the take-out bag and when you finally find it, it looks like it was in there by accident.
author: Andrew D.

description: WOW, best Chinese take out I've gotten in SF. Their food is fantastic - got the Mongolian lamb, which was amazing. They also gave me free pork buns AND sesame balls. I was actually going to throw away the sesame balls because I didn't know what it was - then I took a bite out of it ...and boy, am I glad I did. Maybe my new favorite Asian dessert - basically a hollow doughnut hole with filling covered in sesame seeds. This will definitely be my new go to for Asian take out!
author: Christine J.

description: This place has some of the best Chinese food in SF. But honestly, I could eat a WHOLE MEAL of their onion pancakes. Seriously. I've gotten great service on both eat in and take out. Reasonably priced.
author: Cat U.

description:
Always has been a great go to restaurant. I find myself being mindful of the past when I eat here. And that's a good thing 8).
Oh but I miss the Hawaiian shirts
author: Ricky B.

description:
Every Chinese restaurant has a particular style and flavor to each dish.  This place is unique in the style of sauces used in their dishes.  It's okay to ask for lighter sauce, foods not so spicy, and to reiterate the old mantra, no MSG.  Some of the favorite standards are the salt & pepper pork, walnut shrimp, broccoli beef, and yee won-ton.  

The wait staff is very efficient, helpful, polite and the place is clean (ever eat lunch in a Chinese restaurant in Chinatown?). They work hard in making sure you have plenty of everything including tea.  My non-chopstick using friends appreciate the forks on the table without asking for them.

The favorite part is the dessert: black bean sesame balls, which are delicious and freshly prepared.  I grew up with these and the smaller size is just right which makes it tasty and not too greasy.  

In summary, Red Jade has its own unique flavors and style.  Folks are friendly and helpful, and the sesame balls are fantastic.  Thank you.
author: Stefan L.

description:
Disclaimer: I've only ordered delivery.

For the price and convenience of being able to order online, they're starting off on the right foot.  Also they have good quality Chinese food.  I'm sure you could find better, but it would cost you, AND they probably wouldn't deliver.

I don't get anything crazy... I love hot and sour soup, kung pao chicken, and pork fried rice.  I haven't been disappointed yet.

Another nice thing is that they let you sub all white chicken for $1 more.  A reviewer on eat24hours.com pointed that out, and I go for it every time (just put it in the notes).
author: Jamie B.

description:
Food was awesome... though I have to say I'm from Ireland and I'm used to Irish Chinese food which I guess is a little less authentic.. 
Had potstickers and wantons to start which were super tasty and then Mongolian beef and Tso's General chicken which were absolutely delish! One major downside was the waiters- they were soo unpleasant!  We ordered a coke and it never came which is understandable if the place is packed out but there was literally only one other table!  They were also really unhelpful when asked anything about the menu!

Definitely yes for takeaway but I will not set foot in the place again, there are so many other restaurants even on the same street where the waiters are super helpful and nice and there's a much nicer atmosphere!
author: Ashleigh R.

description: Sesame chicken, walnut prawns, stick to the house special if you want something good. Otherwise, everything else on the menu is just okay, not bad but just your average Chinese food. Service was fast. No chit chats. You came in for food therefore they will serve you, but not to be friends with you. I say this because I overheard this one guy trying to get a conversation from one of the waiter, asking for recommendation and the waiter had this wtf look on his face. The menu says it all so be a good customer and just make up your damn mind when ordering. I do love the decor, yellow painted walls with bamboos and orchids.
author: J C.

description:
I live not-so-far, so I order dinner from these guys often.

Pro's:
 - Fast delivery
 - Decent quality of food
 - They give you a good amount of food, I can never finish my order
 - Affordable prices
 - FREE pork buns and desert. They always send us something free, which is always nice

Con's:
- It isn't the best chinese food in the area but its good for what you pay for it.
author: Sarah D.

description: Order from here all of the time. Food is very good...especially the pot stickers! But tonight, the driver asked my boyfriend for an extra dollar because we added something to our meal. Excuse me? What are you saying, sir? If anything, you should give me a dollar since you put onions in my fried rice when I asked for none! What if I was deathly allergic? Also...I don't know why everyone raves about those sesame balls. How can I get them to stop putting them in my delivery orders?!
author: jaime n.

description:
Dear Red Jade Delivery Guy,

Thank you for the easy online ordering. 

Thank you for being at my door just 30 min. later.

Thank you for not running away screaming when you saw sickly me in my scruffy robe and nappy hair.

Thank you for bringing me the "Yee" Wor Wonton with Fresh Chicken Soup.  The wontons were nicely filled with shrimp and pork, I liked the veggies sprinkled throughout, the broth was soothing, and the portion size was generous.

Thank you for bringing me my favorite Green Onion Pancake.  Its crisp, savory, slightly greasy doughiness always makes me feel better.

Thank you for the $15 minimum delivery requirement because it gave me an excuse to order more.

Thank you for the Fire-House Spicy String Beans with Minced Pork and Rice that I will eat for dinner.

Thank you for the freebie BBQ pork buns, fortune cookies, and sesame balls.

Thank you for giving me sustenance to take a nap and watch back episodes of The Daily Show.

But mostly, thank you for NOT putting multiple sets of utensils in the big bag of food that I ordered just for me.  

You da man!

xoxo
Amy C.
author: Amy C.

description:
Still a fan.

Had lunch with the same mentor from two years ago, who's still cheering me on as I look for another job.

We both had eggplant dishes, mine not spicy but his, very much yes.  What's great is that your meal comes with soup. This time it was egg drop which was velvety, creamy and filling.  We also orderd that infamous onion pancake which is one of the best I've had.  Brown rice all around and good fortune cookies and fried sesame dough balls for dessert.  

Nourishment in food and friendship.
author: Jen L.

description:
The waiters are extremely rude and very unprofessional!!

Sat down at 4:59pm, and waiter comes over to take my order.  I asked to order from the Lunch Special menu (11am-5pm), and the waiter rudely said to me it's 5:01pm, and no can do.  Apparently, I missed it by a minute from when I sat down.  I wasn't happy about it, but I wasn't going to press the point.

Ended up ordering beef chow fun.  It took almost 20 minutes for my single entree to arrive, and it was mostly noodles with a miniscule amount of beef.

I finished my meal, and the tab was $8.45, and I handed over $10.  The waiter picked up the cash, and NEVER came back with the change.  It always galls me when the waiters don't come with change - it isn't about the amount, but more on principle that upsets me.

The restaurant is walking distance from my pad, but I'm not walking into this restaurant for a long ass time.
author: Edward A.

description: Easy place to get some decent sesame chicken. Pretty generous lunch specials and tasty sesame balls.
author: Katie H.

description:
Ode to a green onion pancake

I've searched everywhere
for a pancake that even compared
To the delectable delight
I had on Monday night
Piping hot and delish
There's nothing left from that dish
I will remember thee
On my next eating spree
author: Sophia C.

description: Word of advice: DO NOT order the crab puffs, it's hard yet soggy on the outside and imitation crab meat soaked in mayonnaise on the inside. Totally inedible. On a side note, I ordered the shrimp with lobster sauce without the pork, and guess what I got? Pork. Luckily for me it was only 4-5 little pieces so I could pick em out easily. It wasn't much of a lobster sauce also. I feel a little sick after the meal not sure if it was the grease or the poorly cooked crab puff. I do not recommend this restaurant if you decide to order these two items that I've order.
author: Chev C.

description:
In anticipation of a full night of bar hopping, we stopped in Red Jade Restaurant for a quick meal to go. It was inexpensive and prepared quickly. 

We ordered the Combination Fried Rice, which we devoured at our second drinking hole of the night. It was quite good, although I will have to try more next time.
author: Rebekah T.

description: I normally don't like Chinese food over here but rare jade is yummy! I have never been inside, only ordered delivery but they are pretty fast, food was always hot. Unfortunately they have a hart time understanding you on the phone every now and then but in general it's not that big of a problem.
author: Caroline K.

description:
This restaurant has the WORST service imaginable! 

From their website: "If you are looking for one of the best Chinese cuisine experience delivered to your door you may just want to check out Red Jade "

So far the food has not reached my door after over an hour and a half after ordering via Eat24Hours. We called after an hour, and it 'just left'. When I called again thirty minutes later to find out where my food was. whoever answered the phone started screaming at me like it was somehow MY fault, and threatened non-delivery after I'd been waiting for 90 minutes and that I should should be grateful that they were gracing my table with their food.

So far, I reserve judgement on the food. Maybe it's just THAT good, and they just hire assholes to run the phones, so I'll update this review later - but so far my experience of Chinese cuisine has not involved slow delivery and screaming, angry staff. Much.

Just to add to my review -After two hours waiting,  the food arrived. I told the delivery guy just what a raging a-hole his boss/manager was. He agreed.

The food - mediocre at best. Burnt bits in my fried rice. And yes - STALE fortune cookies and shrimp chips. I have NEVER had stale shrimp chips, that's just WRONG and DISGUSTING!

And to echo someone else's review, here's a link to their DPH score - 77! - we're never ordering from these unsanitary bastards ever again!! 

http://bit.ly/sZD9Rs
author: Tim T.

description:
I have to minus one star bc one of my friends thinks they got food poisoning from a shellfish dish here :(. My meal, however, was great. Quick service, friendly staff, water refilled and the plates that just kept on coming!

We had reservations for 5 people and were seated right away since thankfully it was not a busy night. I had to order the onion pancakes - which did not disappoint. A little on the greasy side, but thick and delicious. A friend and I split the crab rangoons bc that's just what you do if you're going to get Chinese, get the fried crap and share for less guilt.

My main meal was the lettuce wrap special. I really enjoyed them as my main course and for breakfast the next day! Great, hearty portions, and the chicken was well seasoned chunks, not ground up or barely recognizable.

There were a bevvy of different veggie dishes at our table and everyone seemed to lick their plates clean. Sesame ball surprise at the end for dessert and hot sake in my belly, not much more I need on a cold winter's night.
author: Jessica P.

description: Red Jade is bay far a great place to go if you want really good Chinese food. This place has been a mainstay on Church street as long as I can remember!  I have gone a nmber of times when I needed to get take out or as a sit down customer. The service all the time has been very good and very fast. When I have gone in this place is ALWAYS busy. I would recommend this place in a heart beat.
author: Frank S.

description:
Went during the weekday for a sit down with the future wife. There was no line around 6pm, somewhat early bird, but the place was almost packed already. 

We ordered scallion pancake, pork stir fried with bitter melon, and spicy salted fish. The food was prepared well and fairly authentic. Scallion pancake was on the money, threw me back to when we had the same in Taiwan. Salted fish was full of flavor. 

We really had no issues, just an all around good experience, the neighborhood is always busy with things to do afterwards. 

good eating
author: Michael H.

description: First let me start off by saying I've never actually been to the restaurant but have ordered take out multiple times and have yet to be disappointed. Like everyone else has stated the Hot & Sour soup is delicious. They are prompt with delivery and my food is always hot regardless of traffic around the SOMA. My favorite item on their menu are the Crab Meat Rangoons. I hope to dine at the restaurant in the near future and can only expect the same prompt service and great food!
author: Lionel F.

description:
My experiences have been solid with Red Jade across several encounters.

Last night I changed it up and had the fried rice with brown instead of white (try it).  Forgot that it's like $1.50 more for brown rice.  .I had no cash (paid online), but the lady smiled and said "No problem, you get me next time".

It was nice.  Even if it was only $1.50.
author: Andrew S.

description: Yet again, my order has taken TWO HOURS to arrive. Again, meaning, this is not the first time. Same thing happened last time!!! What is going on?!?! I could buy the ingredients and cook my own Chinese food BETTER in less time. Fuck Red Jade, you're done. (I've been a customer for 8 years,)
author: Kicker ..

description:
I have many allergies and am extremely sensitive to food. Therefore, when I learned about The Red Jade on Church St. in SF from 'Check Please!' on KQED, PBS, I felt I should try it out. That was over a year ago and I found it a lovely source of delicious food! 

It has turned out to be a reliable and pleasant place where I am able to dine and I'm delighted to say that in my experience, "It is THE BEST CHINESE FOOD IN THE BAY AREA"! 

The service is always prompt, courteous and unobtrusive, which I greatly appreciate! Some other places in the east bay I've found exceedingly noisy and riotous. 

The atmosphere is calm and pleasant and the food consistently superb and DELICIOUS!!! IF I ever have a possibility of being there for the lunch special, I'll be there!!! Consistently good, flavorful and generous NTM fairly priced! I LOVE IT!!! 

...So much so, that I've chosen to purchase a camera at the nearby Wolf's Camera store so that I can dine at Red Jade when I need to come back to SF for lessons on the camera! 

Thank You Red Jade for giving me a 4th place in the bay area where I CAN eat out! 

Love, Iadora U!!!
author: Iadora K.

description:
RED JADE is a GREAT Chinese-American Restaurant !

There are many styles of Chinese cooking and RED JADE is  Chinese-American cusine, that's GOOD Chinese-American cusine at a resonable price!

ADDA is a vegetarian, and VEGGIES will find a slew of wonderful dishes to choose!  The SAUTEED SNOW PEAS with WATER CHESTNUTS ($6.95) in a lighly flavored sauce is THE BEST! 

The tasty CRISPY FRIED TOFU comes in bite-sized portions, and is really delicious for those who crave good (non-greasy) fried tofu! 

RED JADE's LUNCH SPECIALS are resonably priced at $5.25-$5.95 with soup, white or brown rice, seseme ball/fortune cookie, & tea! 

VEGETARIAN DELIGHT ($5.25 lunch) has a HUGE plateful of wonderful veggies in a light sauce. (ADDA always asks for EXTRA GARLIC to really give it a super taste kick!!)

Meat/fish eaters should try the LEMON CHICKEN ($5.25 lunch-$7.50 dinner) is a nice crispy chicken with a very light coating of lemon sauce. Not overpowering at all...TASTYLICIOUS! 
  
The SHRIMP with MIXED VEGETABLES ($5.95 lunch) is also a lighty-flavored enjoyable treat. 

Actually, there are so many selections on the menu, it would be impossible to review each and every dish there, but one can be assured that EVERYTHING IS SO FRESH !!!!!!

RED JADE's wonderful staff is very attentative and kind. They are open to any changes or dietary restrictions/additions!  

For CHINESE-AMERICAN CUISINE...RED JADE is a wonderful inexpensive "'GEM"!
author: Addadada A.

description: Our office orders from here occasionally and so I just placed my first home delivery order. The food arrived in less than 40 minutes and everything we received was delicious.
author: Dani S.

description: Loved everything! Especially the Hot and Sour soup! It is more hot than sour...we were seated right away served drinks right away with complimentary tea. Great price for how delicious the food is! We will definitely be back
author: staci H.

description:
they earned a second star for the free pork buns.

Really really mediocre food.

Why is there no decent chinese delivery in SF?!?!? Arghhh.
author: Joby P.

description:
We were looking for a good lunch spot last weekend and found Red Jade here on Yelp. Had to come leave a review - we were so impressed with the food and the service. Beautiful, clean restaurant, kid friendly and really well priced.

We started with the onion pancake and potstickers. The Onion pancake is more cake like than we've had before and was really fluffy with great flavor. The potstickers were fantastic, pan seared  with a great crispy base and then stuffed with really tasty pork.

For main dishes we ordered sweet and sour chicken and kung pao ostrich along with pork friend rice. The rice was great - great texture and flavor but the two main dishes were the true stars. I never expect much out of sweet and sour anything, we usually order it for the kids. This dish was above and beyond! The chicken morsals were tender and moist and lightly fried with a nice crunch. The sweet and sour sauce was lighter and nicely sweet. It was THE best SS dish we've ever had, here in the U.S. or in China. I had to order the ostrich because I love it and have never seen it available in Chinese food before! It was amazing - really well cooked, tender and flavorful in a lightly spicy sauce.

They concluded the meal with fortune cookies and sesame pastry balls with red bean filling. 

Our entire meal, with soft drinks was less than $40 and everyone left happy and full. Its a drive for us and kind of out of the way, but we will definitely be back!
author: Kimberly P.

description: I love Chinese food. With that said I have been to some terrible ones.But occasionally I will bump into a really good one.  Red Jade is one of the best ones.  First off the peking duck is to die for.  They don't always have duck in stock so call first if you want to make sure you can get it that day.  The guy doing the deliveries (i think his name is Jordan) Was working at a lightning pace this past Christmas Eve.  He would leave with bags of to go orders, would rush back and do it all over again.  Must of been 8 trips in the 90 minutes I was there.  Great service all around.  Red Jade is a little out of the way for me but worth the trip.  Everyone should give it a try.
author: eric t.

description:
If you stick to the basics here, you'll do just fine.  It's not the place to get all adventurous and order something crazy.

it's Chinese take-out  with a super nice dining room and wait service.  You can't be the prices either, especially the lunch specials, and they even run them all weekend.  

The food is pretty decent, they nail the standard Chinese dishes we all crave.  It's not exactly "light" food or portions though, so hit the gym before hand and eat there when you can take a two hour nap after.
author: Edward H.

description: Service has gone down terribly.  I didn't get any help last time with out actually waving someone down or walking over and getting the waiter myself.  We also saw other being helped waited on and served before us even though we sat down first, they also left before us.  The food also tasted like plastic for some reason which has never happened.  Sad to say this will be my last time at my "usual" spot.
author: Skindy B.

description: I was there once, but would not go again. Food was kind of ok, a bit greasy. Service was also ok. Then why only three stars, you ask? The same day my wife and I ate there, we had slight symptoms of food poisoning. The only common meal that we both ate was some sea food appetizer (if I remember correctly - prawns).
author: Igor P.

description: I didn't like this Chinese food. Salty yet flavors were off on generals chicken and chow mein. Egg foo young was just okay. Lettuce wraps were okay. They were fast on delivery and friendly.
author: Piper W.

description:
I only had hot n sour soup and potstickers here 
but they were both GREAT. Very very good.
author: Paul H.

description: I think I've finally found good chinese delivery in the neighborhood!
author: Mikah M.

description:
Want Chinese comfort food? Jade Garden is your go-to place. The food here is like an old, familiar, comfortable sweater that might not look the best but that you find you still can't let go. Who cares about fashion when you feel good... Riiiiiight!?!?

Jade Garden's Chinese food is what you'll find in Americanized Chinese restaurants all around the country. I have seen this menu, as well as this food, countless times. And hey, just cause I'm pasty as he'll doesn't mean I don't want it to be spicy and dangerous!

The food all tastes as I'd expect, prices are inexpensive, the service is friendly and quick, and while nothin' amazing, a decent stop if you live in this area and want some Chinese. This is definitely an old sweater I'd try on again.
author: Denise B.

description: I've ordered delivery from red Jade now a few times, it always comes on time and is hot!  They also always throw in a couple sesame balls for free. Food is good and not too greasy.   I couldn't ask for more from a Chinese delivery place.
author: Maddy F.

description:
Large portions.
Hunan Beef was crispy and tasty.
Love that spicy yellow mustard on the egg rolls.
Sesame balls with the fortune cookies were nice, too.

Was this always Red Jade?
Either way, it seems new or fairly recently remodeled.  Service was fast and friendly.
author: Ken B.

description: The food is great. Delivery is HORRIBLE. They simply do not  understand customer service or English for that matter. I try every time for them to get the order right and they fail everytime. They simply don't care about their customers.
author: Dave R.

description: This was the worst Chinese food I've ever had and even though I returned the food they charged us for it. The chicken is mostly bread and the sauces are bad.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Chop suey? Check! Egg Foo Young? Check! It has been exceedingly difficult to find Chop suey and egg foo young at San Francisco Chinese food restaurants although I have researched and it seems the dish was invented here. Well, these dishes are mainstays at Chicago take out Chinese restaurants and I was really interested in eating it here in SF.

Red Jade serves both and they are both good; and greasy. I don't try to fool myself. When I go for Chinese, I prepare my stomach and know it may be grease-filled; that's okay. This is definitely flavorful and it is pretty nice ambiance. The wait for food was moderate and it wasn't that crowded. Definitely going to continue to eat here.
author: Lem B.

description:
I love this restaurant. We visited Red Jade during the weekday for the lunch specials. What a bargain it was! For lunch, you can get soup, and a rather large portioned meal for a smidge more than $6. 

The restaurant is clean! Always a plus!!

I ordered the salt and pepper spareribs. The texture was fantastic. It was not too salty, and was paired well with the rice which was cooked perfectly. I hate if rice is too hard or too soft - bleh.

The portion size was so large that I couldn't finish it in one sitting, and decided to take it home to share with my loved ones for dinner.

I also heard that they make party platters that are very affordable without sacrificing taste! Something to think about for the next party that I plan.
author: Rosie M.

description:
A above average Chinese restaurant.  I go there often because it is a block from my house.  Their lunch specials are very affordable, but I am not a big fan of the dinner prices.  Their delivery service is excellent.  However, I was surprised that in violation of the law according to another Yelper, they do not display their SF Health department score, which was supposedly 77.  That's lame.

Next time I go in there I am going to look for that score card, and if I do not see it properly posted, I will certainly make my opinion known. 

But compared to some of the grease and cockroach pits in Chinatown, this place is decent.

Very very fast attentive service and food delivery to go or in house.  Sometimes tasteless Chinese food.  Some dishes are better than average on the other hand.

I guess I go there because of the convenient location, good lunch special prices (though dinner is a bit more than it should be), and very fast service.
author: Joe S.

description:
4 stars for overall food quality, especially at this price point.
Excellent Dim Sum at any price point; it rivals the big Dim Sum restaurants.
author: G L.

description:
We order from here a lot for our office and they are always nice and prompt.  They always include some freebies which is awesome.  

One thing-They give you these tiny forks so it takes forever to shove all the good food in your mouth! I need this delivered with a shovel in the future.
author: Siouxsie D.

description: I placed an order for delivery from this place, specifically, ordered fried rice and the orange chicken. They delivered this fried, bland, meaty looking thing with a sauce on the side. I thought they had messed up my order. Nope. Orange chicken is, literally, fried plain chicken with some orange sauce on the side. I tried giving it a shot, mix the two together, figuring "this is rather unusual, but sure, why not" and... it was just terrible. Terrible terrible terrible. I couldn't go more than a few bites before giving up and just ordering from a different place. The fried rice was fine, I suppose, so there's that.
author: Rodrigo M.

description:
OK, it is probably the alcohol talking (hang on, what am I saying; of course it is!), but after a few drinks on a Sunday afternoon, Red Jade hits the spot for dinner.

Two of our regular table of four are creatures of habit, always ordering the mongolian lamb and hunan fish. The lamb can be a little hit or miss (twice has been good, once was a little tough), but the fish has been consistently tasty. Other than that, I have tried the princess prawns, the spicy string beans, and a couple of broccoli and eggplant dishes. 

Eat it family style with a an order of steamed rice for the table, and you can't really go wrong -- it soaks up the alcohol, and you leave full and happy.
author: Shane W.

description: ECSTATIC!!!! My hubby & I have used their delivery service several times now. The food is OFF THE CHAIN!! The consistency is impressive. I mean, sometimes--Well, you know how you order one time--it's good. Then, it starts to go downhill? Their food is BEYOND delicious EVERY time! We usually order Hoisin String Beans, Sweet & Sour Pork, Green Onion Pancake, and a large order of Steamed Rice. (you can get brown, or white rice.) The string beans are tender, and FRESH. The sweet & Sour Pork--Chopped in smaller pieces. In my opinion, this is better. It allows the pork to cook quicker w/o turning the outer crust to turn to HARD, inedible, rock hard mess. Their S&S Pork has a crunchy exterior w/ tender, juicy interior!! And, honey, the Green Onion Pancake is DEEEEEEEEE-Liciously crunchy & Flavorful!! Delivered HOT!! We always get it within30 Min. Great service. Cordial staff.
author: Sabrina R.

description:
03/16/2012 Friday evening, order food at 1830 hr for delivery at 2000 hr. Given them time for delivery. Did not get the order until 2030 hr. 1 star taken away.
I ordered the Chicken Corn Soup (blanded) had to doctored it. 1/2 star taken away.
Mango Beef was not up to par. 1/2 star taken away. Will try again when mango is in season.
Crispy Chicken was okay bit dried. 1/2 star taken away.
Beef Chow Fun was good especially ordering at night. 
Seafood with bird nest basket: the seafood was fresh and good. The basket was not like what Martin Yan would make.

Overall, the food was good enough to eat and watch "March Madness". Since the food arrived late I will order sooner for delivery ASAP instead of providing a delivery time. Plus the food arrived "HOT" so I am going to order from them again maybe not on a weekend.
author: Randolph T.

description:
SLOW DOWN, PLEASE!!!  Seriously!

I just got back from this restaurant and was very disappointed.  I've been here a few times and it was so-so...until tonight.  
We ordered the orange chicken, chicken chow mein and the house special beef.  The orange chicken and chow-mein came out real quick (like 3-5 minutes later!).  No complains there but, my complain is that the other dish we ordered never came out!

Saving my appetite for it,  I stopped eating cause the waiter (Male, late 40's) said it will come soon.  15 minutes later, nada!  NOTHING!  Just the waiter coming back to ask if everything was good.  And if we wanted to take the food to go.  REALLY?  
We told him we never got the other food, so he went back to the kitchen to check, only to come back saying he forgot, or the kitchen forgot it.  He then took our plates, which we weren't even done eating, then gave us our check.  WTF!  

They really need to SLOW DOWN!  That guy needs to slow down and pay attention and not mad rush the customers!  Its like I'm eating at a fast food restaurant!
author: Little E.

description:
Wanting to try a new Chinese delivery place, we ordered the Combination Plate Sampler, General Tso Chicken and Pork Chops in Pungent sauce.

70 minutes later it arrived luke warm with a long black hair wrapped around one of the dry fried chicken wings and soggy General Tso's Chicken.

Never again...
author: Stacy Y.

description: This place is okay. Honestly, I have had better Chinese food and better service else where.
author: Moy V.

description: I came here once with my coworkers, since then I have been coming back and now I bring the family with me. Yee wonton soup is the best!! Friendly and clean. Customer service is awesome!!!
author: Evelyn M.

description: I came here a long time ago, and I never went back. The service was fast without hardly a word spoken, and the food was ok, nothing unique about it.
author: Bahar A.

description: Do NOT! I repeat, do NOT order orange chicken from this place. They don't do it right and it's disgusting. Their hot & sour soup is delicious. Chow mein is sub-par. Try wonderland SF for better Chinese or Eric's in noe valley (Eric's doesn't deliver, but wonderland does).
author: heather m.

description: rude service & i will never order from them again! they had the nerve to call me at 10:30pm complaining about a tip. wth. never again!!!!!!!!
author: Cici V.

description: My go to Chinese delivery.  I like war wonton soup and Red Jade's won ton has shrimp in it too and they give you 2 big containers full of soup for one order.   They also always give you sesame balls and steam pork buns as a gift.
author: Wakako U.

description:
These guys turn out really solid food.  I've ordered delivery a few times.  Notes:

* The standalone eggplant dish is awesome -- well-cooked, generous portions of eggplant
*  Free pork buns with large orders?  Yes sir!
*  I don't normally like General Tzo's, but Red Jade managed to serve up some big chunks of chicken that were lightly dipped in sweet sauce.  Nice.
*  Big dumplings.  Score.
*  Someone ordered the Hong Kong-style noodles with seafood.  Not really a hit with the table.  Noodles were soggy and the seafood was just sort of tossed on top of the everything.  I'd avoid in the future.
author: Bill H.

description:
Check Please! Review... 

If you have never seen Check Please! it is kinda like Yelp on TV http://blogs.kqed.org/food/program/ Gotta love it! 

So my Man and I where watching my favorite PBS show Check Please! and along came Red Jade and the sudden craving for Chinese. After the show was over we knew we had to try it especially the "Best Green Onion Pancake in Bay Area." We made the track out to San Francisco and after battling to find parking got there. Cute place. 

Because they were on the show there was a bit of a wait. We tried calling ahead for a reservation but all of the times where booked and only walk in was available. My Man and I joked about how many people where there as regulars v. viewers. As it turns out we ended up chatting with another lady who was waiting and had also come out because of the show. Ah, the power of marketing. 

The place is small so it took about 25 minutes to get seated. We were so hungry and had stared at the menu for so long that we immediately placed our order. We ordered: 

- Pot stickers: They were not the worst I have had but by far not the best. Not to mention they don't have that yummy pot sticker sauce. :( 
- Dim Sum: Which my Man really enjoyed. 
- The Veggie Chow Mein: Was pretty yummy, but not delish. 
- Broccoli Chicken: This was bland and did not taste all that great. 
- Asparagus & Cashew Chicken: This tasted exactly like the broccoli chicken. 

Because they were super busy it took forever to get our food. Not to mention they were out of the "Best Green Onion Pancake in Bay Area." Overall, the place is nice and they have good food but the service is not good. The server was overwhelmed rushed us and was hard to understand. In conclusion the place gets a solid 3 stars.
author: Caro S.

description:
Not much to say about this place. If you've been to an average quality Chinese restaurant, you've been to Red Jade.

We had mixed starters including some kind of... cheese wonton. The first time I've ever had cheese in a Chinese restaurant. Hopefully the last. Everything else was average.

We then had brown rice, General Tso's chicken and sesame chicken. All battered, all drowned in sauce, all perfectly edible but unremarkable.

Prices were moderate; I'd say that for the quality of the food, you could shop around and save money.

I'd eat there again if I were in the area and had a hankering for Chinese, but it's in the vicinity of some much better restaurants if you're not precious about which cuisine you're eating.
author: Rob C.

description:
Just met some friends here for dinner.  My friends ordered their food and I ordered the homestyle chicken, which was really good.  Then I ordered chicken fried rice, it was then when I was ordering that the waiter proceeded to show me how big of a plate it was and asked if I wanted to order it, since it was a big plate.  I was kind of surprised how frank he was being, considering had someone who was more sensitive about their weight would have taken offense to how he was describing the plate and possibly insinuating that I didn't need to eat that much.  Needless to say, I told him I would take home what I wouldn't eat.

The chicken chow mein that my friends ordered, tasted burnt.  When my friend stated that he wanted it refunded from the bill, the waiter stated that he could replace it with another dish because his boss had already left and couldn't do the refund.  We had it refunded.

The waiter brought our check over.  The ticket listed all the items we ordered, without the prices, the waiter only wrote down that the entire order was $50.  Considering our experience already, we decided to add up the bill on our own.  As we were referencing the prices on the menu and adding it up, the waiter came back over, grabbed the check and added all the prices to the ticket and the total with tax was a little over $47.  Sure, it was just under a $3 difference, but it's the matter of principle, that based on the subpar service he provided that he would think we trusted him enough to not actually add up the check.  It was dishonest.

Not sure if I'd go back.  Food wasn't bad, but would hate to have that experience again.
author: Perry P.

description:
As a creature of habit, I usually get the same thing.  Sesame Chicken but I really do love it.

Green Onion pancake and crab rangoon also good.
author: Sean S.

description: Whatever u do don't Order chicken. They took forever and when it came out it's was like chicken left overs. There was no chunks of meet at all. Just like legs and feet. Nasty!!!
author: James C.

description:
Crab Rangoon.  That is why we come to Red Jade.

My wife and I moved from San Francisco to the Denver area in early 2009, but we've been fortunate enough to be able to come back to SF regularly on business.  When we do, we often find time to swing by Red Jade.  My wife cannot get enough of their Crab Rangoon.  We've tried it at a few different places in Colorado; some have decent filling, some have decent wrappers, but nobody brings the whole package together the way Red Jade does.

We also tried their wonton soup for the first time recently, and it was fantastic.  The entrees... well, most of the people we go with like to get the Americanized basics of sesame chicken, sweet and sour chicken, etc., which are fine but nothing exciting.  I enjoyed the chop suey a few times and have had some decent veggie dishes, too. 

But ultimately, it's all about the Crab Rangoon.
author: Michael I.

description: I saw this place on Check Please Bay Area and bookmarked it. When I was in the area, I used my Yelp app and this place came up and nearby, so I chose this place for dinner. The staff was really friendly, I ordered right away and they brought me tea. It took a little longer than I had expected for the food to come out, but it was probably just me since I was eating by myself, so time seemed to move slower than usual. The noodles were great, I'm a noodle addict, so of course I ordered the chow mein. But I would like to come back with more people so I could do family style. The noddles were a HUGE portion, I took half of it with me and at them later that night when I got home. Also I LOVED that they gave us a fortune cookie and a jin deui. I was really happy with it, but there wasn't a WOW factor for me, hence the 4/5.
author: Suki V.

description:
Had the crab fried rangoon and the peking duck ($11 for half a duck). It was fantastic. Peking duck in other Chinese restaurants usually comes with fatty layers that you need to strip away to get at the good lean meat. This was either stripped (save me the trouble) or the duck was chosen to not be fatty. Either way, it was really a delicious meal. I glanced at other people's General Tsao's... I'm getting that next time.

Bonus was at the end they give you little seasame balls, but they're usually not very fresh (they have a relatively large bin of seasame balls to grab from when they hand out the checks).
author: Sylvia L.

description: I think this place is great! No MSG. We sat down and had immediate attention. Everything we ate had distinct flavors. Great service. I shall be back.
author: Ethan S.

description:
My first visit was around 8:45 one evening. I noted that their closing time as posted on the door was 9:30. I ordered the pan-fried pork loin with black pepper sauce for $8.50 and a side of rice for $2.00 more. I'm having a really hard time getting used to paying for sides of rice in this city when it's free where I've lived before. One dollar for a bowl of rice would be questionable, but a two-dollar charge is shameless gouging. I make organic jasmine long grain rice at home all the time, and it's cheap! Really cheap! Anyway, most Chinese meals seem incomplete to me without rice so I order it and complain on Yelp! lol

The pork loin was very tasty, not greasy at all, not overcooked, and a good portion. So many Chinese restaurants present a beautiful large platter of beautifully battered fat and bone, but this was not the case with this dish. There were enough leftovers that I could make another meal at home.

What I found especially interesting and encouraging was that when customers were still streaming in at 9:20, they were greeted warmly and seated with no mention that the restaurant was closing in ten minutes. Being greeted warmly is a refreshing change from what happens in most San Francisco Chinese restaurants. I was served team-style by three pleasant servers, and it was a good experience.

I'll go back to try their lamb chops, Peking duck, soft shell crabs or some of the other interesting menu selections.
author: Reynolds L.

description:
I recently moved to the same block as Red Jade so I'm becoming a regular.  

In the past, I'd had some not-so-great takeout, and one time I showed up to pick up my food and they'd given it to someone else and I was annoyed.  

HOWEVER, I have to say, all the meals I've had in the restaurant have been really good.  The dim sum special is tasty and a great alternative if you don't want to go out and deal with a big dim sum spectacle.  It comes with three shrimp dumplings, two pork siu mai, a scallop dumpling, and two pork buns.

I love the lettuce cups (with diced chicken) here.  Also a fan of the green onion cake, the sauteed bok choy (or other veggies), the vegetarian mu shu.  LOVE LOVE LOVE the fried chicken wings, and love the potstickers.  The sesame chicken is really good, too.

The chow fun isn't so great here.  And generally I would suggest eating here (and not takeout) because I've had some really disappointing take out experiences...

Service is quick, and the staff is really nice.
author: Dave M.

description:
This is the second time that I ate at Red Jade. The first time It was much better that is why I am putting 2 stars instead of 1.

The first time, last week, my co-worker and I called to order for pick-up. We both ordered the veggie fried rice with no egg and we added tofu. It was great and a very large portion for a decent price.

We then decided to call and order for pick-up a second time today. We both got lunch specials which came with rice and soup. I ordered the eggplant tofu lunch special. My co-worker came back from picking it up and at first I thought that they forgot to add tofu and it was only eggplant, which was okay. As I was eating I discovered little pieces of beef. It wasn't just one or two by mistake either. I decided to ditch the entree and I ate the rice alone with soy sauce. My co-worker said that his mongolian beef lunch special was "ok" and that it felt like it had been sitting out for a while.

There are plenty of Chinese restaurants in the city and some with a lot more vegetarian options. I understand that mistakes happen, but It is a huge turn off to see meat in my vegetarian dishes.
author: Anthony H.

description:
Having used Waiters on Wheels, what a pleasure this was. 

Wait time: When I see 45-60 minutes, the cup half empty expects 60 minute, so I was pleasantly surprised when the door bell range at 45 minutes! 

Food: Chow fun was delicious, but not the charred taste, that would make it excellent. The egg plant was savory/sweet and cooked to perfection. The Peking duck was more like roast duck, but had light pancakes with them. The ma po tofu had large chunks of tofu in a savory sauce. I am not sure why I ordered the original chicken wings, but they were crispy and moist. 

Free food: The free pork buns were a nice touch. I love those things. It was an unexpected and appreciated addition. I am not a fan of the sesame ball, but it was free! 

Thanks for a timely delivery!
author: A I.

description: They are blindingly fast. The food is good. They give us free sesame balls and pork buns. What the HECK more do you want?! This place is a GREAT spot to rely on for fast, reliable, delicious Delivery. Nuff said.
author: Vincent C.

description: We ordered mango chicken to go with brown rice. Get home and the inside of the  bag is covered in gravy. The lid was not put on tightly and it was a big mess. We counted 4 small pieces of mango in our Mango Chicken. No reason to come back here.
author: Bob J.

description: My favorite place to order from. Their chicken wings are the tastiest in the city, IMHO.
author: Gavin M.

description:
A dependable Hunan or Mandarin restaurant is worth giving up a kidney, and one that delivers makes me want to get a frequent organ donor card. And one that has great, fresh-tasting food can only mean one thing: a brain transplant.

That's why I am thrilled that a good friend of mine made me aware of Red Jade on Church. There are plenty of Chinese restaurants that deliver in my neck of SOMA, but they all seem to serve from the same vat of mystery brown sauce that covers all their food no matter what you order. Whatever it's made of, I believe it's the same ingredient that Ron Popeil uses in his spray-on hair aerosol can.

Red Jade, on the other hand, serves fresh Mandarin cuisine superbly prepared. I can always tell how good a Chinese restaurant will be by their garlic chicken. I've been to one that actually deep fried their chicken like McNuggets and ladles some kind of goop with just a half-clove of garlic in it. At $6.95, Red Jade's is fresh with a light marinade but heavy on the garlic. I also like their tangy Fire House Spicy String Beans with Minced Pork ($6.95), heartier than your average veggie side, especially with all that meat.

Their $8.50 Lettuce Wraps are much better than what they serve at Long Life. The appetizers are worth a meal in themselves - the $3.95 Green Onion Pancake is flaky perfection, while the $5.95 House Special Dim Sum for Two is a nice treat without the burden of a Tourettes-screeching woman clanking by with a steam cart. Best of all, they offer lunch specials that range between $4.50 and $5.95 that include soup and rice. They even deliver the specials as long as you hit the $15.00 minimum.

By the way, the restaurant itself is perfectly nice and worth visiting. The service is fine, and I've yet to be there when the whole place has been crowded. But, c'mon, free delivery...how can you beat that? Plus you get those addictive fried sesame balls plus if you hit a $20.00 tab, free Bar-B-Q Pork Buns. Enough said. 

FOOD - 4.5 stars...fresh and hot
AMBIENCE - 4 stars...nice and wide-open and just a stone's throw from Market
SERVICE - 5 stars...did I mention they deliver for free??
OVERALL - 4.5 stars...getting my donor card now
author: Ed U.

description:
Ordered :
General Tso's Spicy Boneless Chicken Lunch Special : 3/5
Mongolian Lamb Lunch Special : 2/5
Garlic Chicken Lunch Special : 2/5

Will order again : 2/5 NO
Food was pretty bland and tasteless.
author: Rachit A.

description: This is by far my favorite Chinese restaurant to order delivery. Food is always delicious and hot. They give free pork buns! I highly recommend it!
author: Michael S.

description:
I noticed the restaurant's sign last week while riding a trolley to upper Market, and I'm not sure why, but the name "Red Jade" kind of made me want to check it out.  I made a special trip out that way, and I had a late lunch / early dinner at the Red Jade for the first time on President's Day, and I was quite pleased.

The order of potstickers would have been a meal in itself.  Large and plump I especially liked how the ginger and pork flavors in the filling overpowered the cabbage.  For me cabbage is only a necessity with corned beef or cole slaw; I am not a fan of cabbage.  Anyway, the skin was relatively thin and the flavor of the filling was very good.  

It took a bit of wait time before my seafood combination chow fun arrived.  I ordered it dry as opposed to the slimy, saucy version which I hate.  The serving was quite large with lots of fun ( flat rice noodles), lots of calamari and scallops and some shrimp.  A small amount of bean sprouts, slivered white onions, green onions and scallions made the whole dish wickedly good.  I ended up stuffing myself silly.

The little fried sesame ball filled with the sweet lotus paste was the perfect ending to a delicious meal.  A bowl of complimentary egg flower soup preceded the meal.  There was nothing special about the soup though just broth, eggs, some chopped green onion and lots of corn starch.  The service was very good too.

The restaurant is very clean compared to the Chinese restaurants I normally frequent, and I will return.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
I ordered for delivery and it was very fast. It's not too expensive.
18 dlls for  a chicken soup, orange chicken and chow mein
When I opened the door the delivery guy was mad at me because he waited 5 min outside my building.. seriously? 5 MIN!!! anyways...

the food does't have flavor. The chow mein was okay, but the orange chicken was horrible. The chicken looks like it was frozen and it was more skin or hide than chicken. I don't know what the chicken had but I was vomiting the whole night! 
 
their bad orange chicken was the reason I created an account in yelp.

I'M NEVER GONNA EAT HERE AGAIN!!!!
author: Arael D.

description: I've been here many times!  It's not the absolute greatest but it's very affordable and quality is good.  I would recommend the eggplant tofu, as well as the General Tso's chicken.  They are very hospitable and have friendly customer service.  Rarely have I waited more than 10 minutes for my meal.  I would recommend going here.  We go at least 2x/mo.
author: Paul W.

description:
Food = tasty, and offer healthy choices (such as brown rice)  I'm a fan of their house special eggplant dish though (shrimp, chicken, eggplant in a spicy garlic sauce)  Yum.  
Portions = hearty.  Trust me...one dish is enough but sharing is great too.  
Service = friendly enough.
Decor = simple.  

They offer delivery service, but they have a fairly well sit-down service too.
author: Fannie S.

description: They keep the door open so it makes for a chilly atmosphere. Food is great but I don't like to be cold during dinner/lunch. Overall a great inexpensive place to have lunch. Just be sure to bundle up.
author: David R.

description: Ok. Hit & miss. Some things are pretty good, but you can find better spots around the neighborhood...
author: Luisa L.

description: I ordered Kung pao shrimp and hot and sour soup and both were DELICIOUS.  Delivery service was excellent.  I recommend this restaurant!
author: Aaron C.

description:
Red Jade is the perfect Chinese restaurant for the Castro neighborhood:  stylish, not overly cramped, clean feeling, with lots of eye candy at the tables around you, and all of your favorite Chinese dishes done well.  

In a city that is practically overwhelmed by good Chinese restaurants, what sets this place apart is that the owners have really tried to make the experience about more than just the food:  in other words, they've decorated.  

And they care about your fussy weird no-white-foods diet, too, because you can either get white jasmine or brown rice...I don't know of any other Chinese restaurant that offers that choice!  And the white rice is good, too: it isn't overly dry, isn't too sticky or glutenous, and the grains aren't all broken up...so, a detail as small as the rice is noticed and cared for here. 

There are a lot of vegetarian options, too, and this restaurant can accomodate large parties.  Their lunch specials are seriously inexpensive (think $4.25-6.25) and definitely fill you up!

As far as location, you couldn't ask for better:  It's right by Muni, in the midst of many things to do and places to go.  You can walk to a number of coffee shops, dessert places, clubs and bars from here, should you feel so inclined, and the neighborhood feels safe to walk around in, even very late at night.  The only downside is that parking seriously sucks in this neighborhood, so give yourself extra time to drive around and around for 10-20 minutes before finding a spot.  

All in all, I highly recommend this place to people on dates, large groups, and anyone who is less concerned with food snobbery about how "authentic" their Chinese food is (I can hear it now: "What?!  No chicken feet on their menu???  Honey, let's just go...") and more concerned with just having a tasty, affordable meal in a nice environment.

**Note:  If you're looking for "Prawns with Walnuts", ie, my favorite dish, you'll find it on their menu under the name "A Happy Family".  Don't ask me why.  Just order it :)
author: Amy L.

description: Our meals were very good I had sweet and sour pork while husband had chicken and snow peas. Always greeted at the door when walking in.
author: Robert L.

description:
The service here was bullsh*t. I came here with my girlfriend once and we both got lunch specials. I got the dim sum (which was supposed to come with rice) and she got some kinda chicken dish. Well it was supposed to come with soup, however he didnt tell us what soup. So when he brought out the soups and I realized it was something I couldn't eat (due to allergies), I asked nicely if I could just get something different like thier normal egg drop, something equal in price. He looked PISSED, told me no and that I had to pay for another one if I wanted it. I was just hungry, so I did. Now comes our meals. I get the dumplings..there's..4 of em. Not great. I asked the server if I could get the rice that came with it and he just tells me "No, it doesn't come with rice." Me: Well... on your menu it says it does.. Server: "Dim Sum isn't supposed to come with rice." Then why the HECK would you put that on your menu???

Le sigh. I don't give many bad reviews but this place sucked. Wonderland isn't far from it, go there instead.
author: Ashley F.

description: This is my favorite place to eat in SF.  There are hundreds of other restaurants that are great for lots of reasons but Red Jade is consistently awesome for the following reasons. They are so efficient.  Seating to order to service is never more than 10 mins.  The potstickers are amazing.  It's cheap.
