Their sweet and sour chicken, Mongolian beef and beef with broccoli is so good.  If I'm hungry and want quick eats I go here.  I cannot fault it! Please don't ever leave.
author: Clare C.

description: Love this restaurant. I probably visit about twice a week. Great menu and high turn around so the food is always fresh, delicious, and there in just minutes. The staff is super friendly and cater to your requests immediately. These guys know the food industry! Other restaurants should take notes.
author: Arvi C.

description:
Came here on the recommendation of Sam S. My dining companion for the evening is a meat-eater and reluctantly dines out at veg restaurants with me, but he feels much more comfortable when he can order meat, so this was a happy medium.

He got the peking duck and enjoyed it. I got the kung pao tofu (my favourite dish to get at any Chinese restaurant) and it was pretty stellar.

The tofu itself was delicious - cooked quite well. Perfect amount of water chestnuts and peanuts. The kung pao part was not as spicy as I would have liked. Granted, I like SPICY, much more than the average person, but I expected it to have a little more kick. Still, good, regardless.

Would have loved to try the garlic spinach, but I'm relatively certain they don't use vegan butter. So yeah, not phenomenal, but certainly not bad, and there is an extensive veg selection.
author: Natalye R.

description: I do not....repeat....do not like Chinese food.  Red Jade has adjusted my attitude towards the usually greasy food.  The onion peanut butter pancake thing is outstanding!  The soups are all delicious and the service is very quick!  Great location in the Castro and love that they were open and PACKED on Christmas!.
author: April M.

description: It was amazing !! The service was great. The best potstickers are the best I have ever had. The onion pancake delish!! Defiantly a place I will go back :)
author: Marcy T.

description:
They just don't do it for me the way they used to.

Somehow the veggies don't seem quite as fresh.  The flavor has moved more toward the American-Chinese end of the continuum (vs the Chinese-Chinese end), meaning it's rather bland, and many of the dishes taste the same.

They remain as friendly and welcoming as ever.  And they do have a very generous lunch special ($5.95 for soup, entree, rice, and sesame ball).  Oh, and those greasy sesame balls are as addictive as ever.  

Mmmm, greasy balls . . . (Aren't you hungry now?)
author: Ravena F.

description:
I come here almost every week for lunch since I work around the corner. Their lunch specials are so cheap and they come in big portions! And they're not that bad. Probably the best place to get Chinese food in that area.

I think the lunch special comes with soup and a sesame ball & fortune cookie. Oh yeah, try their potstickers! They're really big for some reason lol $6 for 6 pieces though...

I'm positive there are places in SF that have better Chinese food, but for a place that gets you your food quick and affordable, if you're in the area... come here!
author: Sandy M.

description:
Very inexpensive and very fast service.  Surprisingly nice decor inside.  I used to stop by for lunch sometimes.   I would like to rate this restaurant higher, but have generally found that all the food tastes similar, as though all the sauces came from the same base. What that really means is, I grew tired of the restaurant after only a few visits.

I'd recommend it if you're in the area, but don't really go that often myself.
author: K. B.

description: Kung Pao chicken was bland and all dark meat.  Blah. Hot and sour was good, no meat.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Ugh, I know my food and this was bad.  I order delivery.  Got the Appetizer Sampler, with the Crab Rangoons, Potstickers, Eggrolls, and Fried Chicken Wings.  I think they advertised the wings as hot/spicy, it was not.  The sampler was bland, the Rangoons could have been initially frozen, they were definitely not made fresh, chicken had no flavor, the eggrolls were fine and the potstickers were just not good at all.  I also order the Singapore Style Rice Noodles.  I am a huge fan of this dish in general, so when it's poorly made I get really pissed.  We pay money to have a place like this make good food, why is it that so many places service horrible food?  This dish had very little flavor, the shrimp were frozen at one time, the BBQ Pork was of decent quality, but I don't think any of this would have mattered if it had actually been seasoned correctly.  Will definitely never order from here again.  

Such a waste of money and it took about an hour and a half to get the food, so such a waste of time too.
author: Jason B.

description:
We ate at Red Jade the first week they were open, having just moved to the neighborhood, and have been back regularly since.

Their potstickers are great.  They are one of the few restaurants left that makes a mean Egg Foo Yung (BBQ pork variety is the best).  Other good dishes include:  Hunan Beef, Spicy Salted Fish, Cashew Nut Chicken, and Green Onion Pancake.  We usually get out of there for $30 for two people, including appetizer, entrees, drinks, and tip.

Red Jade may not offer The Most Amazing Cuisine On Earth, but the food is good, the restaurant is clean, and the staff is friendly!
author: Karen C.

description: Amazing lunch specials. Large portions for $6. Staff is attentive. Not the best chinese food by the food is good for the price :)
author: Lissette V.

description:
Go to Chinese food in the area. Clean for a Chinese restaurant. Excellent red bean grease balls at the end of every meal!

Better than big lantern IMO
author: Curtis L.

description: It took three phone calls and an hour and fifteen minutes to get some dried up chicken that had some unidentifiable brown sauce on it. Recommend you pass on this place.
author: Christian D.

description:
Not the best Chinese food I've ever had, but then, I didn't really like it in china either. It just occurred to me that maybe I don't like Chinese food. But Trader Joe's sells a fine orange chicken in the frozen food section..hmm
well I took some vegi medley and the s&s chicken to-go and it was so sub par. The chicken was over sauced and fatty and the vegi blend was over mushroomed and watery. Oh, and the egg drop soup tasted like nothing. And also not good a day after. Some Chinese foods taste great as left overs, this one, not so much. Okay, clear advice: don't take food to-go here.
author: Lilly K.

description: I remember the food being SO much better the first time I visited over 6+ months ago, I wonder if they had a change in ownership.  Don't think I'll be back.
author: Cianni E.

description:
My experience at Red Jade has been overall pretty good. If I had one word  to describe the food it would be "satisfactory".  I always walk out full and content but never bowled over. 

In my experience Red Jade has two strong points. The first is the service.  The hostess and servers are always welcoming, attentive and proficient. I usually receive food recommendations that fit both the group and the budget appropriate to the dining occasion. 

The second is the green onion pancakes. They are consistently good and their quality has not digressed each of the five times I have ordered them.  The pancakes come with three different sauces (hot mustard, peanut and the ubiquitous red sweet and sour) of Safeway Select quality. I find that a drizzle of soy with a splash of the house vinegar work best for me. 

Other good dishes are the Hong Kong Style pan-fried noodles with scallops and shrimp. The noodles are a nice crispy brown on the outside that gives way to wonderfully moist and chewy ones on the inside. The bok choy served with the seafood on top of the noodles is always very fresh and expertly cooked. 

I also enjoy the kung pao shrimp. I have had it three times and the shrimp is always plump, juicy and never overcooked. The sauce is just spicy enough and the veggies are usually fresh and crisp. 

Duds included the fried rice and pot stickers with the remainder of the items I have had being just meh to o.k. 

The dining room is tastefully appointed for a midrange Chinese place. I cannot say the same for the soundtrack (which can be quite loud if you are unfortunate enough to be seated by a wall speaker). 

Ultimately this is good place to meet up with friends when on a budget and am wanting to get some middle of the road Chinese.  I also like to bring people here who are non-adventurous eaters or who don't in my opinion merit a meal at  Yank Sing etc.
author: Joshua W.

description: Great service. Decent food. Inexpensive. Onion pancake appetizer is too heavy.
author: David S.

description:
Food was just ok. Spicy basil chkn was average...chowmein was full of oil.

$20 for 2 dishes - but not worth the money
author: Nitin B.

description: Desperately wish there was better Chinese food in the area! HAve tried it twice and maybe I am ordering the wrong things but had a sweet and sour chicken that had no trace of sweet or sour. Service was nice but really slow.
author: Virginia W.

description:
Mmmm.... my favorite Chinese take out that I have found in the Castro/Church area so far!

They are always very fast, decent quality, and the food is HOT! And CHEAP!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Tortillas for Moo shu wrappers? This filling was pretty good, but the tortilla thing bugged me - a lot. Maybe it was a, "oh crap, we ran out of wrappers, run over to Safeway a grab some tortillas" night. Hope so, 'cause others seem to like this place. 

With so much to choose from in SF I think this will be low on our list for a second chance.

Staff was friendly.

Food: **
Service: ***
Space/Atmosphere: ***
Value: ***
author: Saul E.

description:
Eh, there is better Chinese food around.  Ordered 3 dishes: Spicy Eggplant, Chicken Chow Fun, and Chicken with Basil, which all tasted the same. The chicken in the dishes was of poor quality - stringy and just kind of gross. The portions are quite large, but in this case leftovers weren't really welcomed.

On a better note, the fresh basil in the Chicken with Basil dish was nice as was the roasted eggplant.
author: Jessica P.

description:
We called the order in for pick -up and were told it would be ready in less than 10 min
which leads me to believe the dishes had been precooked. it was just ok food and cost $27 for two main dishes ands one app. I dont think I will return
author: Brian H.

description: This is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in San Francisco. Yummy food, good service and it's pretty quiet, good for having a conversation. I go here all the time with friends and have even taken a few dates here. Definitely try the dim sum as an appetizer, it's almost a meal in itself. Green onion pancakes, everything on the menu is fantastic. You really should try it.
author: Jesse B.

description:
The only thing better than Red Jade delivery is Red Jade right in the restaurant! 

Every patron gets a big pot of hot tea and water with lemon as soon as they're seated. Service is quick, efficient, and no-nonsense and food is reliable and craveworthy (as good as any American Chinese food, and as unshakably desirable on late nights and cold afternoons). Ambiance is pleasant, clean, relaxed, and spacious - hosts seem comfortable with the occasional lingerer, even after the bill is paid.

With lunch specials for $5.25 and speedy delivery throughout the Mission and SoMa at least, it's hard to go wrong based on bang for the buck. May need to order rice separately from your entree, though - best to get one order and share with the group.

Especially recommended: Veggie eggrolls, sesame chicken (shareable portion for $7.50), veggie fried rice. Beef with bok choy is straightforward and no-nonsense. Hot and sour soup is hot and sour, but add a half-teaspoon of duck sauce and eat around the scallions and you'll like it even more!
author: Megan G.

description:
Okay, I should start by stating that I am unusually tough on Chinese restaurants, whether upper scale or hole in the wall.  I compare them to my mom's or my grandma's cooking.  That being said, here we go:

Food = 1.  This is CHINESE-AMERICAN food, not Chinese food.  If you're okay with that, enjoy your orange chicken or cashew beef or whatever!  The food is way too salty and oily.  If Chinese people ate like this all the time, there wouldn't be over a billion of us due to heart disease!  In particular, their chicken dishes are composed of mostly dark meat (which is cool) and of that, mostly fat and skin from the dark meat (which is NOT cool.)  

Service = 1.  On the occasions I've eaten there, the service has been on par with most Chinese restaurants.  However, on the one occasion I ordered delivery from Red Jade, it was a DISASTER.  They forgot TWO of the dishes I ordered.  I had company over that night and there was just enough food.  When you are Chinese (or ABC like me), not having enough food for company is the kiss of death.  Good thing I made rice that night!

When I called Red Jade to inform them of their mistake, they kept me on hold for 5 minutes while they took other orders and when I finally got a live person, she said they would not send another deliveryman to me but they would credit me the unordered items from my next visit.  I tried to give them my info so I could be properly credited but she said, "We have your information on our computer and we will remember you next time."  Uh, don't try to be shady with me HONEY! I know your game cuz I'm Chinese too!

Atmosphere = 2.  Two stars for having a clean dining room.
author: Eddie L.

description:
Ostrich Kung Pao???
F***ing awesome!

I especially love ordering there minced chicken in lettuce cups.
author: Keika L.

description:
Red Jade is by no means the best Chinese in the city - I am not really even sure if it is the best delivery Chinese in the city.  All I know is that they deliver to my house for free and the food is solid enough so that I keep ordering from them.  

Like everyone has said, the green onion pancake is pretty good.  But only if you are sharing it because it is a serious gut buster - I repeat, do not eat the green onion pancake on your own!  It is super greasy and doughy in the best way possible.  These guys cannot do tofu, I have ordered both the ma pao and braised tofu and they were both bland.  Lesson learned, best to stick with the Americanized fare.  The black bean chow fun is decent, and the sesame chicken was pretty good.  

They deliver really quickly and give free sesame balls (they are no way as good as Yank Sing's - but they are also free so who can really complain) and steamed pork buns if you order more than $20.
author: Dana H.

description:
I've been stuck at work and this was the hidden gem my friend brought me to. I don't usually eat at Chinese restaurants, I eat a lot of Chinese cooking at home. But this place has a good meal deal - $6.75 for an entree, soup, dessert and tea. Where can you get that now-a-days? I got a taste of the Ma Po Tofu, dumplings and the walnut prawn. Ma Po Tofu was spicy with some heat to every bite. I could have done without the dumplings - it's a little too doughy for me. The walnut prawn was average but the walnuts were crunchy and candy coated - yum. 

Typical Chinese food but the quality isn't bad. I would go back again for a quick pick-up lunch or even dine in the restaurant. The best parts of the meal is the hot soup of the day at the beginning and the sesame balls & fortune cookies at the end.
author: Candace F.

description:
This place remains my usual choice for delivery Chinese food.  It's nothing amazing, but then delivery Chinese doesn't really have to be.  Let me run down some of the things I've had here.

Pot stickers - massive and always worth getting
Ma Po tofu - spiced well and really flavorful
General tso's chicken - tends to be a little mushy, but is still ok
Chicken chow fun with black bean sauce - simply rocks. 
salt and pepper squid - light  crispy batter, squid is never chewy
"special crispy tofu with seaweed" - should be avoided, as it just consists of a few flavorless cubes of fried tofu with a couple of pieces of seaweed thrown in.  
Hot and Sour Soup - a bit bland

Anyway, the food is always delivered quickly, and piping hot.  Plus with any order of $20 or more they throw in free char siu bao!  I'm a sucker for freebies, so given that, the tasty food, and the convenience of ordering on delivery.com means you have no excuse not to give Red Jade a try if you're in their delivery area.
author: Joshua W.

description: nothing wrong with the food so i'll give them 3 stars.  but the delivery service can use some work.  i get a call from the delivery guy asking me to come outside because there's no parking.  i look out my window and guess what...yep, there's parking.  i don't get it, they've done this to me 3 times already.  i normally give them about 20-25% tip when I pay for delivery.  if i end up paying a little extra for delivery without it actually getting delivered to my door, i'm moving on to a different restaurant.  i obviously have plenty of options.
author: Damon D.

description: Great, well priced tasty food for delivery! We usually order egg rolls, sweet& sour chicken and pork fried rice. All super tasty!
author: S V.

description: This place is really hit or miss to me.  Sometimes it can be good and sometimes it can be awful.  The service is fast which I like, but I just got home from ordering carry out and I guess they were too fast, perhaps gave me some chicken that was fried a while ago?  I don't know, but I ordered general tso's chicken, I live two blocks away and I'd expect the chicken to be fried to order, but I have a soft, soggy mess drenched in sauce.  After a 5-10 minute walk, the chicken shouldn't be in this condition.  This would be one of those night's when the food is awful and not worth the calories.  Gosh, guess I won't be frequenting them again.  I just wish House of Chen could be a little quicker, because I would just order from them all the time.  tsk tsk, shaking my head...
author: Kevin M.

description: My family and I were staying the weekend in San Francisco and we were near market so I yelped Chinese food and this place came up good reviews so we ordered came very quickly and very hot only thing we asked for 5 forks we got 2 and no plates we were staying in a hotel so we had to go them. We got chow mein , pork fried rice , fried prawns , pork ribs , beef broccoli and orange chicken.. Didn't care for orange chicken very dry meat and you had to add the sauce but over all good eats.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Lunch Specials for $5.25!!!

Plain, reliable, inexpensive Chinese served to you in a clean, spacious dining room.

Several CLEAN restrooms!
author: BigJohnS F.

description: I come here often for lunch because it is the best quality of Chinese food around for under $7 (lunch menu). Love this place!
author: Amalia G.

description:
The single star goes to the delivery driver who was very nice...but the food took an hour twenty to get here...so it is cold and basically inedible. And drinks were forgotten. Well, food in the trash and heading over to Hard Knox for some yummy soul food...need a good dose of comfort food after this disaster!! 

I definitely do not recommend this for delivery, unless you prefer this cuisine cold and rubbery.
author: Elle N M.

description: Food is affordable and very good. Service is fast but a little forgetful in an angry way. Also very under staffed. However, portions are huge. Te restaurant itself is clean. This was a nice dining experience.
author: Jimmie B.

description:
Ordered in from Red Jade last night. Overall, for the convenience of not having to go out, it was decent.

The food was quickly expedited, the delivery person friendly.

Wor won ton soup, not so much.
General Tso's chicken- pretty tasty!
Beef with snow peas- decent.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Red Jade has cheap $5 to $6 lunch specials during the week and is conveniently located next to Muni. For a place with such cheap lunch specials, the interior is clean and well-kept. The tables are often prepped and the numerous service staff is helpful. To-go orders are expedient. 

Most of their vegetarian food is average but I think they have the best Kung Pao tofu of anywhere. The sauce is rich. The fried tofu is firm and served steaming hot. Lunch specials end late at 5 p.m. which works for those who eat early dinners like I do. The specials come with hot and sour soup (has egg) and rice. I wouldn't recommend the Spinach Mushroom Tofu soup. It's bland. The soup is simply piping hot water with floating spinach, mushrooms and tofu.
author: Chris G.

description:
Im setting aside the problem I had with this place, and rating the review based on the food. General Tso's chicken was awesome, the pot stickers are an 8/10, Sizzling rice soup was great, Mongolian beef was so-so (a bit chewy). Overall the food was good quality, and very tasty. IT wasn't the best, but certainly good. Very affordable, I was able to feast with my wife for $30 and have plenty of leftovers.

The only problem I had was as follows. I called to find out the address and was met with a very hostile counter with the woman on the phone. I brushed it aside because I really wanted to try the food here. Well, during our meal, I noticed the woman answering the phones getting hostile with a customer. She began yelling at him, and rather loudly stated "because your bothering me" and abruptly hung up the phone on the person. I can only imagine the other person asking "why are you being so rude?" Several people in the restaurant noticed and we all looked at each other and kinda laughed. I thought it was kind of funny, but beware of the hostile woman. Maybe she was just having a bad day. 

The food is worth trying, and I will go back if in the mood, and in the area.

EDIT: I went back for a second go, and this place impressed me more, and I upped the rating to 5 stars. The Peking duck is amazing and rivals one served at the most expensive Chinese restaurant I know of in SF. The green onion pancake is also terrific.
author: Jon P.

description:
I could make this short and simply write "See Amy C.'s review."

Yesterday was a long, tough day at work.  I wanted food, easy and fast.  I ordered from Red Jade on the strength of other Yelpers' reviews, and I wasn't disappointed.  Easy ordering online.  My food arrived in just under an hour--pretty impressive for a Friday night--and it was packaged well with all of the condiment requisites, the free pork buns, and the free sesame balls.  The delivery guy was a sweetie.  The food was great. (It's American Chinese food.  If you want Chinese Chinese food, try Ton Kiang.)  I was particularly impressed with the potstickers and the hot-and-sour soup.  Tons of leftovers, and my tab, including a generous tip, was thirty smackers.

Thanks, Red Jade!  I'll be back.
author: Earline A.

description: This place is HORRIBLE! Don't go there. I ate there last night and now have a stomach flu. The vegetables were not cleaned properly and stems of the vegetables were showing decay. After eating a bit I realize why it tasted so bad so I had to return it but unfortunately it was too late for my stomach. Even if they offer free food, I would not go there.
author: S J.

description: Another place we go regularly. We always order the yang chow fried rice (cha siu, shrimp, veggie combination) and the potstickers.
author: Becky W.

description:
This is my fav new chinese place in San francisco.
I am not going back to the rest as this one trumps them all.
Reasons:
1. Great Food (pot stickers are a must have)
2. Great Service (always a smile)
3. Great Prices (lower than my other places)
4. They Deliver (although dining-in is best)
author: Mick H.

description: Our go to delivery meal when we have no time to cook and the kids want Chinese food. Favorites include green onion pancake, chicken wings, salt and pepper prawns, and black bean chow fun.
author: Cynthia L.

description: Red Jade is best for their lunch specials.  I mean, who can complain about a $7 lunch with soup, rice, and a huge portion of your order.  They also give you a fortune cookie and sesame seed ball thing with your bill.  The service is a bit lacking (expect to receive your meal before you finish your soup, but given how good the food is and the price you really can't complain.  Dinner is more pricey (but still cheap) so I usually avoid it.  Their lunch is so darn good, and you won't feel awkward going alone (at least I don't).  Definitely recommend coming here.
author: Shane E.

description:
Time of order: 7:39 PM
Time of delivery: 8:59 PM

Do I need to say anything else? I mentioned that they got the order wrong too, right?
author: Josh E.

description:
I enjoy Check Please to introduce me to new places to try for great dining experiences. Seeing the Red Jade episode in July 2013 I looked forward to trying the place. Two of the diners really 'raved' over this green onion pancake. Well I ordered one this evening, and like some of the previous comments here, it was real waste of money. It was gummy, and completely lacking in flavor. Even the sauce that comes with the dish, had no definitive flavor or punch. I later realized that it was supposed to be a peanut sauce, but it was truly bland and watered down. A small pie, it's cut in 6 slices. I ate two and declined to take the rest home.

I'm glad that someone else here, also noted the meat that was used in their beef dishes was horrible. I ordered the scallop and beef with Chinese broccoli. There were a few bits and pieces of scallops, but I swear, the meat tasted as if it had come out of a can.

Besides the really distasteful meat, I'd asked them to make the dish 'spicy'. Well it arrived with a one whole small dried red chili pepper mixed in the dish, and what amounted to the emptying of a can of chili flakes which were stir-fried with the food. Every piece of meat had several chili flakes on them. Besides too much chili, the basic sauce also lacked flavor or direction.

Okay, you might think I'm done, but my attempt to be tolerant and gracious came to an end, when a small black bug walked off of the broccoli. I tried to shoo it away, hoping it was just a gnat, but no...it wouldn't fly, it just walked around the rim of my plate.

In their favor, the waiter deducted 30% from my bill. I would not recommend the restaurant to anyone.
author: Hrt S.

description:
Finally a restaurant that makes a green onion pancake just like the one my Grandma used to make!

Decor was nice, service was good, but too bad the food was mediocre.  I probably could've just eaten the green onion pancacke and stayed away from the rest.
author: N. Monique S.

description:
eaten here many times...

why does the green onion pancake always rate high on peoples reviews?

highly overrated,,,too dry... not tasty.

meh

chicken salad is great,though
author: Brent P.

description:
Best Chinese food I've had so far in SF. Wor Wonton Soup was crowded with wontons, bok choy, barbequed pork and shrimp plus tasty broth.
Mongolian beef and spicy eggplant both hit the spot. Reasonable prices, and pleasant service round out a most pleasant dining experience.
author: Carla B.

description: The first time I came here I had the green onion pancake, and the sesame chicken. Since then I've been here about 5 times and have always ordered the same thing because they're both SOOO GOOD. Especially the green onion pancake - it's greasy, but good greasy, and it comes with what I can only describe as a peanut butter and jelly tasting sauce. It doesnt sound good, but it works really well. The sesame chicken represents the perfect chinese-american takeaway style dish. Lots of meat in a simple somewhat spicy savory sauce. I crave it about once a week and will go back a lot more when I just want something simple and delicious
author: Daniel B.

description:
Mediocre at best.  Very large portions.  Kids enjoyed it- grown ups, not so much. Might be better for vegetarian choices, but every meat dish we tried was chewy and gristly.  

We trusted Yelp on this one and it was a mistake!
author: sara m.

description: Walked into this spot while family was in town and had a really good, cheap lunch. I was surprised because most of the food I've had in the Castro sucks. I'd definitiely come back for their lunch specials.
author: Camille R.

description:
The Green Onion pancake was delightful and brought me back to my childhood when my grandmother used to make them for us. The "Happy Family" was good as well. Yet, everything else was quite disappointing for a Chinese restaurant that seems popular among the locals. Be sure to stay away from the extremely salty and garlicky soft-shell crab. Lastly, DO NOT order the seaweed soup, it was the most disgusting thing i've tasted in a while.

Overall, it was a clean and nicely decorated place, it's just too bad that the food isn't up to par.
author: George S.

description: Red Jade is proof that inexpensive food does not equal bad food.  I had absolutely no complaints.  Everything was fresh and colorful, like it should be.  Two people plus a 25+% tip and it was still under $20.  Take a look at the  picture of my meal (portabello mushrooms and shrimp)  :)
author: Jesse M.

description:
I have been in the hunt for the best scallion pancake in the city and Red Jade takes the crown. Their scallion pancake is absolutely delicious. It is thick, crunchy in the outside and soft on the inside. it also comes with a side of peanut butter sauce... It is very filling but definitely Yummy!!

Other dishes are okay... If you're looking for actually better quality general Chinese food go to HOUSE OF CHEN just a block or 2 away on Noe st. it is WAY better..

Red jade's chow mein is not that good, and their lemon chicken to-go was pretty awful..., but if you go you absolutely cannot walk out till you try their green onion/scallion pancake... You won't regret it..
author: NC B.

description:
Red Jade....great Chinese food for the price and they deliver too!

Im a pretty big fan of the Green Onion Pancake but it seems like everything we've ever ordered from Red Jade has been wonderfully satisfying. So as far as Chinese food goes, you can't go wrong with ordering from this restaurant.
author: Courtney C.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! the delivery was fast and prompt.  My food was hot and delicious!! 

This is the only place, I call and consider for take-out.  Plus you receive a free complimentary order of pork-buns with your order. I was suprised!  

PS- i LOVE THE SESAME BALLS!
author: LoLa L.

description:
This was the first time I had been to this restaurant and I was pleased.  The atmosphere is clean and comfortable and the price was good for the quantity of food you get.  The pot stickers were great.  They had a very nice zing of fresh ginger.   We also ordered bbq chow mein - not too saucy or greasy, Mu shu - excellent, and three mushroom chicken - makes me happy in my tummy!!!   I am a mushroom LOVER and this dish was great!

It was all standard Mandarin fare (they do offer two Ostrich dishes but they were out or we would have gotten them) but well made.  I would definitely go back.

Aya says "Yea."
author: Aya M.

description: I lived in the Mission in SF for 7 years and this is my favorite standard Americanized Chinese restaurant within walking of Mission and 16th BART. They have all the standards done well (love the pot-stickers, wonton soup, chow fun) as well as house specials like ostrich. They do so much takeout the driver is in and out the whole time. Also a takeout favorite of the local SFPD from what I can tell.
author: Andreas T.

description: After ordering a delivery from them last night and having a pretty negative experience, I felt compelled to write an awful review.  The delivery was pretty quick, but the food was horrendous.  DO NOT ORDER THE ORANGE CHICKEN... The chicken itself looked half frozen and came with a container of the orange sauce.  It was truly petrifying and actually kind of hilarious that they thought they could pass it off as a legitimate order of chicken.  Never again.
author: Mary C.

description:
I am deducting one of Red Jade's stars (and a delivery's person entire tip).  I cannot even express the level of jaskassery I experienced while calling in my delivery order this evening to Red Jade.

My FIRST phone call (there were two) was extremely rushed and I felt like I was the least important customer they ever had.  I was about to tell them I needed to pay with my credit card, when...he hung up on me!  

Now, I'm all for free food, but I didn't think it would go down that way when the delivery person arrived on my doorstep, so I did the right thing and called back.  I spoke to the same man the second time, and after telling him I needed to pay with my card, he literally yelled "please hurry up! I'm so busy!!" at me over the phone.  I HATE to be rushed by customer service persons, so that made me want to go even slower.  I asked him to please calm down, and gently read him my credit card info.  Afterwards, he felt it necessary to let me know that he had 10 more phone calls after me.  Which is fine, apparently they're recession proof, good for you Red Jade.  But don't make me, a paying customer, feel like my business is unwanted.  

So when that delivery guy gets here, he will not be receiving a tip.  I will let him know that it is not his fault, and hopefully things will just work themselves out.

Red Jade, I will still order from you, but don't let that guy answer the phone.  Stick him on bathroom duty or something.  Thanks!
author: m a r l a s.

description: If you're into slow food, this is your place! I used to like Red Jade...their food was decent (not great) and they're only ten minutes from my house for delivery. But the last two times I've ordered from them the delivery was inexcusably slow...over an hour the last time and an hour and a half tonight. I knew they would get busy on a Friday night, so I called and placed my order at 4:20 pm. It was almost 6:00 pm when it finally arrived. Good food goes bad when it sits around (or rides around) for 90 minutes. When I called after an hour of waiting to ask where my food was I got the standard response, "Oh, he'll be there any minute now." Well, he arrived after thirty more minutes with cold food and a bill for $50. I could drive to the restaurant in ten minutes and pick up my food, if there was anywhere to park. There isn't because all of Church Street is a bus zone now. Frankly, unless you're walking in to eat there, Red Jade isn't worth it. It's hard to believe you can get bad Chinese food in San Francisco, but Red Jade manages to prove that you can.
author: Kenneth O.

description:
This is a tough review because I actually really like the freshness and flavors that Red Jade produces, but I saw something today that killed my appetite. I went in to order take out, and saw the cook chain smoking cigarettes. Every time the employees opened the kitchen door I saw the cook taking a drag, even holding the cig in one hand while flipping a wok in the other hand. Now I know Chinese restaurants are not known for their cleanliness and that it's always an "Eat at your own risk" kind of event, but can't they at least smoke outside??

They have great lunch specials for affordable prices and the freshness is always there. The flavors have diminished in the years that I've been going there, but they still top a lot of other places I've tried. 

Eat at your own risk.
author: Foodie F.

description: I ws really diappointed when I went here yesterday. I don't know if they got a new cook or what but the food wasn't good at all.
author: Ayana K.

description: CHEAP BRUNCH SPECIALS!!!! Nothing out of the ordinary, but the prices are very reasonable and the service is FAST.
author: Liz W.

description:
For a neighborhood chinese restaurant, Red Jade is pretty damn good. We've tried they're pot stickers, orange beef, happy family (sauteed prawns and candied walnuts), chow mein, eggplant and spicy tofu with seaweed, all of which was delicious. 

Fast delivery, promising food, convenient and well-priced.
author: Emily I.

description:
I came here on this past Monday night with some friends after a brutal cardio work out at 24 hour fitness down the street.  This was my first experience eating at Red Jade and as many of you know, I am open to all sorts of experiences.

First impressions:
1) Clean
2) Fast seating
3) Moderately priced
4) Well-prepared food

Yet, the staff, while initially courteous, mixed up our order forgot our duck and then, after forgetting our duck told us that the KITCHEN WAS CLOSED....*breathe*....okay, I'm practicing ZEN....and going to my happy place now.

The chicken and sweet corn soup is tasty, not at all oily.  The spicy salted spare ribs were also very tasted.  The food came out quickly.

 I hope to go back to try additional things on the menu to provide some more feedback.
author: Hiromi N.

description: Ordered delivery tonight. First time I was disappointed with my food. Ordered orange chicken for the first time. The meat was  tough, tasteless and had that freezer burn and unsightly rough  off yellow winkled  edges. The rest of the fare I ordered also did not meet my previous expectations. Maybe it was an off night, a new chef, or I was wondering it had changed in ownership.
author: Vincent D.

description: I love the food here!  It has become a Sunday tradition to order from the Red Jade.  They deliver all the way to Bernal Heights!  I recommend ordering online.  My favorite dish is vegetarian hot and sour soup.
author: Kate J.

description: FOOD WAS ON POINT!!! But the service wasn't as good :( We had to keep asking and waited for a long time for water refills. When we tried to order they weren't as helpful, our server didn't understand or speak English very well and we could tell he was getting frustrated when we kept repeating or rephrasing our questions about the menu. However, I have to give the food credit, IT WAS AWESOME! so for the food YES COME HERE! Just hope you we get a better server next time.
author: Tiana M.

description:
Got a Chinese food craving? COME HERE!
 
You won't be disappointment.

Besides the amazing prices for their lunch specials, 5-7$(soup, meal, dessert) until 5pm. The portions are very satisfying! My appetite is huge, and I have always walked out of here full with a smile.

I've known about Red Jade for about a decade. I've came here on several occasions. Each time was a tasty treat. The mood/decor is enjoyable, the servers are very attentive. 

All in all I couldn't wait to yelp this place after another mouth watering experience today!
author: Tip S.

description: I LOVE this place! great food, clean restaurant and right off MUNI!
author: MaryEllen F.

description:
It was nice and SUNNY day at Dolores Park, I was in 20th and church right by the muni, enjoying sunshine!! I was too lazy so grab my phone and called RED JADE for delivery!

YES! they delivered to me in Dolores Park! while I was on my speedos.. :-) LOVE IT!!

BEST CHINESE FOOD IN SAN FRANCISCO!!
they have great customer service!
FAB-TASTICK! tasty FOOD!! 
Price is great for budget!
nice LUNCH deals..
author: Aemar E.

description:
For quick, low cost delivery, Red Jade is the best Chinese in Lower Haight.  Took about 15 minutes from phone to door, arrived hot and tasted delicious.   I highly recommend the General Tso's Tofu - crispy, sweet, spicy perfection.

Also, as others have said, the free pork buns and dessert ice the cake.  They even mark them "free" so you don't think you paid for something you didn't order.  Priceless.
author: Eliot W.

description: I just don't get the negative reviews I just read. What's the matter Yelp? They not advertising or something? The food here is terrific. Reasonably priced and delicious. the green onion pancake....great. Pot stickers have just the right amount of ginger. Delicious. My favorite is the beef and green beans. Yum. And try the house special chow fun. Its not on the menu...you have to ask for it. And get it dry rather than "wet". It has that smoky taste and being the house special, has chicken/beef/pork and shrimp. the lunch specials are super bargains. My favorite lunch special is the hunan lamb. I always get it mild. Seriously, this place is awesome. And their Wor Won Ton Soup? What's with all this hatin? Its great
author: George K.

description: Sesame chicken is something I crave!   Good solid Chinese food.  Generally bad service but cheap prices so I let the service slide.   :-)
author: Daniel A.

description: General Tso's spicy chicken order that and team it up with some steamed rice you will leave happy!!! Only reason it's not getting the 5 stars from me is cause they charged me a premium fee for a can of soda when I order a soda I don't expect a glass and a can didn't vibe well with me! But other than that it's supreme!!! Yelpers.
author: Richard P.

description: Adorable lunch. Fills you, but doesn't weigh you down. They also have fast delivery around Castro, Dubois Triangle and Upper Market.
author: Arn E.

description: I had ordered delivery and they arrived late. They had said it would take 45-60 mins for the food to arrive and I got my order after a 70 min wait. I was ok with it at first with the order arriving 10 mins late but that should have been the first sign. I had ordered the garlic baby bok choy and it was overcooked and mushy, also the mushu pork that was ok, and the worst of all the beef chow fun. I had found a cigarette butt in it! This place is very unsanitary and disgusting. I would warn everyone to NOT order from this place and definitely check the yelp reviews first.
author: Windie W.

description: We had great experiences at Red Jade in the past 3 visits.  I ordered 'Chinese Crispy Chicken' for take out tonight.  What a mistake.  It was the worst Chinese Crispy Chicken I ever had.  It was greasy,  been done hours if not days ago, using stale grease, then reheated.  Nothing remotely close to what should be offered.  I know since I am Chinese,  grew up in Hong Kong.  My suggestion to Red Jade is to strike that item from their menu,  they clearly have no idea how to do a good Crispy Chicken.    Most of the other items they do well,  so disappointing.  There are too many great Chinese restaurants in the city for us to revisit Red Jade.
author: Linda R.

description:
I was starving on the evening of Sunday, July 4th and Red Jade was open. I ordered sizzling rice soup, pork fried rice and broccoli beef. The food was delivered under 25minutes and was absolutely delicious.

I highly recommend this place for delivery or eat in.
author: David F.

description: I have been looking for a good chinese restaurant that was comparable to this place I went and loved as a kid called Fountain Court. Well I think I have found it and with very much delight! Red Jade is no joke about their green onion pancake my god that is the best I have ever had! The potstickers and the free pork buns were delicious to the max. I had the mongolian beef which is really good but liked my mom's kung pao better. Another time my dad got the salt and pepper golden calamari which is to die for. I am so glad they deliver to the inner sunset I have been thinking of trying this place for a while since seeing it on Check please! I am so glad I did but it is a little oily just a wee bit of a warning but all in all good bang for your back!
author: Nadia N.

description:
We tried four dishes: two delivered and two at the restaurant. Delivery was fast and courteous. Service at the restaurant was attentive and friendly, and the decor pleasingly modern. Portions were huge and the prices were remarkably low.

But ... the dishes were disappointingly tasteless and afterwards we decided that they all tasted very similar. The vegetables did not taste fresh and the chicken in the chicken dishes were tough and stringy. The vegetable Chow Mein was heavy on the noodles and light on the vegetables.

You can't beat the price or the quantity though!
author: Geoff L.

description:
Feeling sick again, time for Chinese food. And guess what I realized? You can order online! The whole thing, and you get a confirmation email and everything.

So cool.
author: Radha S.

description:
Was nice of them to deliver to us on Christmas, but I don't get why the food got here in like 10 minutes. What would be a dream to some is mildly unsettling to me. Insta-gelatinous-goo-mess hot + sour soup? Check. General Tso's Cardboard/Chicken? Yup. Nope. Sorry guys, good 
"service" but no thanks.
author: Anjali B.

description:
Two friends and I went to lunch here to celebrate my return to San Fran. We walked into this place, located on a pretty street near the Castro Safeway. There wasn't anyone seating people, so we just sat at a table and a waiter came over quickly.

The others got the beef and broccoli, I got the vegetarian Kung Pao.

The restaurant was about half-filled, but it still only took five minutes for us to get our food, a period in which they also brought out soup for us. 

Portionwise, it was perfect: enough to finish a meal and not have any carry out. The Kung Pao was a good amount of spicy for the meal: not burrito hot, but still enough to start the sweat. Tasty, well done, and a nice variety of vegetables to mix with the rice and tofu. 

The cost for all of us was under $19. Most of the meals on the menu were reasonably priced and the meals come with a side of rice, or soup if you want. 

Overall, I definitely plan to return. If you are someone who wants a restaurant where they fawn over you, this is not your type of place, but if you like being left alone with your company and want a cheap deal on Chinese food, this is your place.
author: Jake W.

description:
I am literally addicted to this place!

Their General Tso's chicken is the best i've ever had!!!

The lunch deals they have are soooo cheap and ridiculously amazing!!! I think I spent $6 bucks on the best hot and sour soup + General Tso's Chicken + rice. Where else can you get the best chinese food for cheap!?!

:) ABSOLUTELY love this place. 

ps. it's fast and amazing service. in and out in 30 mins!!!
author: Ellary C.

description:
If I would describe the Red Jade's delivery service in one word it would be: Inconsistent.
So far I've ordered their delivery three times and have ordered some appetizers, entrees, vegetable dishes, etc.
I decided to try this place more than twice to make my decision if I would order from them again and so far I would say its just less than an o.k. and will not order from them again. 
I got to admit its pretty awesome that they give you some extra items with each order but its still doesn't justify the fact that they're less than mediocre.
author: Brenda I.

description:
I was Very Pleased with my RED JADE experience
I love San Francisco for many reasons and RED JADE has just added another check mark for reasons to visit the City By the Bay. The service was friendly and speedy and the food was absolutely amazing. I highly Recommend the Green Onion Pancakes they were to die for and their Won Ton Soup was the best I've had since the early days of my childhood. Red Jade has made me forgo eating any more Chinese cuisine in my current city, Stockton, for my family and I have vowed we would not eat another bit of Chinese without it coming from RED JADE
author: Dustin B.

description:
My brother-in-law recommended this place for dinner last night and instead of going to our usual spot in the city to order we went here. We ordered green onion pancakes, sweet n' sour pork, crispy beef, dry fried chicken wings, pan fried noodles and beef chow fun. 

Loved the green onion pancakes, arrived crispy especially since we had everything delivered. Other places it would be mushy by now. Everything else was good as well.

I will be ordering from them again. I want to try their lunch special who can say no to lunch specials til 5pm Awesome.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Delivery portions are huge.  Free sesame balls if you order $15+. Free steamed pork buns if you order $20+.

Flavors are clean/tasty.  Nothing to dream about but does the trick.

Scallion pancakes are indeedy the best I think I've ever had.  Fluffy, chewy, flaky, perfect.

Menu is somewhat different since it's Mandarin when many/most delivery places in the city are Cantonese.
author: Melanie C.

description:
Just discovered that they delivered in my area so I took advantage on a cold night when I was craving takeout (I've never been to the restaurant itself so can't comment on decor, service, etc).

Delivery arrived in about 45 minutes.  The spicy string beans with shredded pork was actually really good, the yellow chicken curry not so much.  I also liked the egg rolls.

Nothing spectacular but decent, filling food at pretty good prices.  No complaints here!
author: F. P.

description: Decent to delicious food - depending on chef on duty, but solid Chinese fare in the Mission/Castro area and good prices, fresh food.  Great lunch special before 5pm.  Sometimes they skimp on sauce, which always makes me sad, but usually great.  Waitstaff are friendly and welcoming, but sometimes can rush you if it's a busy evening.  Overall good stuff.  I recommend it.  Eggplant tofu dish is delicious.
author: Saweni S.

description: I hope my review did not come off insensitive to race.  I just meant that I don't like to eat sweet and sour shrimp.  I like the same foods (well minus the meat) that the staff eats at the staff meal.  The "white boy" comment is my take on Chinese places that have like two menus, one for non chinese and one for chinese.  I want to order from the "chinese" menu.  THis place has geared the whole menu to non=chinese.  Therefore that is what I what was referencing.  K?
author: Christopher F.

description: DO NOT eat their shellfish or you will be sorry. I had the prawns and scallops special on Thursday night. I woke up Friday morning with the worst food poisoning I've ever had. I had to spend an entire day lying in bed, missing two holiday parties and a concert for which I'd already bought a ticket. I will never forgive Red Jade. Please learn from my mistake.
author: Jason L.

description: I got delivery from here. I really liked the food, the service was fast, so in the end I was impressed.
author: Amy E.

description:
Your typical nasty greasy sugary thick and msg'ee Chinese food.  We  fried rice passable as Panda's and wonton soup, which wasn't half-bad actually.  We ordered kung pao chicken and beef in black bean sauce and, I kid you not, the only difference was chicken and peanuts in one, and beef -- if you can call that beef -- in the other.  

Then again, we did ask for it, ordering Chinese food from just about anywhere.  Yeah, spoiled by San Tung.

All that said, we scarfed it proper.  It came with free sesame balls, pork buns, and not insignificant indigestion.
author: Bill S.

description:
There aren't many Chinese places in the Mission/Castro area. This is one of the only few...

Came here for lunch. Usually when I crave Chinese food, it means I crave fried rice cooked on a big wok with a big big fire. So naturally, I ordered the fried rice with chicken. Decent fried rice, much better than the super soy saucy one at Big Lantern on 16th St, but not the best I've had. Good amount of salt and didn't make me thirsty afterwards. Rice was a good texture. They had carrots and peas in it with pretty tender chicken. Could've had some more garlic and white pepper. I also got the egg flower soup, which was ok. Just ok.

Service was friendly and quick. I was REALLY REALLY impressed by how clean the bathroom was.

Spent $11 (tip included), which is good for lunch. All in all, I think this will now be my go-to for fried rice. Sunflower has really crap fried rice and Thanh Tam sometimes has sketchy fried rice. We'll give Red Jade a go and see how things turn out. =)
author: Angela H.

description:
I was in the neighborhood and stopped in.  Red Jade was busy, so I thought it had promise.  Boy was I wrong.

A table was quickly cleared and I was seated.  Given 30 seconds to look at the menu, a waiter stopped by to take my order.  I asked for another minute.  Another waiter stopped by to take my order after another 30 seconds, so I ordered.

Quick quick quick.  Why is every worker in this restaurant moving so fast?  There are so many waiters and they are all moving at this ridiculously fast speed.  Slow down, please.  It was the least relaxing meal I have ever had.

I ordered the pot stickers.  They were pretty okay.  They came out pretty quick (seems to be the theme at Red Jade).  For the main meal, I ordered the spicy tangy chicken and asked for brown rice instead of white.  It wasn't a problem or an extra charge, which was nice.  Unfortunately, the brown rice tasted old and half cooked.  The spicy tangy chicken was good, but the chicken pieces were oddly small--think peanut sized.  It was odd.  The prices were all pretty good, but I would have gladly paid a little more for something special (and properly cooked brown rice).

And then I sat.  The mad rush of waiters running by, holding up two fingers and shouting as people came into the door, "Two? Two?! Right here!" and pointing to a table.  Then quickly running off to take care of something else.

And I sat some more.  15 minutes after finishing my meal, my beer, my water, the check was brought to me.  I sat down my credit card and WHOOSH! another waiter snapped it up as he ran by and took care of the check.  Gah!

There  are too many other restaurants in San Francisco--I won't be coming back here.

(And then I left to get on Muni--wishing that quickness was at least their style)
author: Jason S.

description:
Since they're reliable for delivery I keep coming back.

I take back what I said about the soup - i think they were having an off night.  It's fine, great, good.  They'll even leave the meat out if you prefer (love that).

the one item i can't live without is the scallion pancakes.  So yum.  thick and sweet and fried and even good cold the next morning (if any ever last that long).

delivery is reliable and speedy.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Check please... 

That's the last time I take culinary  advice from a Muni driver.  

I was really hoping this place was going to get me out of my crummy Sf Chinese mall food experience I have had as of late. Hey don't hate - I did read the Fortune Cookie Chronicles there's some truth to my statement. 

OK, the place was packed for lunch and it was your blue collar crowd which implies large portion at a good value. The service was good even though they got my order wrong: I wanted String beans not braised beans and the crispy tofu not so crispy. The stir-fried prawns with Jade greens more green then Jade-not to sound like Gorge but four prawns!!! I did like their salt and paper pork which was juicy and plentiful and this is one of my favorite dishes and Red Jade's menu still has plenty of classics that I'm willing to try. 

I guess still in a Chinese funk for now.
author: swys -.

description:
I tried their ma pao tofu with pork recently.  It doesn't taste like ma pao tofu I've had before but I still really liked it.  So much so that after eating all the tofu, I added a new box of soft tofu to the sauce to make it last longer. 

The service is also nice. We went to dine in but changed our minds half way through.  They promptly boxed up our food without acting like we're an imposition (although I did feel bad, so I tipped better).
author: Yan E.

description:
This place is a gem. The food is very good for a Chinese restaurant in the  City and they are courteous and fast!   I love their dry cooked scallops and beef dishes - yummy!

I have friends from out of town that always want to come here at least once when they visit.
author: john h.

description:
Really glad we came here on Friday night. Not only did we get there before a rush of people showed up, but it really hit the spot. 
We ordered the green onion pancake that people have mentioned and it was my favorite green onion pancake that I can recall having in SF, Portland, Seattle... many many cities. :)  Thick, crisp on the outside, and a little bit doughy on the inside. YUM!
The combination wonton soup was done well, and came out steaming hot in a huge white bowl. General Tso's chicken tasted great - not too greasy and not like heavy lumps of densely battered meat - these were light, slightly crispy, and just the right amount of sauce. We also ordered the Spicy salt and pepper soft shell crab to try something different instead of getting salt and pepper calamari. It was a delicious choice - 3 whole soft shell crabs, love the mix of garlic and peppers liberally sprinkled on top.

Overall - food was great and inexpensive, service was attentive and just right.
author: Marina K.

description: I have dined in as well as ordered delivery.   Though mostly the latter.   I'd say on average I have a delivery once a week.   The speed of delivery ranged anywhere from 20 mins to 90 mins.   I'd say on average it's been 40 to 60 mins.   This place offers good value for good dishes.   I usually get their fried dumplings, spicy and salty fish, combination chowmein, singaporean noodle, sweet and sour fish.   I've also ordered the peking duck once.   Delivery orders require a min of $15 (incl. tax).   For orders over $20, they give complimentary char siu bao (two).    Don't forget to tip your delivery guy!
author: Kelly M.

description:
Yum! 

My favorite Chinese place to order delivery from.

I enjoy the green onion pancakes, mongolian lamb, and the bbq pork buns / sesame balls that come free with my order!
author: Madeline F.

description:
Imagine, if you will, a group of misfits who are each individual yet fit together like an intricate puzzle. A socialite, a sadist, a nerd, a dictator, a pacifist, a philosopher, a comedian, an idealist or any other personality you can conjure up. Now imagine 12 of them descending upon an unsuspecting staff, a little drunk, a titch loud and devilishly hungry. That was our group when we entered this establishment. 

Our party was boisterous and I would assume bordering on obnoxious but the staff here handled us all with grace. They brought us a variety of food, some awesome, some okay and some that has me wondering why I ate it but all plentiful, fast (almost too fast) and inexpensive. The atmosphere was a relaxing, typical Chinese decor, but without the stifling crowded feeling you get from some Chinese restaurants.

It is often said the company you choose can add to or subtract from your perception of a place, and I think this is absolutely true. I would give this place 3 stars for the food, but because the people here allowed me to enjoy the company of those I was with while remaining nearly invisible in the process (sans the tons of food and drink that just kept appearing and disappearing when the plates and glasses were empty) I give the experience an extra star. We were all thanked, invited back and allowed to be the farcical group we are without judgment. Oh, and my fortune promised me an off road adventure (in bed) ....who wouldn't return after that!?
author: Drue C.

description:
"The coming month shall bring you much happiness....(in bed)"
Sounds good!  And that little fortune came at the end of the meal!
 
Every time I go out for Chinese I always hate myself.  I always eat too much, feel bloated and totally un-sexy afterward, and remember why i don't really go out for Chinese.  With that being said, everything we ate tonight was pretty tasty, which is why i feel like a cow right now.  The green onion pancake appetizer was delightful. General Tso's boneless chicken dish was top notch.  The mu shu tasted as mu shu should, and the other 100 dishes the 12 of  us ordered were satisfactory as well.  OK, we didn't order 100 dishes, but it sure felt that way.  The only odd choice was the ketchup spaghetti that we ended up with.  That's not what it was called, but that is sure what it resembled and tasted like.  Also...they were out of ostrich.  I almost left after I heard that.. What kind of decent Chinese food establishment runs out of ostrich???

ps...does it shock you that i wrote this immediately after getting home tonight.???
author: Lauren F.

description:
I wasn't even hungry when I walked in.  I ate just a few hours before I came.  I was only interested in the company of my friends... and throwing dagger eyes to my nemesis: Lauren S.

Then some kind of pancake thing arrived.  People recommended that I try some.  I took a bite.  It was delicious, like little angels made entirely of onion dancing on my tongue.

The next plate came around, this time with some sweet-and-sour spaghetti-looking concoction.  I figured I'd try it.  Not half bad.

The next thing I know, the well trained staff of Red Jade inundated our table with plate after plate full of delicious food.  Our crew erupted like a pride of lions descending upon a fallen gazelle.

At the end, I patted my very full belly and gazed upon my fortune: "You'll be more productive at work if you have a little fun this weekend."
author: Christopher K.

description: Last time I got some vegetable fried rice delivered and the broccoli in the rice were ice cold.  And the princess prawns weren't as good as usual, they seemed kinda soggy from the moisture inside of the container.  I still order from this place a lot though, they deliver pretty fast.  4 stars for this update.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
My sister-in-law recently lost her mom...

After the memorial service, we were invited to dine with the family at the Red Jade Restaurant.

For the number of people that needed to be served at once - I must say that they were very efficient about taking our orders then getting the food served to quickly. The family style portions were very generous and reasonably priced. 

The sizzling rice soup was a bit on the bland side - but the other dishes that came our way were well seasoned at piping hot from the kitchen.

There was a blur of dishes that came from the kitchen and settled on to the table before us. So many that I had a hard time keeping track of what was being placed in front of me.

This is definitely a place to come if you have a large group and would like fast and efficient service.
author: Mercy B.

description:
Just like others, I saw the episode of "Check Please" and was like "whaaaa? a restaurant 2 blocks from me got such good ratings? I must go!" . Apparently other people also saw that episode (freaky, isn't it?) and decided to show up.

There's a line outside. But any decent restaurant in SF has a line outside on a weekend. We put our name down, and ask the host "how long is the wait?". She say, "20-30 minutes". OK, we decide to checkout the bookstore next door (aside: it's a great bookstore, sells gently-used books, a definite must-visit). 
10 minutes later, we come back and find our names crossed out. What? The lady says "I called you but you not here!" . But... but... you said 20-30 minutes! OK, back to waiting again.

We are seated, and promptly ask for the scallion pancakes.

Now, let me tell you. Scallion pancakes, aka "tsun yu bin" (probably butchered that name), is my absolute mostest favoritest Chinese dish.  Because Cheap Eats raved about it, I had decided to come here.

Imagine my surprise when they said, "we're out". What the.... ? How can you be *out* of scallion pancakes?? Do you get them from some store???

Anyways: the lack of scallion pancakes was an ominous sign. We ordered a few more things ("sizzling rice soup", etc.) and they were totally mediocre.

The reviewers on "cheap eats" must've been *really lucky* the day they visited, for I found nothing to rave about in this meal. It was no different than any of the 1000s of cheap Chinese places scattered all over the Bay Area. 

3-stars for the food (mediocre), -1 star for running out of their "star" dish.
author: A J.

description:
Oh yes. The Gourmet Carousel* of the Castro. That's exactly what I needed. More shitty Chinese food in my life. The free fried sesame ball was actually the best part of my meal. 

* http://www.yelp.com/biz/qlA-O6c4-lp092I6kzibUA?hrid=NTgxT10iusircPilzDZS1A
author: Maria D.

description:
Pop quiz hot shot: a dozen Yelpers walk in your door at 8:30pm on a Monday night. What do you do? WHAT DO YOU DO?

Take a page out of this places book.

I have to say I was thoroughly impressed by them. Within minutes of ordering food it started flowing out of the kitchen. We should have had a conveyor belt to just pass it around the table. The way the plates were going reminded me of one of those circling tie racks...or at the dry cleaners (weren't we going to order fewer items than people at the table...what happened to that???).

We had the combination plate appetizer which I really liked, especially the crab rangoon (sp?). Then I had some fried rice, mu shu pork, and General Tsaos chicken. There was a lot more items on the table but I kept it pretty simple. The chicken I really liked, the mu-shu I've had better. I didn't have the funny ketchup noodles because it just looked like yuck.

I can't say what the service would be like on a busy night, but for us it was attentive and not overbearing. They were quick to remove empty plates so that we had some more table space, even taking half empty plates and putting the remaining food on smaller plates. Ok, so the little things matter to me. 

Overall, I would come back here...I might even find out if they deliver to the upper Haight.

And my fortune: Your magnetic personality will draw people to you this month ... in bed.
author: Laura D.

description:
I would say the only thing I liked about this was the Crab Rangoon I ordered. 

The Mongolian Beef was yucky. I tasted one bite and then threw it in the fridge to where I eventually just tossed it out.  

The chinese broccoli was wayyy to soggy for its own good. And the oyster sauce I requested with it was soo watered down that it didn't taste so great. 

The only other perk to this is they gave me free BBQ Pork Buns and sesame bun with this.
author: Helen V.

description: Red jade has some tasty awesome generals chicken and fried rice. The servers are nice but a little rushed and always hovering around to take any dish you might not be using anymore. Extremely nice or do they just want you in and out? You be the judge! ;)
author: Alex R.

description: this is a great spacious place on church and market. parking is not that great so you can park at safeway and walk there. the food is awesome. my favorite is hunan beef and the green onion pancakes. the price is very low and you get a lot of food for it. one of the things i really like about this place is that the lunch special is till 4pm. this place is really nice and clean. servers are really nice.
author: Ma S.

description: Had the mongolian beef, not what I'm used to but was good.  The egg soup was good and of course have to mention the scallion pancakes.  For the price, you can't beat this place.  Service is good too!!!
author: K W.

description:
First, I've got to give credit to the staff here. When 13 of us walked in without any notice, they immediately pulled a few tables together and seated us within a minute or two. The service was attentive and the kitchen timed the dishes perfectly. They also put up with us graciously as we read fortunes aloud and added 'in bed' to the end as if it were incredibly original and hilarious, even though I'm sure I could hear their eyes rolling.

The food itself wasn't bad either. Fried rice, mango chicken, mu-shu pork, standard Chinese restaurant fare. Ostrich is on the menu but wasn't available at the time. We had a tomato chow mein dish that was a lot like spaghetti with ketchup (which is the only thing I wouldn't recommend) and General Tso's chicken as well.

Tso Tsingtung (1812-1885) was a brilliant Chinese general during the Qing dynasty. Merciless and effective on the battlefield, his army put down the Taiping and Nian rebellions and reclaimed portions of Xinjiang from invaders.

He was not known for his cooking. General Tso's chicken by most accounts was invented at one Chinese restaurant or another in NYC in the 1970s. Having grown up eating Chinese food on a regular basis, I have been taught to dismiss this dish as inauthentic, something created for western tastes. And it is, but I'll order it again in a heartbeat next time I'm eating at Red Jade. it's good here. 

If you're nearby and you want a quick decent meal, Red Jade is worth checking out.
author: matthew r.

description:
This place is eerily similar to Eliza's on California. A Chinese restaurant with good flavor and authentic servers in a distinctly non-Chinese location...one in Pac Heights, the other in the Castro.

Like a ton of folks here, I came here when my mom saw "Check Please Bay Area" and said we needed to try it. I had my doubts, and they were quickly erased. After a brief 10 minute wait, we started on scallion pancakes (chong you bing) which was crispy hot and flavorful. The appetizer plate was a fantastic deal with two each of pot stickers, crab rangoon, egg rolls, and fried chicken. The crab rangoon was rich and soooo sinful. The chicken wing was crispy with good batter but the chicken meat itself had no flavor. The hot mustard that came with this plate was a tad spicy but AWESOME. It also came with a decent sweet and sour sauce and a rather disappointing peanut sauce. 

We settled on a plate of beef chow fun (my staple Chinese comfort food) and an order of black bean asparagus. Both were solid.

Make no mistake. This is not a relaxing Chinatown or Clement Street dining place. You're surrounded by a lot of retarded white folks asking for General Tso's chicken and giggling at words that don't fall into their vocabulary. If you are amused by this kind of ridiculous American-ness, enjoy. If not, then stick to those two places.

In the mean time I'll be back here if only for that hot mustard.
author: Aaron F.

description:
This is my come-too inexpensive chinese restaurant  in this area, when I'm in a Chinese food mood. There are only two dishes that I always get, when I come here. The Basil with chicken or Double Mushroom chicken.  

So, one fine saturday, for lunch I decided to try something else for a change...I ordered the Spicy Hunan Fish.... tasty, but slightly salty, which was a bit overpower, all in all I got through it and my blood pressure returned to normal.

I like this place, inexpensive lunch, the staff are friendly, the seating is quick and the soup is quick to get to the table as well, and its very clean...

My only complaint about RJ is the strong odor of Windex that they really need to go easy on; It is super strong to the point of smelling it from three doors down} this explains the 4 stars!
author: Valerie D.

description:
Last night, the phone rang and tore me from my Sunday afternoon drunken slumber.  Here's how the conversation transpired:

Red Jade Lady: "Why you no answer door?"
Me: "Huh? Who is this?"
RJL: "This Red Jade!  We try to deliver food but you no answer!  You still want?"
Me: "Yeah, we still want our food.  You tried to deliver already?"
RJL: "Yes, we try many time.  This time you make sure to answer door!"

Upon hanging up the phone, I discovered six messages, four of which were from the delivery guy trying to rouse me to the door to accept his food.  I'm not sure who the other two were from because I didn't bother listening.

If Red Jade will put up with my nonsense and STILL deliver my order after I dissed them 45 minutes earlier thanks to far too many margaritas and shots of whiskey, I'll gladly patronize them again.
author: Marcus C.

description: This restaurant is not good.  You can find cheaper and better Chinese restaurants in the Sunset or Richmond neighborhoods. I don't think I'll ever come back unless I'm dying of starvation.
author: Gregory D.

description: Ordered delivery.  Appreciated the convenience of their online delivery process, but I was very disappointed with the food, which was mediocre at best.  Poor chicken quality, the ma po tofu tasted like vinegar.  Very disappointing.  Wouldn't order from here again despite the convenience.
author: Sarah T.

description: The sesame chicken and orange chicken were edible (maybe good), but wtf happened with the rest of the food. The mongolian beef tasted like absolute crap. The beef was definitely old (like leave out the steak in the sun smelly old). How the f do people give this place more than 2 maybe 3 stars. The bok choy beef also tasted the same. The BBQ pork dim sum was good actually. But I didn't really enjoy the food because of that beef.
author: Brandon R.

description:
Solid take out! You can order online and not talk to a single person if you like!

I recommend the mango special. I've had it with tofu and prawns with added spice and it was very tasty.  Everything I have gotten here is very good and if you like it spicy I would recommend having your own hot sauce because it is all seems to run rather medium in my opinion.

Very quick and friendly delivery makes this my #1 Chinese delivery place.
author: Allegra F.

description:
For Approx $6.00 you can order a lunch for which people would travel great distances. The food here is memorably good and has gained my loyalty and consistent recommendations. If you give this restaurant a try...I would suggest the Sesame Chicken, Gen Cho's Chicken or any shrimp dish on the menu. I would not recommend the onion cakes as they are too thick and chewy. The Dim Sum appetizer is also very good.
Chris H
author: Chris H.

description:
Adieu Red Jade. 

We are moving out of town and will miss you sorely. 

You are the only place we'll order from because there are options that we are both very happy with. Chinese food can tend to be greasy but not yours. Your food is tasty and always delivery steaming, fresh, promptly and never loaded down with a bunch of "junk" (corn starchy sauces or MSG). 

Ah and I love your buns. You bring us free pork buns and treats too. I'll never forget you or your lettuce wraps, chow mien, pot stickers, general's chicken, salt and pepper pork, chop suey, or house eggplant. 

The new place can never replace you (believe me, we've tried them already).
author: Brandi L.

description:
The food was fantastic. All the grease you want  in Chinese, but not disgustingly. We had the sesame chicken, hot and sour soup and pot stickers - all deliciously seasoned. PLUS free pork buns and sesame balls. Can't go wrong with that. 

Delivery took about an hour, but was the best Chinese delivery i've had in a long time. I'll be back!
author: Danielle G.

description:
I order delivery from here a lot, so my review does not relate to the restaurants service - I live close by and they are almost always super quick with delivery.  I think only one or two times it took more than 30 min - and they usually say 45 min on the website delivery time. 

Food is always hot, and always right.

I'm giving 4 stars because they have the best crab rangoons I've found in this city.  The rest of the food is, as other reviews have said, mediocre.  Fried rice is pretty good, but its tough to mess that up. The chicken is almost always overcooked and tough.  If they could only get that right, this place would be awesome.
author: Todd S.

description:
Good, fast delivery, tasty dishes, and yummmyyyy crab-cream cheese wontons. I love these things when made right, and they do it well! I would honestly go back again just for these and the sticky brown rice.

Now, the only odd negative. I ordered orange chicken and the sauce was served on the side with the chicken separate. Then I had to mix the two, but it just didn't come out right. It seems like the chicken should have been cooked with the sauce so it wasn't so dry. All the other dishes were good including the spinach side. Great place for cheap take out.
author: Natalie N.

description:
Red Jade has very good Chinese food. We had the minced chicken lettuce cups, hunan fish with brown rice, and chicken chow fun. Quite impressive that there's the option to have brown rice. The food was FLAVORFUL and NOT GREASY. 

To top it off, the service was great and when the bill came, it had the commonly associated fortune cookies but also sesame balls. 

I would definitely visit Red Jade again!
author: Jeannine L.

description:
This place is soo good! I'm pretty picky about Chinese food and I was convinced there was no good Chinese food in the city, so I was so happy when my roommate introduced me to Red Jade.

Their lunch specials are inexpensive and very filling. I'm a vegetarian, except that I eat seafood (so I'm technically a pescatarian), and they have plenty of delicious options for me. The asparagus salmon with black bean sauce, for example, is excellent. I also try to find good crab rangoon anytime I go to a Chinese food restaurant -- and Red Jade makes superb crab rangoon.

The staff is friendly, sometimes they seem super busy but they always serve you well. Free pork buns with a big delivery (I don't eat them, but my roommate is happy to oblige), and the sesame balls that come with every meal are yummmmy. Yay Red Jade!
author: Maisha J.

description:
even as I am writing this, I am still unsure how many stars Red Jade will get.
It is the best chinese delivery I have found so far in San Francisco.  That being said, I was slightly disappointed.  Green beans were good, but sweet for some reason?  App combo plate was pretty good.  Braised tofu...pretty bad.  It was really bitter, and nothing I did seemed to make it taste any better.  As well, they put the tofu (which was in a very liquidy sauce) in a cardboard takeout carton, and it leaked through!  (completely pooled in the bag, and i was so happy the bag had no holes)
But also got the free steamed pork buns and sesame balls, both of which were good.  Delivery was fast as well.  
I will order from again, just have to work on refining my choices
author: Anya W.

description:
We live across the street and order all the time.  Not the best, not the worst.  Consistently consistent.  Free pork buns and quick service.  We seldom eat the pork buns.  Not sure why someone would want something they didn't order.  The dog likes the sesame balls.  A food, a ball, a ball and a food.

I usually order the walnut prawns.  About half of the serving is honeydew melon.  Not sure why.  The best thing we order is the shrimp fried rice.  Not much shrimp, but you can see a few.  No carrots or noticable peas.  Not sure about the MSG... hard to say.  But we like them and have also eaten in the restaurant.

Are their better places to go?  For sure Erics and Alice's are MUCH better, but they are good for a neighborhood joint.
author: Sara A.

description:
Just had to check out Red Jade after rave reviews on BA Check Please. Unfortunately, I'm not sure what the raves were about. I ordered the Happy Family - a dish recommended on the show and found it flavorless and strange (nothing like the Great China Walnut Prawns that it resembles). I also had the green onion pancake, which was OK - but I didn't love the peanut sauce that came with it. I much prefer a soy based dipping sauce that I've had with other green onion/scallion pancakes in the past.

On the plus side, the potstickers were excellent and the sweet and sour chicken that my friends ordered was competent as well. Red Jade is in an adorable location and the decor is cute too. It was packed, so maybe I didn't make the right menu choices.
