I thought the service was inconsistent, at first it seemed like the food was coming quickly but then after they served my friends we waited an additional 5 minutes or so for my entree. They also seemed attentive at times and at other times we couldn't manage to get our waters refilled. 

I was disappointed, I don't think I'll return to Red Jade - especially since relatively speaking I have the glory that is Great China in my backyard.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Delivery: 5 stars
Food: 3 stars

I miss New York City for its delivery service. Everyone and their "motha" delivered everything, from food to dry cleaning, even if you lived half a block. You'd understand what I mean if you live there, especially during the hot summers and brutal winters. I love San Francisco. More importantly, I love our sunny neighborhood. 

I was pleased to discover Red Jade's delivery service. Their fried crabmeat rangoon (you get 6 potstickers with fake crabmeat and cream cheese), sizzling rice soup, hunan or sweet/sour fish, sauteed baby bok-choy and vegetarian chow mein are generally pretty consistent. 

Nothing here will knock your socks off since there are way too many restaurants in town that serve excellent Chinese food.
author: Miles G.

description: This Chinese restaurant delivers to Civic Center and it's the best of three places I've tried so far.
author: S W.

description: Hot soup, hot tea, hot steamed won tons. Super clean restaurant, friendly and fast service, very affordable prices, convenient location...and I had leftovers...you cant beat that on a cold rainy day.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Red Jade has always proved to be reliable whether I have it delivered or eating at the restaurant. But I do have a couple of gripes. The first is, Red Jade menus are always blowing around on my street. I don't know why they persists in papering my neighborhood weekly, its not like the menu changes

My second gripe is, whenever I am eating in the restaurant, the wait staff are constantly patrolling the room. I mean they remind me of prison guards the way they walk up and down the aisles. It is a bit discerning but if these are the worse issues facing me at the Red Jade I will keep coming back.
author: Richard P.

description:
Christ on crutches!  Now that's some gourmet Chinese delivery!

Crab rangoons- delish!
Chicken chow mein- they give you a crap ton and it's those thick noodles.  None of that Panda Express string noodle bs.
Sweet and sour pork- yum!
And the icing on the cake...2 free sesame balls and 2 free pork buns if you order delivery.  Hell ya!

And damn, did they just deliver in 10 minutes??  Oh yes they did.
author: Lauren B.

description: Actually not so bad.  Ate here twice already and really liked it.  It's definitely better than most Chinese restaurants in the city.
author: John H.

description:
The bf and I just moved to a fabulous new apartment at Alamo Sq, but we miss the solid Chinese/Asian places on Polk street in our old 'hood. Lacking any good, walkable Chinese, we started trying places that would do delivery. After a few disappointments, we tried this place and it's been great! 

It's not high cuisine, but it's all that's right about Chinese comfort food for me. The flavors are right and not too bland, and it's not too greasy (but just greasy enough :). This is probably going to be our goto Chinese from now on.
author: Stephanie L.

description: The delivery service they use, almost 2 hours and no delivery..called and the driver is on the way 20 minutes ago. Unacceptable. Not happy with Red Jade Or delivery.com
author: Susan M.

description:
I have only ordered from Red Jade and have never been in person.  HOWEVER, I think very highly of them and definitely recommend them.  They are extremely courteous, prompt with their delivery, and the food is extremely tasty.  Great potions too!

The lettuce wraps are fantastic as is the "Vegetarian Delight."  The food is delivered with complimentary pork buns and/or sesame rolls which are little bites of decadence.

I need to go to the place in person I admit, but ordering for delivery is just so damn good.  Call them up, order your food, wait briefly, and enjoy!
author: Ryan G.

description:
Thank god they deliver.  Red Jade is a godsend if you're too hungover - or stoned - to leave the house for food.  

Dishes are hit or miss.  Find something you like and stick with it.  Spicy salted sparerib and hot and sour soup are some of my favorites.  

Dishes taste better and you get larger portions if you visit the restaurant vs. delviery but they don't disappoint.
author: Jimmie L.

description: I usually order delivery from them and I am satisfied for it being Chinese take out... but after today, I will have to "x" this restaurant from my list of options! I ordered a broccoli dish because I read in the reviews that their meat dishes were of bad quality meat. Upon opening my delivered goods, I saw that they gave me a chicken dish instead of the broccoli dish I ordered. Needless to say, I ate it anyways because at that point I was starving and  heck, it's not like I don't eat meat... but let me just say this: the meat was of HORRIBBBBLE quality- so chewy and had this odd gamy taste which chicken should not have... I ended up throwing the rest away and now my tummy hurts... I hope I don't get sick! *yuck
author: Ashlyn C.

description:
I'm not sure how I missed this place over the years living within walking distance, but I'm glad I found it.

I wanted Chinese food delivery on this cold rainy evening and I got it. I ordered online and I was surprised how quickly it came. It was also made to order so that was super fast....

Food is fine. The earth didn't shake when I bit into my egg roll but it was good. The sauce for my chicken had too much oil in the sauce and it was the primary flavor, so that wasn't all that great.

They gave me a free pair of pork buns...hmm
author: Marz W.

description:
Mediocre Chinese food, but if you're in the mood for Chinese comfort food, this place is great.  Your food is ready alarmingly quick, and they have a surprisingly wide menu.

I got General Tso's which had a ton of flavor.  It's also a plus that brown rice is only a tad more expensive than white rice.  (yay complex carbs).  They don't rush you out either, another plus.  Food could have been hotter out of the kitchen.

Also, including a sesame ball with the fortune cookie was a nice touch.

My fortune: "You will have a successful entertainment career."   For everyone else's sake, let's hope not.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Great food.  I got the Mongolian Lamb and Pot Stickers.  15.00 for both total and ate half of the 6 huge pot stickers and plenty of food left over for the exact same meal tomorrow.

Good quick service and free Tea.

Had no idea this place was here and its only 3 blocks away.

Great random walk by find.
author: Shawn L.

description:
Pretty decent Chinese grub that doesn't break the bank. I always order for delivery because every time i'm in the mood for Chi food i can't even muster up enough energy to stand up. 

If your order is over 20 bonez you get free pork buns. That's pretty rad.
author: Cliff C.

description:
Having just moved to the area from Nob Hill, I was simply looking for something close to my place and I seemed to have found my favorite Chinese restaurant in the city so far.  Huge portions for lunch, but the best part for me was that the lunch specials run all the way until 5pm.  For a late mover like myself, this suits my lifestyle quite well.

I've only sampled the miso soup and the sesame chicken, but I was extremely happy with both.  I'll definitely be going back.
author: Justin W.

description:
i might loose all sorts of cred here, but i really liked our dinner here. 

we started the meal with the traditional ancient chinese amuse bouche of immitation crab (pollack) with cream cheese and scallions, wrapped in a wrapper and deep fried. 

i gotta say, that was the best deep fried immitation crab with cream cheese and scallions ive ever had. it was really, almost perfect as a deep fried immitation crab with cream cheese and scallions could be.

i didnt do the usual thing i do at restaurants and order enough food for twice the people sitting, but what we did order, i gotta say i really liked it.

i would go as far as to say the dry fried wings at red jade are better than san tung. yes, i said it. the dried fried wings here were damn good. they came out super crunchy (still crunchy after a 5-8 minute cool down)... the sauce was sweet, savory with a TINY hint of spice.... the chicken itself was nice a juicy even with a crunchy as hell crust.... 

im not sure if this place would qualify as a destination spot... and yes i was the only non roundeye besides the staff, but i gotta say...... i liked it.  

oh and you can find the very traditional, ancient asiany accompanying fermented beverage here too, sierra nevada pale ale.
author: Euge L.

description:
So bf and I didn't feel like cooking after work and we were really craving some Chinese food. What to do? We'd always pass by Red Jade without going in so we thought this would be the perfect time to try it. Our first impressions: it's very clean and a place that has put some attention to ambiance which not usually true for Chinese joints (usually it's very over the top or just down right dirty). 

On to the food: We ordered broccoli and cashew chicken, asparagus salmon with black bean sauce, and Mandarin eggplant. The chicken was what you would expect anywhere but my favorite was the salmon even though at first glance it didn't seem like it would anything great. It was pieces of salmon that came with a lot of green peppers but the fish was tender with the right amount of black bean sauce and totally hit the spot. Eggplant was a bit oily but that's kind of how it always is when cooked Chinese style. 

Note: They have white AND brown rice. Very happy about that! You gotta be healthy somewhere.. :)

We ended our meal with the standard free fortune cookies but they also threw in two sesame balls! YUM! Good place for a cheap Chinese meal in a clean and nice setting. I'll try the delivery next time when I'm feeling even more lazy.
author: Julia T.

description:
Yelped for the best Chinese in our half of the city, and found it!    It's mandarin, with all the typical americanized dishes my simple pallete prefers from time to time.  

Kicked things off with the sampler appetizer platter, which included among other things, the best crab rangoons I've ever consumed, with an unusually healthy portion of fresh crab. Followed that with General Tsos chicken, which I could likely eat every day for the rest of life.  The perfect level of spice, the bite size pieces were nice, and all with a side of brown rice.

Also shared the sesame chicken - historically my favorite dish of this genre - and while not the best I've had, it was excellent.

Great location, just south of the F line at Market.  Possibly the best value in any food genre I've had in the City. 

Save me a seat!
author: Cory J.

description:
I had a craving for Chinese after dropping off a friend, and looked up this restuarant yelp at the Safeway at 14th/Church, so decided to head here.

I ordered simple - General Tso's and a small rice.  Service was quick, there is a $10.00 minimum for using credit but the waiter was going to let me do credit with my order despite it coming out to $9.60.

I'm usually a fan of big bang for buck, and this was pretty tasty and a pretty good bang for your buck.  

The only downside really - the fortune cookie had no fortune.  Seriously?  Perhaps got cut due to the economy?  A bad lot in the fortune cookie batch?  Who knows.  

Oh, lastly, this is actually also a sit down restaurant, not just a delivery place.
author: Neil P.

description:
My sister works on the same block as Red Jade..and I always used to make her go here just so she can get me a bag of their mini sesame balls....they are the best!!! Super crunchy and fresh and if you're lucky to get them when they are still warm..you'd be a very happy camper!!!

Their food is delicious also...I love their Mongolian beef!  The decor is pleasant also...

Great place for cheap eats and they deliver too!
author: Jade B.

description:
Great delivery.  The food has a lot of flavor.  Love the eggplant with chicken, shrimp and basil and the General Tso's chicken.  yummm.  Really good Wor Wonton soup - for only $6.95 it can make 2 full meals.  The spinach, muchroom and tofu soup is good if you are under the weather.  Combo chow mein and spicy string beans with pork are new favorites.  
Good prices too and large portions.
author: Gina T.

description:
I do reccomend tha general Tso Chicken as long as you have not just come back from Hong Kong ( LOL).

The Sesame Balls are yummy. I have to say for good chinese food in the Castro this is the best. ( Yes Dorothy the Castro is not Chinatown!) The delivery is great too. All of my friends and foodies always like this place. 

People forget there is allot of variety in how chinese food is prepared,. There are a lot of regions and variations. 

Red Jade offers a good cooking style that is consistant and tasty. Its best dish are the sesame chicken, general Tso's Chicken, Empress  Prawn, ok all the fried foods. They are so tasty.

If you are looking for light cuisine go somewhere else. 
The decor is appropriate for the low-key style the resturant clientele that the restaurant attracts.
Mostly local here eating in and taking out.
On a rainy night it delivers out.

Love this stuff!
author: Joe R.

description:
Yes I gave this place 5 stars and I'll tell you why:

-Delivers faster than expected with food fresh and HOT

-Food is actually tasty! Esp the pot stickers and pork fried rice. My other staple is the general tso's chicken. (Yes, yes, how typical. But if a rest. can't get the 'regular' stuff right, then, how good are they really???)
author: Cid T.

description:
I was hoping that I would be writing a good review, but seriously I can't (so sad) find one good thing about our meal except the service (hence the 2 stars).

Its Sunday night, jonesin for a lil Chinese food and thought lets try something new, a little closer (u know support your local biz) After perusing yelp, we thought we'd give Red Jade a try- maybe they are as good as their predecessor, Hong Kong (oh yeah I went old school on you)... uh yeah, Bad Idea

The woman who took the order was pleasant and the delivery guy arrived on time. I was sooo excited to open our little white boxes. Mmmm so very Hungry! Now here is where it just went bad on so many levels-

Chow Mein- uh no flavor, but ended up being our entire meal
Bok Choy Broccoli Beef- Possibly 2 pieces of Bok Choy, maybe 5 pieces of Broccoli and the rest was plenty of over sauced and salt o rama Beef?
General Tsao Chicken- SALTY chewy and stringy pieces of batter with a sliver of chicken

sob sob

Everything was so over salted (its been 2 hours and still chuggin on the h2o) that we ended eating the noodles and throwing the rest out. How awful- right? 

1 Star for Service
1 Star for the complimentary Sesame Balls & Pork Buns (which were decent)
author: Anna S.

description:
first time I ordered and I am very happy. Food was delivered fast and hot. 
Lemon chicken: vgood, but was like eating lemon candy 
Sweet and sour chicken: very good 
chive pancake: very good!! 
pork buns were free and good 
pecking duck is never good unless you are having it AT a good Chinese restaurant, I won't be ordering that again 

Will be ordering from them again for sure
author: soledad a.

description:
OMG (sorry) WTF (sorry). A battle, owner vs. patron (not me). We heard about this restaurant on Check Please so we had to go! Everything went smoothly until the owner freaked (I mean freak out literally...what? ) out on a diner and kicked them out because they complained about something. I was happy with the Green Onion Pancake which saves this place. The kicker was at the end of our meal, the waiter asked "are you feeling ok?" What do you think I said?

In a nutshell: The owner needs to go home and hope for the best. The Green Onion pancake is off the chart delicious. Why did he ruin it for me by treating their customer like ###$$$!!?My experience was fine until the owner had a melt down.  Go if you want to experience theatrical drama. A message to the owner or manager....STAY HOME!!!!!!!!
author: BringItOn N.

description:
I wasn't going to write a review of Red Jade because I have already given up on this place and am not looking to ruin anybody's business. But it would not be in the true spirit of Yelp to only write good reviews, which I am guilty of usually doing. Plus all the positive reviews of Red Jade really started to get me riled up.

Let me first state that due to the close proximity to my residence I have been to Red Jade more than a handful of times, mostly as take-out. If you are looking for something fried, greasy and sure to make your left side go numb the Fried Crab Meat Rangoon is a pretty safe bet. The potstickers, while less fried, are a pretty tasty deal. That, however, is about all that is remotely decent on the menu.

The soups are inedible with chunks of meat and veggies that are obviously (fresh) out of the freezer. You know, the type of chinese food where all the ingredients seem to be water-logged from de-thawing.

Every entree I have ordered has been as disappointing as a Jack Shepherd 'Lost' episode. If you order something crispy it will be soggy. If you order veggies they will be covered in glutenous goo. Not like this description is different from any other cheap chinese restaurant, it's just that Red Jade delivers the cheap and the chinese without the guilty payoff at the end.

In short, don't let the interior design fool you: Red Jade is no better than the buffet-style dim sum joints scattered about San Francisco. The only difference being that Red Jade tries to pretend it is something it is not, a fine dinning establishment, at twice the price.
author: Galen M.

description:
remember the ipecac contest in family guy?
(http://www.milkandcookies.com/link/33774/detail/)
Me, Dana, and Liz are having the exact same contest now. It's awesome. Thanks Red Jade, you're the best!!!

p.s. Liz says the fortune cookies were stale... how'd you manage that? i hate you.
author: dave g.

description:
Still seeking a new favorite chinese restaurant after New Sun Hong Kong dropped the ball earlier this year,we decided to give this place a shot,since it was,by chance one of the few chinese restaurants on the street we were on.

We ordered what we usually get-beef chow fun and chicken fried rice.Also an order of sweet&sour pork.It started out good,with the rice being the first plate brought to the table,but was not meant to be.The old addage "anything tastes good when you're hungry" comes to mind.I was blinded by my hunger at first,but quickly realized it.

I've had better flavored food at Mr.Chaus.Everything here was either bland or overly salty.I wont be going back for seconds.
author: Mike M.

description:
All I can say is...WHACK!! I'm sorry, I've had tastier food from the little no-name chinese restaurant at Hilltop Mall. And my "spicy" prawns had zero heat. Boo!

********
Funny I saw the episode of Check Please (love the show!) talking about this place and I wish it came out before I tried it. I would've ordered some other things. People are saying it's been packed since the episode but it was empty as hell when I went there. It's possible that I didn't order the right stuff, but I doubt it. I mean it shouldn't be about ordering the "right thing" they should make everything exceptional.
author: Chantay X.

description:
Yum! If you want reasonably priced, delicious, HOT, and quickly-delivered, slightly Americanized Mandarin-style Chinese takeout, Red Jade is your new favorite restaurant. My skeptical, unsure self ordered from delivery.com for the first time, and wondered how long it would be before they got to my house. Answer: in under a half hour. My lack of cash was even worse than my lack of fridge food, which was fine because I was able to pay the bill and tip with my credit card--yesss. 

And the food--sent from the takeout Chinese gods themselves. I was starving, and I got the vegetable egg rolls, sesame chicken, and szechuan sauteed broccoli, which all was easily enough for two to share. The chicken tasted like chicken (already it's winning me over), the sauce was sweet but not overpowering and the portion was huge. The broccoli was crisp and the sauce was delicious--I mixed the two dishes together and it was awesome. The egg rolls were nice and crispy, just as they should be.

And, I got 2 FREE pork buns, 2 FREE sesame seed balls with red bean paste, and the usual fortune cookies to complete the meal. I'll have plenty left over for lunch and maybe even dinner again tomorrow, and it's good enough that I won't mind eating it that often.  I'll definitely be a repeat customer as long as I'm living in the Castro. Take note though--rice is not included unless you order it.
author: Allison G.

description:
I should have read some other reviews on here a little closer before ordering because the quality of the chicken was not great. I have had better takeout with much better quality meat (Ah Lin, for one). The things we ordered - General Tso's chicken and appetizer sampler with pot stickers, egg roll and crab rangoon - were mediocre at best. 

The good points were the people that worked there were friendly, very quick delivery, and the free sesame balls they throw in for dessert.
author: Anne Q.

description: Very possibly the absolute worst food I have ever had delivered. I can't say enough bad things about it. Oredred 3-items and one was worse than the next. Even the rice. OMG!
author: Lee S.

description: Super yummy. Quick delivery and even though I ordered 2 minutes before the kitchen closed they threw in free pork buns and little sesame ball cookies.  : )
author: Nicole C.

description:
I go to Red Jade for two reasons: it's close, and they offer brown rice.

Slightly above average chinese food, fast and friendly service, and a great deal of a lunch special only help :)
author: Josh A.

description:
The food here is consistent, cheap and delicious. The chicken dishes are always crunchy. They seem to really care about making good food. 

The pot stickers are big enough to be a meal for two.
author: Matt W.

description:
Red Jade is not my regular "hang out" as far as Chinese restaurants are concerned, but their Lunch Special is definitely worth going for. 

The lunch specials are very reasonably priced. It comes with soup of the day usually "Hot & Sour" or "Egg Flower with Corn" soup. There are a good variety of lunch specials on the menu for you to choose from. 

At the end of the meal, they'd give you a sesame ball for dessert...and perhaps a Fortune cookie as well. Though last time I went, they gave me a stale sesame ball. Thus, minus one star.

One of my favarite dishes there is the Salt and Pepper Spareribs. 

Overall rating:
3 stars for food
1 star for service
author: Jen L.

description:
My friend and I had lunch at Red Jade recently.  She had seen a review on Check Please Bay Area recently and wanted to check it out especially the green onion pancakes that the reviewers had raved about.  We arrived at lunch and the lunch dishes were pretty standard.   I had the Sauteed Green Beans and she had the Garlic Chicken.  Both came with white rice and were good as was the Egg Drop soup that accompanied both luncheon dishes.  Of course we ordered the Green Onion cake which was delivered to our table after the soup was served but was served before our other dishes.  This is a nice touch only because at many Chinese Restaurants they serve all the dishes at once.  Red Jade paced it very nice.  You can imagine our surprise when the first bite of their touted onion cake was doughy and tasted uncooked.  We alerted our server who informed us that the onion cakes are crispy on the outside and are supposed to be soft on the inside.  Now Red Jade's onion cakes are the thickest that I've ever had, usually onion cakes are flat, these were a good inch or more thick which would explain why the inside was not fully cooked.  I was about to explain that to the server but she was insistent. The peanut sauce that was used for dipping was good however neither of us could have more than a couple of bites of Red Jade's doughy Green Onion cakes which would definitely NOT win any prizes for Best Onion Cakes. I'm not sure if the diners on the television show had ever had green onion cakes before, but Red Jade's are only good if your taste prefers an uncooked doughy center.

The other dishes were OK...but Red Jade doesn't offer anything more than just standard Chinese Food in a neighborhood that has absolutely no parking. 

One last thing...the Sesame Balls that accompanied the fortune cookies and our bill were fabulous providing a nice sweet touch to what was a very ordinary meal.
author: Nick C.

description:
I've been trying desperately to find a decent, cheap chinese food place.  Red Jade completely surpassed my meager expectations... both in delivery and in house service.

I first tried their food using the handy delivery.com service.  I placed my order with 8 minutes until the 10:00pm shutdown.  I had no problems and received my order within 20 minutes!  

My favorite, as others have mentioned, is the General Tso's chicken.  I'm a generally a fan of the sweet stuff like Sesame Chicken or Sweet and Sour Chicken, but this has enough kick to it without being too spicy for a spice-weenie like myself.  Don't get the Sesame Chicken if you're hoping for a kick... this one's pure sweet.

The other great thing about Red Jade is the very reasonable prices, for v. v. good chinese food!  I'm still in utter shock... if you order btw noon and 5 pm, take advantage of the rice plate lunch specials... for ~$6, you get heaping spoonfuls of white (or brown) rice and more heaping spoonfuls of your entree... plus soup, and the occasional freebie pork buns.

Also, don't let the sketchy "Red Jade Chinese Restaurant" sign fool you... I was expecting a lackluster interior when I finally took my stomach to the source.  On the contrary, they have a pretty decent setup in there... nice wood tables and chairs and cloth napkins.  Not too busy and decent service... dinner entrees run ~$7 and could easily feed two people.

This place rocks... AND it's cheaper and closer than Eric's!  In short, this is the best chinese food for the upper market area (esp., delivery)!!
author: Laura N.

description:
Recession proof! $7.90 for me and the girl to split a big lunch special and two pork buns. Awesome!

Plus tea, and sesame balls at the end, for free. The staff is friendlier than at nearly any of the other Chinese restaurants in the area (though Hunan Garden wins that one). 

Perfect lunch spot.
author: Ryan B.

description: I love this place. I've had a great experience here every time. The service is great, the food is great, and it's reasonably priced. I try to go here whenever I'm in San Francisco. I highly recommend this place to everyone.
author: Daniel C.

description:
good chinese food, FAST DELIVERY!

Not only they have fortune cookies, they also have this sweet balls that come with as desserts. they're pretty good too.
author: Jeff Y.

description: This place was great. I ordered on Tuesday night and received my food in about 35 minutes. Not super fast, but absolutely worth the wait. The pot stickers are definitely what everyone says about them; awesome. I also had the General Tso's chicken which was fresh and crispy. The free steam buns and sesame balls just made it that much better. Super stoked to order from here again.
author: Rick James C.

description: The food here is pretty yummy. I thought the shrimp fried rice was impeccable! Nice little place, casual and relaxing. Prices are very reasonable.
author: M D.

description:
I come here more often than anywhere else in SF.  I order the sweet & sour chicken lunch special, with steamed rice.  The sweet & sour chicken is crispy, not soggy, with ample amounts of sweet & sour sauce, and the lunch special--an extraordinary deal at just under $6--includes soup (egg drop or a spectacular hot & sour with tofu and seaweed in it, depending on the day) & a pot of tea, both brought out before the main course.  It also includes a fortune cookie and small sesame ball for dessert, brought out with the check.

The service is amazing.  I normally don't like being waited on, because I honestly don't like the forced social interaction with strangers that entails, especially with tipping involved, which makes me feel like an American Idol judge, but these guys are great.  The soup & tea come out right after you order; the main course comes out right after the soup & tea; the plates are cleared and the check comes as soon as you finish the main course.  Other than that, they leave you alone to read Tom Tomorrow or Savage Love in the copies of the SF Weekly & Guardian you've brought over from nearby Aardvark Books.

The ambiance, also perfect.  Very clean, no tablecloths, paper napkins, a good amount of natural light if you sit toward the front of the restaurant, and nonintrusive muzak playing in the background.  An oasis of calm and order.
author: Ryan G.

description:
Let me say that this place is NOT bad.  I ordered the tomato beef mein, wet dried fried chicken, and the house special seafood nest.

The tomato beef mein I've had better else where, the wet dried fried chicken was pretty good (really filled yer noses), but the seafood bird's nest was by far the drag on all of the foods since it felt pretty tasteless.

Now, I like to add extra credit basd on how good it comes around the second time as leftovers.  And boy, did it come around.  My stomach decided to churn, twist, and squeeze itself out.  It wasn't going to take it anymore abuse.  I had to throw the rest out and down a shot to calm my stomach.  I don't blame Jade though.
author: Alfred Y.

description: Every time I have eaten here, the service has been friendly and quick.  The food is good, and I recommend eating there for lunch.  You get a soup before your appetizers or your entree.  Enjoy
author: Patrick B.

description:
Bad experience I had w/ this place, summarized:

[call in for delivery]
me: lunch special, does it come with hot and sour soup?
red: no, but we can give it to you with that instead
me: oh perfect, then yes, lunch special with hot and sour
[delivery arrives with other soup -- I call back]
me: wrong soup
red: lunch special does not have hot and sour today
me: I know, but I asked, said they would
red: lunch special does not have hot and sour today
me: right, but I was told it would for me, will you still deliver it?
red: lunch special does not have hot and sour today
me: can I talk to the person I spoke to before
red: no
me: why not?
red: lunch special does not have hot and sour today
[they hang up one me -- I call back again]
me: did you hang up on me?
red: lunch special does not have hot and sour today
me: I know, but I asked for it, and was told I would get it...do you think I am lying? I order once a week
red: yes maybe you are a liar
[I eventually hang up on them]
author: Captain B.

description: Fast, cheap, really good. And extremely attentive service. If you need a quick bite to eat before a night out of drinking the Castro, you can't go wrong with this this place.
author: Jeff R.

description: What a disappointment. I remember even when this place was the Hong Kong Cafe and it was always consistently great. Then when Red Jade openhed, and offered reasonable lunches it was good, at first. But wow, how it has gone downhill quickly and with no end in sight. Lunch yesterday was so inedible; could barely stomach the curry chicken. The chicken did have the skin removed, there were small bones and grissle. The curry sauce was so thick you could stand a spoon in it. Sorry to say, won't be going back here again. A shame.
author: Peter K.

description: We were feeling the need for a good dinner, but didn't want to leave the house, so out came the takeout folder. Red jade won with their prices and their lack of MSG on the menu, We had the Lemon Chicken, Steamed Rice, General Chicken, Pot Stickers, and Crab Rangoon. They told us about 40 minutes, but they showed up in under thirty. It was great. We opened to HUGE bag of food. BONUS! They even threw in some steamed buns with BBQ pork. The food was hot and the chicken dishes were all white meat. The price was great for quality of food and swiftness of delivery. the only draw back was the General Chicken wasn't crispy anymore and the pieces stuck to your teeth. But it's a delivery thing. We will definitely order from here again.
author: Jena D.

description: Really. Great Chinese food.  To die for. Happy family meal was delicious. Prawns n butter sauce with fresh fruits and glazed nuts yummy.
author: Kim S.

description:
Clean, courteous, convenient. The staff is always amiable and prompt. I would suggest coming for lunch - can't beat the lunch specials: 6$ gets you a hearty entree plus free soup.
Overral, this is one of the better Chinese places in the area. Be adventurous and try something different like the chicken wrapped in lettuce - different and delicious.
author: Bonifatius B.

description:
Ordered delivery last night online from Red Jade and in the blink of an eye (well about 20 minutes) they were ringing my doorbell with a big bag of hot food.  
The food was pretty good, not mega-outstanding but the best delivery Chinese food I've found in my new 'hood so far.  
The free pork buns and sesame balls were a nice touch, I'll probably order from them again at some point.
author: Nick S.

description: What to order: dim sum special, general tsou's chicken (remind me to tell you about this one time, in china, when I asked who general tsou was...), pork fried rice, sizzling rice chicken soup.  I'll add to this list as we order more.  Love the sesame balls.  Didn't like so much: mongolian beef, it was fine actually just not my cup of tea.  The bok choy needed more flavor, but soy sauce fixed that.  It's become our new go to chinese take out place.  They are just super nice too over the phone and when they deliver.  If you eat there, they are just as nice.
author: Ann F.

description: I had the orange flavored beef and general tsao chicken and chicken chow mein. delivery came within 30 min. but the food was just not that good. the meat was just not quality and this is my second time having this food. i had the mongolian beef the first time at this restaurant and was not really happy with that either. i would not go back to this restaurant.
author: Dominic d.

description:
Who wants five dollar lunch?  I DO!!!  Especially from Jade Cafe.  My friend renamed this joint because he has a habit of doing that, but its appropriate here since the service is very speedy and the prices are cafe-like.

If hunger strikes you in the Church and Market Street area, head for the Red Jade because you get the soup, an entree over rice, and a small desert for $4.50, but only before 5PM, so hurry!  

There is plenty to chose from on the menu, but I always go for the General Chicken because the Red Jade achieves something which many Chinese food places don't: a well fried chicken ball covered in a sauce that is not overly sweet and is deliciously spiced.  All too often I have been disappointed by overly sweet and mushy balls of goo, but the Red Jade achieves what should be very simple and available everywhere.

Soup and desert: the vegetable egg drop soup is by far better than hot and sour, so hope that it is offered as soup of the day.  It is especially delicious with a few drops of that red hot oily stuff.  And also, hope that as desert they serve fortune cookies because the sesame seed balls they offer aren't very good, even though I end up eating them for reason.
author: Dylan D.

description: There was hair in my food. When i took a bite of my Mongolian beef a long strand of black hair was all the way to the bottom of the box. Disgusting. After moving on to my friend rice I found ANOTHER shorter hair in this box. Wear a hair net or something people this is absolutely disgusting and a waste of my money to have to throw away the food I ordered because you can't keep your body hair to your self.
author: Evan B.

description:
Red Jade is why yelp needs half stars.  This place is a little higher than a 3, but definitley is not a 4. 

This place is my go-to place for chinese delivery.  You know - the type of place you will order from 100 times but will never, ever, actually step foot inside the physical restaurant itself. 

Cheap.
Fast.
Tasty food. 
Free pork buns with orders of $20 (diggity). 

What else do you need?
author: Shawn S.

description: I love Red Jade.  I've been here several times, and I've been to a lot of other Chinese restaurants.  This one is different from all the others.  They seem to put a unique taste on everything they serve.  If you think you've had every General Tso's chicken, sesame chicken, or lemon chicken, try them at Red Jade, because they're different and better.  Service is average...nothing to write about.
author: Aaron F.

description:
All I gotta say is, under $5 lunch specials everyday until 5pm. Food is pretty good, not gourmet - but I've been rocking the lemon chicken for a few weeks and it hasn't failed me yet. Super quick preparation; I live a few doors down - I call and order, lace up my kicks, walk 20 seconds down Church and my food is ready. 

Standard Chinese fare, a couple steps above ghetto Chinese.
author: Yotam L.

description:
Saw it on Check Please too. Those people are crazy. It's very standard crummy SF Chinese food, just like (practically) everywhere else.
Maybe if I knew enough Chinese to order off the menu like the lady on TV it might have been OK. As it is, no me gusta.
author: Jonny A.

description:
I'm writing this review as I'm munching on free pork buns (with $20 order, I believe). And it's actually the delicious. (And legit, they're the steamed white ones, not the baked sweet ones).

I have to second everyone else's emotions. Free pork buns, free sesame seed balls, huge portions. The won ton soup came in two containers (although one was hotter than the other, strangely enough)! It was delicious with plenty of MSG to go around. The squid in the Hong Kong Style Noodles was a little bit dry and lacking flavor. Just have some rooster sauce hanging around. 

Ma Po Tofu and the Steamed Won Tons have a nice kick to it. My mouth is burning and it feels oh so good.

The only one star I took away was because they were almost 20 minutes late in delivering. Otherwise, high fives for this joint. Gotta love delivery to my door. Now if I could only figure out how to levitate down (actually, up) my stairs.
author: Salina Z.

description: This place has a nice Americanized environment and affordable prices for the environment, as well as quirky waitstaff. The mango chicken had lots of mango, so that's good. They were out of ostrich, which was disappointing - and they forgot to bring the appetizers I ordered. The meat quality could stand to improve, though the sauces were nice. All in all, AOK.
author: Andrew K.

description:
It's true that you can order conveniently on line without talking to anyone, delivery is fast and you get free pork rolls and sesame balls.  

But the food, which might be passable in Asheville, Des Moines, Amarillo or Stuttgart, isn't really up to par in San Francisco.  It wasn't exactly bad,  Just off, noncommittal and tasteless with the exception of firehouse string beans which were inartfully overspiced. 

If you are drunk enough and hungry enough, this place is OK. But the search for decent Chinese delivery goes on. Please, somebody, help. 

Our civic pride is at stake.
author: Alan M.

description:
yes. 4 stars. Dependable satisfying portions with a great ambiance, clean place (even better, clean bathroom), happy people talking, eating, reading, staring off cupping their tea.  There are other claims to fame chinese restaurants in the city, but either they are cheap and greasy (but good on price) or are asking for a mortgage downpayment (and I rent).   These prices are delightful, portions (again - needs to be mentioned again) are good, and I can't recommend the egg flower soup more.  I"m not a hot & sour soup type of girl - so I can't help you out there.  

And the Red Jade does something that many other great Chinese restaurants can't do - THEIR FOOD DELIVERS NICELY.  There are 2 other chinese restaurants I really like, but when have ordered for delivery it's either soggy, luke warm, or it just plain - eh, feeling.  Red Jade continuously delivers hot piping good wtih crispy sweet & sour.  & this is a more than once observation.  

now where are my sesame balls.....?
author: Walrus C.

description: Most of their lunch specials are around $6 and come with soup. You can choose from many different proteins and vegetarian options, and can opt for brown rice. The food isn't super greasy and tastes like it was made with high quality ingredients. Doesn't hurt how clean and intimate the space is either.
author: James P.

description:
I can see that two of the four people I went to this restaurant with have already written reviews, but I'll still put in my two cents. I was all excited about eating ostrich, but alas, they were out. Other than that, the food was good, if unexceptional. The mango chicken was pretty tasty, and the broccoli was a bit boring. The noodles were somewhat greasy, establishing this firmly as a lower-end chinese place.

The service was courteous, if a bit uninspired. Overall, I would probably come back at some point.
author: Dana L.

description:
I'm Chinese.  I live in the Mission.  I'm deprived of good chinese food.  

For those days when I crave Chinese food but don't feel like leaving the house, Red Jade does the trick.

Seafood sizzling rice soup is pretty yummy.
author: jenn c.

description:
This food is super mediocre, bordering on bad. You should eat here if you are having trouble making the rent payment. It's pretty cheap, but there's a secret trade-off... quality of food.

I love mushrooms, but the mushrooms that were mixed in with the kung pao chicken made me want to urinate in my mouth to cover up the taste.

There's so little to say about such a middle of the road restaurant.
author: Richard S.

description: I ate  there lastnight and everything was excellant! Food was very good, we had green onion pancake, chicken blackbean chow fun,eggplant with shrimp . The service was great !!
author: Deborah R.

description: My man and I ordered delivery friday night. It was excellent. The food was plentiful, fresh and hot. They gave us a free appetizer which was such  a nice surprise! That never happens. We were wooed by the thoughtfulness and the quality of the food- this is our new go-to chinese delivery.
author: Autumn W.

description:
I moved a block and a half away from RJ about two years ago and ate there about once or twice a week. It's not amazing but it is good. The egg rolls kick ass (personally, I think they *really* *really* kick ass. I'd just eat them for dinner if my girlfriend would let me get away with it). All their main dishes are just your regular Chinese fare but done very well. Nothing amazing or particularly creative but their Generals Chicken, Mushu Pork, Hunan Beef are all extremely tasty (did I mention the egg rolls?).

I happened across a bad meat experience with the Generals Chicken after about 6 months and stopped eating at RJ for awhile. Then, about 6 months later I was Yelping for some good Chinese food when I read Anneliese G's post about the all white meat and that was problem solved (Thanks A.G!). I'm now back on a fairly regular RJ diet and haven't had any other problems.

One thing I should mention for all the haters out there: As I said, I live right around the corner and I pick my food up or eat there. Either way its hot and fresh and I never have any trouble. If you've only ordered delivery who knows how long your food is waiting to get from point A to point B. I know when I pick up I see delivery orders waiting for the driver all the time. This may be something they can fix but in the meantime I suggest you go in for dinner. 

Maybe not as good as Eric's or Alice's but I think a solid 4 stars.
author: Jeff S.

description:
This is why it's good:

You can order online. 
Their delivery is lightening FAST. 
The food is decent. Not the best, but definitely not the worst either. 
Did I mention that you can order online?
author: Kristin H.

description: FULL ON FOOD POISONING. This was my go-to delivery and to go place for over 3 years, I loved it. Until last night. It was 6 hours of projectile vomiting, massive diarrhea hell. I have reported it to the department of health, and hopefully anyone else who gets sick will do the same. I don't make this claim lightly, I made sure Red Jade is to blame and they are. Save yourself the pain and do not eat here.
author: JA C.

description: Tasty food, fast delivery. I'm a big fan of the potstickers and have enjoyed every main dish I've ordered (cashew chicken, mixed fried rice, mongolian beef). The fact that they deliver to my hood makes them 100% awesome.
author: Beth T.

description: Worst Chinese food I've ever had.  I got a delivery from here 2 Sundays ago only because my usual place didn't deliver till after 5. I ordered general tso spicy boneless chicken (paid extra $1 for white meat). The food came and there was no meat, let alone white meat.  It was chunks of battered who knows what and it tasted disgusting.It was the 1st time in my 31 yrs that i took 1 bite of my food and dumped the rest in the garbage.We also got spicy Mongolian beef which was fatty and gamey and I have more of a spice in my cornflakes ...Never again!to the chef at red jade try  Naan king road my usual for a proper dish
author: P B.

description: Consistently good Chinese delivery.  I LOVE that I can order online and it seems that 10 minutes after I order, they show up with my food.  It's a lifesaver for nights where I just cannot muster up the desire to move a muscle.
author: Rebecca O.

description:
I've been ordering and taking out from this place maybe 4-5 times now. Love their dry, spicy pork chops (and I like the free sesame balls they throw into the bag). 

Is it amazing? No but it's a pretty consistent, good chinese place that will fill you up without breaking the bank.
author: Rich S.

description:
I just want to say that this place is great!  The food is pretty good, i highly recommend the Hunnan Fish. I went there w/ a few friends and we had soup, two entrees and it was barely $8.00 for each of us!!! So if you're interested in cheap yummy chinese food, that's actually pretty good quality... check this one out!!! =)  

WOHOOOOO
author: Ryan M.

description:
Here's why I love this place:

 1) You can get dim sum anytime - its always on their menu.  And while they have the "dim sum sampler" I only really like the shrimp dumplings and steamed pork buns, and when I order it, I tell them that I only want those two things - which they oblige.  Not living in the inner richmond anymore made me crave dim sum like crazy, since its not as accesible down in the lower haight, but with Red Jade, I can get my fix anytime.

 2) Sweet and sour pork.  Individually fried balls of pork-goodness in a sauce that tastes like candy!

 3) This one time while I was waiting for my take-out order, my arm was leaning on the counter, and I knocked off one of the little knick-nacks which was on the counter.  The woman gave me the dirtiest look ever, and made me feel like I was going to hell.  But, the reason I love it, is because they have since forgotten about it and they haven't held it against me every time I come in, until i felt so uncomfortable I had to stop going in.  Because that would have been truly tragic (see #1 above)
author: Leigh c.

description:
This place is where I go for dependable Chinese in the Castro. I went there for lunch for the first time today and can't believe the deals. It's under $5 for soup, rice, and and entree. 

The atmosphere is nice, a place you can go totally casual with a bunch of friends or for a quiet date. Their service is very fast. 

I was a little disappointed with the General Tsao's chicken today. I have never had it before, and it didn't come with any vegetables. Everyone else really enjoyed their dishes, though. I have had orange chicken in the past, and enjoyed it because it was very lightly breaded, and didn't taste like bread more than chicken. The Mongolian beef was also delicious.

It's always my pick in that neighborhood, and I would go out of my way to get there.
author: Shushannah A.

description:
This place does some great veggie stir frys: not overcooked, not over-greasy.  They do the tofu perfectly.  I've tried maybe four or five different things here and they were all good.

A lovely touch: you get one of those insanely good sesame-studded dough balls that have either a lotus or red bean paste filling.  WAY better than a fortune cookie.
author: Jen D.

description:
There is much more than meets the eye at Red Jade... walking in, I didn't expect much. After being born and raised in Asia, I have pretty high standards for Chinese food -- but I've also adjusted to Americhinese. 

The food Red Jade actually didn't disappoint! The vegetarian hot and sour soup was deeeelicious AND they had white pepper on the table, so I didn't even have to ask. The "vegetarian delight" wasn't exactly delightful, but the broth had a nice flavor and the kale was delicious (a little heavy on the water chestnuts though). 

You also get free tea with your meal, and the lunch specials are a total bargain: it's a TON of food! What sold me was the fact that they serve jin deui (sesame balls) with your bill... I haven't had those since Singapore! Kudos Red Jade, kudos.

I have to admit, they lost a star for service. It was busy when we came in, but service was prompt. By the time we were ready for our check the place was empty (and no, we weren't there forever), but we ended up having to go ask for the bill. Tsk tsk.

Now if only they'll deliver to my 'hood? We'll see. If so, bonus stars to come.
author: Megan B.

description:
This was Hong Kong Restaurant - does anyone remember?  Mellow waiters in bright Hawaiian shirts?  I have many fond memories here from my high school days...more importantly, their combination wonton was very very good...so good that we come back again and again just because of it...now it's gone.

Alright, we all must move on but it's hard and it's likely unfair to the new dig.  The place isn't the same - it's much nicer and cleaner but the homey and relaxed ambiance are gone.  I refused to go in a few times but finally broke down and decided to give them a try - hoping (praying) perhaps the same cooks are there...after all, they still have combination wonton on the menu...

It just didn't feel right to order just the wonton so we also ordered the chicken chow mein.  We asked them first what kind of noodles they use -the thin ones or the thick ones.  The answer was they had both and we can choose...we chose the thick one.

The combination wonton came first in this huge white bowl - normally that huge bowl would have put a smile on my face anywhere else but not here because I was hoping to see the round flat bowl they used before...sigh.  It looked ok and appeared to have all the right ingredients but it was missing the gravy on top.  Taste was alright, will I come to this hood where parking is a challenge for this - absolutely not.  The chow mein was tasty but on the oily side.  Besides fortune cookie, they also give out mini sesame balls - it was warm and pretty tasty.  If to go, they charge $0.40 each!

Overall, it's ok and I will always remember Hong Kong Restaurant and my favorite combination wonton.
author: Gloria H.

description: This place has some good Chinese food for really cheap.  You can have a huge meal for 2 for under $15.  I can't speak for any of the meat dishes, but everything I have had here is good.  The chow mein and Schezuan brocolli is my favorite here.
author: Jonathan U.

description:
I had heard a lot of really good stuff about the Red Jade but my own experience was rather disappointing. In a city with such amazing and inexpensive Chinese food (Eric's in Noe Valley, Xiao Long in West Portal, Abacus on Hayes St.), Red Jade seems to be getting lost. My friend and I shared the spicy basil chicken - it was bland, completely non-spicy (we had to put tons of chilly sauce to give it a bit of a kick) and the chicken itself was not good quality meat. We also had the kung pao tofu which was OK but not outstanding. I kind of saw this coming in the beginning when they served us their tea (a pot with just a tea bag of your typical lipton-style black tea).
Mediocre food in a mediocre setting. I will not be going back.
author: Athena K.

description:
Red Jade is as good as it gets! My friends and I love going, all ordering different entrees, and then sampling everything and eating family style. Its the best! We've gotten to the point that we have to order 2 General Tso's....because those are ALWAYS a favorite. Onion Pancakes are amazing. I haven't found anything to be oversly greasy. 

This is definitely my favorite chinese place in the city! The food is great, inexpensive, and the staff is fantastic. What more can you ask for? 

Oh how I love you, Red Jade.
author: Hilary G.

description:
I was surprised...good chinese food in the Castro! I had lunch here so dinner might be a different situation. The restaurant was quite nice and service was great! The prices were cheap for an entree, soup, and tea. They have brown rice too! Also they give you a sesame ball with red bean paste for dessert...bonus.

It's worth going to if you're in the Castro and craving some chinese food.
author: Venatius P.

description: Food is affordable, quick, and plenty of it. What more could you ask? Definitely one of my go-to lunch restaurants. BK Approved.
author: Barron K.

description:
I love this place's lunch special..the general tsao's chicken is bomb!! lunch specials are about $5 with reasonable portions. Maybe 1 out of 5 times I wont be able to finish. The service is nice, they refill my water before I have to ask everytime and the resturant is clean. The hot and sour soup that usually comes with the lunch special is one of the best I've had. Lastly, the fortune cookie usually has a meaningful fortune.

Be careful what you order though. There will be nothing wrong with the food, but it might not be to your liking. I'd recommend ordering something that you've heard of, otherwise you might get a dish that you don't want to eat.
author: Jay L.

description:
I used to come here all the time when I worked in this area.  How can one beat their lunch special prices.  Two people can eat a lovely meal with soup and tea for around $11!!

Service is quick and friendly.  The only reason I am giving them 3 stars is because their food is just that 3 stars.  I have had better Chinese food, but hey sometimes when the wallet is empty, you gotta opt for the cheap lunch specials.
author: Samantha R.

description:
you have to know the servers... some are great some are so,so.
i would say is the best food in that area when it comes to Chinese.
but... you have to say you are "VEGAN"
author: B H.

description: Since not a lot of people have written about the dining-in experience, I thought I'd shed some light on. As a frequent visitor and not a resident to the San Francisco area, I find myself always trying new places to build my repertoire of SF restaurants. My boyfriend and I stopped here about a long, cold and crazy night navigating back to the mission following the Hardly, Strictly Bluegrass festival. We were both tired, cold and hungry and sought shelter at this humble abode. We were immediately seated in one of the best and larger tables even though there were plenty terrible, tiny tables all around. And then also immediately given water and hot tea. We ordered hot sake, a large bowl of hot and sour soup (WHICH WAS AMAZING), the spicy salt and pepper soft shell crab (perfect if you're looking for some terrible for you but tasty fried stuff) and the garlic chicken with a bowl of steamed rice. With all the food and plenty of leftovers to take home we walked around with under a $37 dollar bill. I also love how they give you a fortune cookie AND one of those sesame sticky bun things with your check. It was a great, humble find and I'd recommend the dining in experience anytime.
author: Jen F.

description:
Not usually a fan of Chinese food but love this place. Less greasy than most, and they have ostrich!  Large portions, reasonable prices.

What's to like?
 - not greasy (request sauteed vs fried)
 - ostrich (try kung pao ostrich) 
 - lots of meat/fish and vegetables, not all carbs
 - wonton soup is huge and tasty, made with lean chicken meat
 - good deal on cheap-but-ok wine, $20-24 deloach bottles
 - stir-fried spinach with garlic - mountain of spinach, almost no oil
 - brown rice is available
 - friendly, efficient service

Not to like?
 - no dessert menu
 - i'd love a steamed fish option
author: Chase P.

description:
YUM! 

I love this place! My favorite is the Hunan beef, General Tso chicken,  and fried brown rice. The place is fast and affordable. Lunches are about $5.25 and come with soup, rice, and a  main dish. Dinner prices are very good as well. The portions are large when you come for dinner (often the left overs completely fill the take out container). Best of all, they also give you sesame balls with the fortune cookies.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: I've eaten here several times, and I always enjoy myself.  There are a variety of items on the menu, though my personal favorite is the spicy eggplant dish (vegetarian).  I tried the Kung Pao Chicken once and it was very salty...not to my liking.  The wait staff is always very accomodating and respectful.  Also, the prices are great!  For a two person meal (main dish, side order, tea, and eggrolls) and even w/ some left over, you'll spend around 20 bucks.  Not bad at all.  Oh, and they bring these really yummy sesame puff things that have some kind of sweet paste inside them along with the standard fortune cookies.  I definitely recommend coming here!  Enjoy!
author: Beth H.

description:
The fourth star is for the extras I got for my delivery order. Otherwise, its 3 star food at 3 star prices (which I guess is a good thing).

Appetizer mixed platter - oily and tastey, the crab fried wontons were thick

Other than that, I can't remember the food. But I did get a free sesame ball and puffy white buns (I don't know the name... anyone? anyone?) with my order.
author: Andy A.

description: The only food that I've tried here was their green onion pancakes and their dumplings (pot stickers). And I loved them both. Their green onion pancakes are made from an old traditional recipe, that's why their good. And I love the dipping sauce that comes with it. It tastes like peanut butter and something else. Their pot stickers were quite good. I like the wrapping of it.
author: Annie H.

description: If you're looking for affordable Chinese cuisine,  this is your place! The food is great and really tastes authentic. I had the dim sum and hot and sour soup that were both delicious! Very friendly staff. Would highly reccomend
author: Karly M.

description: Worst restaurant ever!!! I placed an order for pick up (basil chicken over rice) and they gave me the wrong order (some nasty looking uncooked meet with egg) so I called back and asked if I could get my money back... a man said next time, your order will be free and no charge for delivery. So I called today and a lady answers the phone and tells me they don't won't give me my money back and they won't deliver for me and the worst part I have to pay for the basil chicken and she hangs up on me!!!!!  The food is good but the service is the worst
author: KARINA D.

description: this should be 2.5 stars.  Delicious onion cake.  foods decent... needs to be less salty!!!!
author: Marcia B.

description:
so, I'm from LA, and I moved out to St. Louis for graduate school. Upon my descent into the midwest I came to know what is called Crab Rangoon. We don't have it in LA, and of all of my years at Berkeley and running around Chinatown in SF and Oakland, I had never seen it. I honestly thought it was kind of gross until I tasted it at Red Jade. They seem to use real crab and put green onion in the filling. It has such a succulant sweet taste to it that I can probably eat them for a full meal. 

Pretty awesome wanton soup too.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
I've only eaten at this restaurant for lunch. Their lunch menu are reasonable and the food taste pretty good. I have tried Kung Pao chicken, Hunan Fish, and Mongolian chicken. 

Their service is fast and the bathrooms are pretty clean. Needless to say, I come here for lunch at least once a week.
author: arleen r.

description: I really enjoy this spot for their lunch specials - enough to ride my motorbike down from Pac Hgts when I've got the time. It's priced right and the sweet pastries (two!) they present with your check are a nice bonus. I've been there probably 50 or more times over the years, and I've never been disappointed. Expect to see a cop car in the adjacent red curb zone. SFPD officers frequently have lunch there. FAVES: spicy salty ribs (pork) and twice-cooked pork. It's a clean place with smart, fast servers too.
author: Scott S.

description: This place is consistently GREAT!!  I highly recommend it.  I've been coming here for several years, ever since seeing it on "Check Please Bay Area" (and all 3 luv'd it too).  The staff are very friendly and professional.  While reading their English only menu, they serve you a FREE pot of hot tea. Thank you.  And, some ice water, thanks.  Then a FREE bowl of soup.  YUMMY and THANKS AGAIN!!  I love the "Happy Family" (honey walnut shrimp on a bed of lettuce with melon) and LOVE the ONION PANCAKE (a potato pancake, really, with a few scallions) with delicious peanut sauce.  Yum!  But my family and I have tried many other traditional items (cashew chicken, etc.) and they're lovely and yummy, not too greasy.  The restaurant is pleasantly decorated and the bathrooms are nice.  The meal ends with the REASONABLE check in Chinese (it always adds up) and a FREE fortune cookie and FREE round cookie (I think they said it was lotus inside? YUMMY whatever it is.) per person.  THANKS!  Why are these little free items so deliciously delightful?  They just are!  Good food at a good price.
author: Maria D.

description: This is the first review I've ever written for Yelp, because I'm generally easy to please.  But this restaurant has no place in SF.  I don't know what the rest of you giving this place glowing reviews are on about.  If I could give this place less than 0 stars I would.  The food was disgusting.  The "orange chicken" came as petrified pieces of what we thought was calamari at first.  With no sauce on it.  What was the sauce?  Water with some orange dye in it. All of the food was cold when it arrived.  We were both sick after only taking a few bites.  This place is just gross.  Shame on those who gave this place good reviews, misleading people.  I should report this place to a health inspector and the better business bureau.  DO NOT EAT HERE.  Put them out of business and let a legitimate restaurant take their place.
author: Michael S.

description: Worst fried rice everrrrrr... won't come back!!!!
author: Braina D.

description:
if you live in my neighborhood and you're in a pinch, this is a solid place for delivery. their menu is irritatingly non-descriptive, but everything i've had is a-ok, esp the sizzling rice soup! i would never get soup delivered normally, but for this i make an exception. and you get pork buns for free!

wish the soup did not come fully ensconced in plastic...maybe they could find some kind of paper option?

p.s. DO NOT get your cheesy chinese delivery food from wild pepper. got the worst food poisoning of my life from there. wild pep = bad...in fact, i should go do a review of them...
author: Sally R.

description:
this place is pretty rockin...considering they make bomb-ass food like my granma-ma does post-communist era minus ALL that msg.

It's hard for a mandarin-speakin girl like me to find a mandarin-speakin posse - so an extra 1/2 star for being able to speak to me in my tongue.
author: jen w.

description:
I will never eat here again.

The food was greasy. The chicken was gritty and fatty.

My boyfriend got a shrimp dish that was ok. I do agree with a poster previously about how the fried sesame balls were the best part.

Never again.

The only plus is fast delivery.

Are there ANY good Chinese take out places here?
author: Michael D.

description:
Red Jade,

You get the Chinese seal of approval. Two peace signs.

$40.00 worth of a food
Two happy Asians with very full stomachs

Sweet!

Take Out Break Down
------------------------------
Spinach in Garlic (very authentic)
Egg plant - good
Mongolian beef
Walnut Shrimp (good, but could be crispier - that is the risk of take out with this dish)
White rice (a must)

Fortune cookies and an added bonus of sesame balls

Friendly Service
====================
Result = Recommended and approved
author: Po L.

description: Update - my last meal from Red Jade was le gross; fatty pieces of meat, gloppy sauces, really unappetizing dumplings. Boooo, Red Jade. We used to be friends but we're on the outs.
author: Sara A.

description: OMG, I can't believe that in the 15 years for living in SF it took me so long to find a place with great food, that delivers quick, oh...and you can order online.  Heaven
author: Ken p.

description:
we went here on the recommendations from Check Please episode, and ordered the green onion pancakes per the suggestion.  I'd say the ambiance is nice, the service polite and responsive, the food - variable. 

The green onion pancakes were - hmmm - gummy. Not a lot of flavor and not to nice a texture. Pot stickers were large and plump, but then I took a bite and realized that the inside was raw. Is that pork? chicken? whatever it was, the rawness caused me to eject what was in my mouth quickly. The spicy dry fried spareribs sounded good, but came back as chopped up pork and bone pieces deep fried, very salty, and not much spice. 

The princess shrimp was a nice very American-Chinese dish. 

Again, a nice-enough place with nice-enough service, but variable and sometimes uncooked items.
author: Roland D.

description: Clean and efficient staff.  Food I get is the very basic american Chinese, but they do have some more traditional Chinese on the menu as well.  For the price it is a good deal and great for home delivery orders, just be sure to call them I used one of the online sites once and they delayed the order not checking the site or e-mail or however it gets to them 45 extra minutes.  Will still go back again and again.
author: Joseph F.

description: Good food and prompt delivery. Big ups to the mongolian beef and the scallop dishes. Less enthusiasm for the chicken dishes.
author: Kelly S.

description: Went here a couple weeks ago, and I dont remember what we ordered.  However, I remember the crab rangoons.   They were quite good.
author: dublin a.

description: First time here and the Green onion pancakes are the bomb and the mango beef hits the spot. Will definitely be back again.
author: Brian L.

description:
I love that place. The food is fresh and tasty. No MSGs. Service is usually nice. Potstickers and green onion pancacke are a must for me there. Prices are great and you get plenty of good food for your money.
I took one star off because of the Burger King-atmosphere.
author: Anna P.

description:
4 stars for really fast delivery and free pork buns & dessert!
Food was good enough for delivery.  Now I have a giant container full of ma pa tofu.  yum!
author: Genevieve P.

description: My favorite Chinese food delivery place thus far.  Quality, good Chinese food.   A good size meal for 2 plus tip runs about $25 for delivery.   Delivery usually takes 30-60 minutes, fyi.
author: Dan P.

description: One of my favorite Chinese delivery options - I think they have the best hours for sure.  Food is just okay though.
author: Aaron W.

description: The green onion pancake (sans the sauce on the side) would definitely be part of my last meal on Earth. So glad this place is in my 'hood!
author: Tamara M.

description: There is nothing that compliments a night of red wine, cigarettes and debauchery quite like the food at Red Jade. I have never physically been to Red Jade restaurant, but I have ordered a feast in delivery form.. I was not disappointed. Service was quick and the food was AMAZING. Some of the best Chinese I've had in the city (OK... this doesn't mean much since I moved here in January..). It's not terribly close to where I live, but from now on whenever I visit my two besties I'll be ordering some beef with broccoli and crab rangoon. Oh and one last thing... the pork buns are like an orgasm.
author: Megan D.

description: We ordered delivery from Red Jade, and were very impressed. I got the General Tso's Chicken, which was spicy but not overdone. We also ordered the Sesame Chicken which got rave reviews. The order was delivered quickly, and they even threw on an extra when your order online. I was very impressed!
author: Greg B.

description:
This place is the best take-out in the City,  TOTALLY order the soups from here when it is cold outside and you don't want to travel!

My choice WOR WONTON or FRESH CHICKEN Soups!  They give you enough for 2 hungry people!  And try their Potstickers, perfectly made, lightly browned on one side, ginger and spices on the inside!  A MUST TRY,
Another personal favorite...chicken and Basil, but you gotta love basil cuz they do it up right!!
author: D D.

description: The best place to get authentic Chinese food at an affordable price in the duboce area!
author: Dallas S.

description: Hey people, please read my first review. I GOT A PIECE OF METAL IN MY FOOD!!!!!!! I took a picture. You can ask me to send it over if you want a proof.
author: Mosquito L.

description:
I had dinner delivered a couple of weeks ago, tempted by the menus they leave on my front door each week and some decent reviews from Yelp. I had sizzling rice soup, honey walnut prawns, veggie fried rice and the green onion pancake.

Delivery took about an hour, but at least the food was hot when it arrived. Unfortunately, the temperature was about the only positive thing about the meal.

The soup was adequate; the broth was tasty but the proportion of broth to vegetables to meat was way off. The green onion pancake was okay.  The fried rice was a little dry, and they very obviously used frozen mixed vegetables. THe honey walnut prawns were absolutely disgusting. The prawns were rubbery and covered in a mayonnaise-like goop that overwhelmed the batter, but couldn't mask the fishy smell of old prawns.

While prices are reasonable, you definitely get what you pay for in terms of quality. I will not be ordering from Red Jade again,  and the search for a good neighborhood Chinese food spot continues.
author: Cai O.

description:
I love that you can order from them online at delivery.com  (I only get Chinese food when I'm VERY lazy, so might as well be the laziest I can be, right?)

I think they have the best Sesame chicken in town.

Thier lunch specials are only 4-6 dollars and provide more food than I can eat in a day.
author: courtney t.

description:
If you ever want to know what the fridge of a Chinese restaurant might look like, just do the following...

1. Get really sick
2. Get your friend really sick
3. We're talkin' REALLY sick, like yo shit won't be walkin' for a good 5 days sick.
4.. Have no appetite to speak of
5. Finally feel your fever break after 4 straight days and get way too excited about a small amount of your appetite coming back
6. Grab the only menu you have in your new apartment and order some soup for you and your sicky friend
7. Order a few more soups just in case, cuz who knows when you will ever feel well enough to go to the market again
8. Order a few other things with the same line of thinking in place
9. Meet the guy downstairs (and scare him with your sick lookin self) to help him carry this massive load of food up to your apartment
10. Sign the $88.00 receipt (what?!)
11. Realize you weren't all that hungry after all and only eat an egg roll
12. Stare into your fridge at plastic containers that look like science experiments gone wrong and realize, newp, still not hungry.

What the hell was I thinking? I really have no idea, but you try thinking straight with what feels like pneumonia and a 4 day fever. :) As for the food, they offer up a tasty variety of yumminess. I ordered from them my first week in town and tried the combo chow mein and it was good. Also tried the lettuce cups and they are awesome! I would order those again anytime! And they are super quick for delivery.
author: Stephy S.

description: The green onion pancake was amazing but too much for two people to finish as an appetizer. The chow mein lacked flavor but overall it was OK
author: Stari N.

description: I was volunteering at the Nike Women's Marathon this past weekend and since Nike is hella stingy they didn't feed us lunch even though we busted our asses for like 8 hours free of charge since 6am for them; anyway I'm off topic, we needed someplace to eat.  So we come to red jade because my boy Kevin was like I used to come here everyday after school in high school to get the Mongolian beef. So pretty much the lunch special runs till 5pm which is pretty cool and you get a big ass plate of rice or whatever mandarin style side you like and a main dish for $5. So I got the Mongolian lamb and It was bomb and tasted good, the veggies mixed were good too and smothered with delicious sauce. So I mean $5 for pretty decent Chinese is not bad since its cheaper than Panda Express but its real legit. Service was good and I enjoyed the fact that after we were done we got fortune cookies and sesame balls filled with red bean paste NOM NOM NOM. I mean its in the Castro so If your an ignorant homophobe then you shouldn't go there but I'm cool with it so I was like lehhgo!
author: Jeromy G.

description: Whenever I come to the city I want just one thing: Red Jade. I've only eaten the sesame chicken, but I've had it over 20 times. This is the most delicious, crack-food I've ever eaten. All other places must bow down to their sesame chicken.
author: Vor H.

description: My husband & I have been struggling to find a good chinese place...and over the weekend I was really craving chinese food...so i saw that Red Jade was a hop, skip & jump from our apartment and that the reviews were promising. We decided to go to the restaurant and we were seated quickly - they were moving around at lightening speed but the place was pretty busy that Saturday night...they were nice but wanted you to order quickly (i had to ask twice for them to give us a couple of mins but they were nice about it). We ordered pot stickers which were super yummy, garlic prawns, chicken chow mein and mongolian beef - all were yummy. The prices were reasonable for the quality & quantity of the food. Overall we had a good experience and we'll be back - maybe next time we'll order in too.
author: Kimberly R.

description:
I'd like to err on the 3 1/2 star side but I'm rounding up because there were a lot of factors that made this a 4 star-ish review.
My roomie recommended that I try this place with her as she found they were a great value and had fast delivery and decent food. I chose to order from the lunch menu and had a rice plate (which comes with soup) consisting of brown rice and salmon with asparagus in black bean sauce.  She got the Hunan fish and the vegetarian egg rolls. Our order total was a little over $17, including tax. Delivery was prompt and way faster than the 30 minutes quoted over the phone.  I was also pleasantly surprised to find, in addition to the two fortune cookies, two sesame balls. Apparently if you order over $15 in food they include a free dessert. Yay dessert!
I didn't care for the soup that came with the meal, egg-drop-corn-something-gross kind of texture-soup of the day.  My meal was okay, not memorable but fresh and plentiful. It was cheap and there was enough food to last another meal. Which I am going to now eat for dinner, cuz I'm thrifty like that.
author: Jill D.

description:
-Update-

The Roommate, the Roommate's Boyfriend, the Boyfriend and a Friend and I were starving but we didn't want to leave the house as we had just busted open Ticket to Ride (we're big games people). New food recommendations: the lettuce wraps are good. Nice, fresh lettuce and taste-full chicken. The dry-fried chicken wings are also tasty but they're very saucy so get ready to lick your fingers.

-End of Update-

The Boyfriend introduced me to Red Jade after his protestations of Chow's Kitchen (which I found three-stars-acceptable). I was pleased to discover that the food is a step above Chow's but still three stars because it's not San Tung. The fried crab rangoon was about as good as anywhere else, as were the vegetarian egg rolls. The wok-fried beef fillet with snow peas was ok - the meat was decent, not too stringy. The kung pao chicken is average as is the General Tso's spicy boneless chicken. The steamed tofu with combination seafood was like Ma Po tofu or like Korean soon-doobu. The beef fried rice is actually pretty good - it might be my favorite dish here. I liked the beef chow fun ok too, but I thought there was too much beef (I know, strange complaint). The ratio was a little off. I do like how they give you free sesame balls/BBQ pork buns with your delivery order. There's a minimum $15 delivery charge and they're pretty fast - I'd say about 30-45 minutes, depending on where you live. You can order online, which I love, too.
author: Christine P.

description: This is not the place to bring friends and family if you want to impress them, which is why I always eat here alone after I workout at 24 Hour Fitness. Bummer is you have to overhear lesbians say things like, "I like the girlfriend experience; I just don't like having a girlfriend." Anyway, the food fairly generic, no wow factor. I had the Crispy Chicken last night, and it was just that crispy chicken. The good thing is the food is fresh because the turnover is good, because in the part of town, the gays don't know any better.
author: Jay D.

description: Oh this place is amazing. Any place that can make chow mein for me with just meat and noodles is high my book. The two kinds of ostrich are DELICIOUS. We often get delivery from them, and it's here at my apartment in like ten minutes. Well, I guess that's not amazing considering I live like 5 blocks away. But still, it's fast when I'm hungry and lazy. And that's all that matters.
author: Lauren S.

description: Fast delivery and free pork buns = 5 stars. Nothing really special about the rest of the food takes it down to 3, seems a bit "gringo" to me.
author: Seth M.

description: Gave me horrible food poisoning, missed 2 days of work.  Thanks a lot guys! Awful awful awful. Avoid Avoid Avoid!
author: John C.
