description: You want cheap and fast Chinese? This is your place. Kung Pao chicken is nice and spicy and great if you're in a hurry. I've never actually sat down for a meal at the Red Jade, but I've always grabbed take-out or had delivery. It's not the be all end all of Chinese food, but it's pretty tasty. My only complaint is my potstickers were a little suspect, as they seemed to be slightly undercooked. I lived to Yelp about it though...
author: Michael E.

description: Tried a couple of items on the menu - Shrimp in Black Bean Sauce and Kung Pao Tofu, and was disappointed that the sauces for both items were so insipid. Panda Express food tastes much better and is cheaper too!
author: Shweta V.

description: My family and I went there last night. We thought is was ok--nothing to rave about. We did, however, love the General Tso's chicken; that was super good. The onion pancakes that people seem to really enjoy were quite doughy. The Mongolian beef was not good at all. The Yee war won ton soup was good. Don't think we will go back again.
author: Diane D.

description: Meh. Rice is not free. We ordered the takeout from eat24.com. No bueno.
author: Cindy L.

description: I eat here once or twice a week. Why you ask? This place just simply rocks!!!!! Dollar for dollar, this place is the best chinese food place in town unless you actually know Cantonese or Mandarin and can decipher where to go in Chinatown! The best mixed dim sum of any other Chinese take out place evar! If you order sweet and sour, sesame chicken or general taos (sp? lol, someone hates me for this but they need to take themselves less seriously) chicken, order your sauce on the side! Trythe dry-rubbed pork if you are feeling like something terrible for you but you want to feel sin with every bite! Skip the BBQ'ed pork... it has no sauce. DO GET the Chicken Wor Won Ton soup! Two quarts of delicious soup for $6.99??? You will not be disappointed!!!!! PORK BUUUUUNNNNNNNNNNSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!!!!!!!!!!! NOM NOM NOM NOM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Ethan T.

description: Your standard crappy Chinese fast food. It would be edible enough to forgive if not for the horrifically rude service. The manager actually rolled her eyes and said "Godddd" like a petulant teenager when I asked for sweet and sour sauce as she passed.
author: Arram S.

description: Being a fan of Chinese food, I'm kind of a snob when it comes to the food. Red Jade was first introduced to me by my brother two years ago, and ever since then, I've been a fan. Their food is tasty and not heavy, oily, and yucky that you get in some restaurants, that eventually make you run to the nearest bathroom. The delivery somewhat runs between 40 to 50 minutes but the food is hot, which is a plus. And if you order over $15 you get 2 free sticky balls for dessert (ohhh) and over $20 you get buns filled with meat (ahhhh) as appetizers.  If you decide to do a sit down, the service is fast and prompt. The food portion run towards the plenty side. The price, well it's very reasonable. But beware, if you like to have your sauce on the side, they charge an additional $2 because they add more meat to the dish (which I think is a bunch of crock) but hey it's their business).
author: Kathy T.

description: I have only ordered Red Jade for take out, they are quick and usually get the order right. The food is decent, not the best or worst Chinese food I have ever ordered. I would say they get the order correct about 90% of the time and most of the food on the menu is decent. The ingredients are not the oldest or the freshest I have had. I guess overall they are just A-OK...
author: Bobby B.

description: I loved this place to death until it made me sick yesterday.  RIP cheap lunch specials. *Sheds a single tear*
author: T.Z. R.

description: I placed an online delivery order with Red Jade a couple weeks ago.  Delivery was on time, and I got exactly what I ordered (along with some free sesame balls).  The hot and sour soup was really good, as were the vegetarian spring rolls.  The rice was okay.  The sesame chicken was sub-par due to the poor quality of the chicken and the boring sauce.  I wouldn't mind paying more for a better entree.
author: Brett N.

description: Wow! I've been looking for a good Chinese place in my area, and I've probably walked by this one 100 times! Yes, I know I could just go to Chinatown, but this is absolutely perfect. The food, the service, and the fact that they deliver is amazing. Try to lettuce wraps!
author: Veronica B.

description: This is truly one of the best experiences I have had with Chinese delivery here in SF.  Very good tasting , good quality food.  I ordered the war wonton combo soup, sweet and sour pork (typical i know)  and rice.  It was a nice size portion and like I said before it tasted good.  I will order here again and again.
author: Robert P.

description:
solid chinese delivery. i'm all about it.

4 stars for:
$15 minimum for delivery. 
took 30 minutes to deliver. 
gave me free pork buns. 
allowed me to pay by credit card over the phone. 
was able to find my door to buzz me even tho its hard to find.
cheap.
pretty tasty.


The End.
author: Christine L.

description:
Chinese food, which has a habit of inciting a Maoist revolution in my gastro-intestinal tract, is a real conundrum. Whilst I crave said comida, I often regret it. Red Jade is no real exception....it is no House Of Nanking, nor some super authentic place in the Sunset. But for a stumbled across little place in the Castro, I am a fan.
    The potstickers were amazing, but in a fitting yin to the hate/love yang that is Chinese food, they did not have any of the teriyaki/soy/oyster sauce that generally accompanies them. The general Tso's was good, but was over battered and over cooked. The Spicy Beef was sweeter than it was spicy. All in all, the food left us happy, without a Tiananmen Square incident in my tummy. Oh, and they give these pretty tasty sesame donut/ Lotus fruit snacks in addition to fortune cookies.
    The service was great, love the neighborhood and Id go back if I were there again. The lunch menu looked pretty solid, value-rific.  Not a Wok on the Wild side, but a solid, standard dinner fare.
author: Jonny C.

description: Thank you for the PROMPT service! We were starving and our food was brought to us within minutes of our ordering.  The egg drop soup was delicious and my friend can not get enough of that crab rangoon.
author: A G.

description: This is my favorite Chinese delivery place.  The food is really delicious and always comes in a timely manner.  They are always nice when you order and have not made a mistake in five years of delivery service.  That says a lot.  Their prices are reasonable and they often give you free extras.  We have tried other places but always go right back to Red Jade.
author: Sean O.

description: This place has been in the hood for a few years but we had never tried it until last night. We thought it was just another medicore Chinese joint. We were wrong. The best green onion pancake in town...hands down. The dumplings were solid (dim sum sampler). It's no Yank Sing but certainly a far better value. I took a chance on the spicy salt and pepper soft shell crabs...and they were the highlight of the meal. Incredible. They deliver so this place is going to be our go-to Chinese place.
author: Bill R.

description:
This place claims to be a Mandarin/Chinese Restaurant, but the stuff really isn't that authentic. Aside from that this place is really good.

First off, the price. The prices are just right, that's compared to other Chinese restaurants and especially other restaurants in SanFran.

The food isn't amazingly stellar but the flavors were all nicely balanced. As always, slightly on the salty side.

Waiter service was really friendly and good. I would recommend the Garlic Prawns and Soft Shelled Crabs.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: I came here because I saw the episode of Check Please Bay Area in which this restaurant was featured. The guests on the show raved about the onion pancake so I had to order it . It looked really delicious when we got it, but when I bit into the pancake I discovered that it was way too doughy, and almost under cooked; the outside of the pancake was fried perfectly though. The peanut sauce that accompanied the dish was tasty. Our next dish was the House Eggplant. The shrimp in the dish was way too salty and the eggplant was just ok. Would not come back.
author: Pam G.

description:
My wife and I are value restaurant hunters.  We heard about the Red Jade restaurant and decided to take my mom (a gourmet chef) and her friend (a dim sum chef) to join us for dinner.  The place was packed with a 30 minutes wait so we took the liberty of asking patrons how they liked or disliked their dishes.

Some of the common "thumbs-up" dishes included peking duck, general cho's chicken, honey walnut prawns, lettuce wrapped chicken, various vegatable dishes and the ever-popular onion pancake.  People were tight-lipped about "bad" dishes.

We ordered the peking duck, general cho's chicken, lettuce wrapped chicken and were delighted with the authentic flavors.  We also ordered yee-fu wonton soup, the fried chicken wings and the onion pancake for appetizers.  These dishes looked beautiful but were not full-flavored for they lacked seasoning.  Since the pancake was a top seller, the kitchen rushed out our order and center of the pancake wasn't fully cooked.  

All in all, we were impressed with the value of the Red Jade restaurant and the "nod" from two professional chefs.  The restaurant also offered a comfortable and relaxing environment as well.
author: Dennis Y.

description: I love me some cheap, not too greasy, not to authentic Chinese food every now and again. You know - the kind you bought for an all night study session when you were in college. Red Jade actually caters lunches and dinners at my work during our busy season and I love their Chinese food! Don't expect gourmet - expect tasty, fill you up, Americanized Chinese food for less than $8! I love that the Chow Mien doesn't leave a grease puddle on your plate and that the veggies are crunchy and the meat is fresh!
author: Becky M.

description: Yes, I am poor and I love the $5 lunch specials. A fat plate of tasty food. I am unoriginal in my chinese food and LOVE sweet and sour pork, it was quite nice here. I love it when it's still crisp under all that sauce, not all soggy and creepy. They have lovely appetizers, the rolls and potstickers have been always really flavorful. The service isn't bad, but you have to flag down the servers, which is fine with me.
author: gabby m.

description:
Highly impressed with the quality of food and service. 

I have been to this restaurant twice and definitely will continue going there. This place is amazing. Food came out quite quickly. The lunch special came with soup. Both the soup and the entree (Hunan fish) were palatable. I and my friends are completely full and it only cost three of us only 20 bucks in total including tips and taxes.

For the dinner, I ordered

Hunan fish : similar quality with the rice plate I had before in lunch special. The fish was very good but some of them doesnot even have the taste of the Hunan sauce. Obviously, the fish was fried separately and they are not thoroughly mixed with the sauce so if you order it you will probably have to mix it yourself before eating.
 
Yee-Wor Wanton soup with chicken : basically this dish is a chicken broth with fried dumpling, chicken and bok-choy. The broth was plain but with a little bit of szechuan chili paste (they have it on the table) and some soy sauce, It is very good. Chicken was highly palatable but the dumpling is not that special.

General Tso chicken : this is a real HIT for this restaurant. One of the BEST General Tso I have ever had. For this dish, I just merely love it :)

Also ambience in the restaurant was nice. Service is quite good too.

All in all, given the price and the quality of food, this place is surely going to be in the list of my favorite chinese place of all time!!
author: P O.

description: I really like Red Jade and I'm sad that I don't live a block away anymore. The green onion pancake sets my marker for go0d (tho slightly inauthentic) Chinese food. Despite being "inauthentic"- it's just damn yummy. Inauthentic in the sense that it's got Occidental charm, you know what I mean? It really knows its clientele well. The place that was there before, I swear it was the front for the mafia or something. Red Jade- nummers. My favorite takeout was the mongolian beef, or the special beef, bok choy, and green onion pancake. They also serve brown rice, if you want.
author: Anna B.

description: Never been to the restaurant itself, but the delivery service was pretty quick and came through with a bunch of food for cheap. It wasn't the best chinese food I ever had, it was pretty forgettable really, but I got enough for 3 meals for less than 20 bucks (take advantage of the lunch specials). SO they're good for 3 stars I guess.
author: Tommy P.

description: Food is not very good. It's ok. But I will not tolerate having trash taken out during my meal. Not just trash. I'm talking about the big trash bins that go out on the street. Green and black ones. The outside of which are so nasty and filthy as they sometimes are. And here we are eating out meal, and the roll a few of them right by us, the cans barely squeeze between tables. The cans would have rubbed my arms if I didn't lean out of the way. How about waiting til after closing time people! It's filthy -- not a smart move for a restaurant.
author: M K.

description: Uhhh oooooh, I got sooo freaking sick here it's not even funny.  The food was bland and I have a sneaking suspicion they might have been using MSG, particularly from the raging headache I had throughout the entire next day.  Mediocre food, medicore prices, must find a new chinese delivery place in the hood pronto!!
author: Claire C.

description: When I'm eating Chinese I often go for the eggplant in an attempt to be healthy (I know, I'm kidding myself here).  So I was secretly overjoyed to find that my eggplant lunch special from Red Jade included little, delicious bits of chicken.  So yummy I practically licked the container clean.  Also, the whole deal--eggplant & surprise chicken, rice, soup, fortune cookie, and little sesame ball of yum only cost $4.50.  I think I have a new Delivery.com favorite.
author: Katie S.

description: I say less authentic, but the dishes were simple, clean, and delicious (not to say that authentic dishes are complicated, dirty, and bad).  My friends and I ordered a variety of dishes and shared.  Nothing in particular was 'special', but the free sesame seed buns for dessert, the friendly service and cheap prices (and they take credit cards!) makes this a 4-star restaurant.
author: Daniel L.

description: Who ever said that cheap Chinese food has to make you violently ill? This place has a kick-ass lunch special. Tons of choices, all around five bucks. The entress are a little bit on the where's-the-beef side, but to get rice, entree, and soup in a nice setting for just a few bones? Who cares? Bonus points for brown rice and tons-o-A/C on a hot day.
author: Aaron L.

description: Top notch delivery. Though they're on Church, no problem delivering to SOMA. The free steamed buns and sesame balls are a nice touch.
author: David Y.

description: I have ordered from Red Jade at least 5 times now.  I have never eaten in the restaurant.  Only had it delivered.  The food is always on time, hot, and seasoned very well.  This is really good Chinese food! everything is great! I always place my orders using eat24hours.com.  They work very well together.
author: Ryan M.

description: Good lunch. Cheap and tasty. Waitress said that they don't use MSG so that's definitely another plus. And in addition to the fortune cookie, they give you a sesame ball that is pretty delicious too. Yum!
author: Natascha D.

description: Quick delivery but lousy food. The crab rangoon was great though.
author: brandon b.

description: I love Red Jade. Their Kung-pao tofu is the quintessence of delicous take-away food. They serve great food, quickly and sometimes I go two days in a row! An absolutely must for take-out aficionados! The dining room is nice too.
author: Brian K.

description: Some days driving around town barefoot in my 7 series BMW doesn't make me happy the way it should.  Sigh.  And some days I long for the street food culture of Oaxaca or Hong Kong.  On those days I place a call to this modest Chinese restaurant on Church St. to order some not-so-modest pork potstickers for pickup.  A self-proclaimed potsticker connoisseur, these are my current favorite in the city.   You can easily make your own street food culture by walking around San Francisco with a friend and little white box from Red Jade.
author: Phil D.

description:
This is seriously the most disgusting meal I have eaten (I should say attempted to force feed myself) in as long as I can remember.  And I paid $18 for my foul ass take-out.  The orange chicken I ordered was freakishly yellow and I honestly don't think it was chicken.  It was all curly like octopus tendrils and soggy and foul.  Even the chow main and egg roles were bad and smelled funky...
NEVER EVER EAT HERE!!!!
author: satya p.

description: Free delivery until late-like. Nice folks.  Kung pao ostrich!!
author: Kirsten B.

description:
so you've got a buzz and you want to eat some food before the next beirut game so you order up some noodles on delivery.com from red jade.

.....but then they take hella long and the food isn't great. i mean it's ok and you can eat it and all, but on the whole this place needs a kick in the ass.
author: David D.

description:
smile pile tile vile bile

that's somehow almost an appropriate review in itself. the backstory is that i'm preparing to go on a one month "detox" plan, having read too many exposes on all the creepy crawlies living in our guts and having flashbacks to the mid 90s when my mom was playing tapes people discussing the living things crawling through their own poop while on "cleansing" programs as she COOKED DINNER, and farther back still to a time in high school when a rotund  teacher walked into the cafeteria in the morning, saw me buying a donut and said: "YOU'RE SO SKINNY I CAN'T TELL IF YOU HAVE A TAPEWORM OR BULIMIA."

tonight it felt like both. it was a rough and tough week and i'm about to enter into about 3 solid weeks of house guests. boyfriend left for LA today and i got my detox stuff in the mail, so the plan was to start on saturday morning, and lay low and alone tonight. decided to have really good (ie bad for you) chinese delivery-- grease up before the health kick. i mean, i was INTO it, suffering from a yellow fever, pacing the house and salivating.  i ordered up an app, veggie, and entree, ALL OF WHICH WERE ABSOLUTELY VILE....... hence the tile and bile. literally so bad that i suffered through the 21 bucks and the disappointment of anticipated delivery only to eat half of it and then attempt to puke it back up. 

so i guess i'm edging into bulimia territory. tapeworm to be determined.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Fairly standard so-so delivery food... but they can serve up some serious magic when I am out of my mind and in the right mood. Cheap and always at my door in a jiffy. Green onion pancake is recommended: it is deliciously gross.
author: Chris L.

description: I am starving...no food... :( So, I order from Red Jade.  The food comes quickly, which is pleasing to no end.  The guy was super nice...I rarely get take out, so I never know what to tip...I just gave him like 5 bucks or so.  The egg flower soup was yummy...I had some sort of spicy chicken that was slightly over cooked, but all in all it wasn't bad.  If someone knows of really great chinese takeout let me know!
author: Jess S.

description: I call this place Jade Caf because you can seriously have a caf priced lunch here. $4.50 and you get a huge serving of General Chicken, lots of rice, and whatever soup you want. And it is so good, pretty much my favorite chinese in the City. Plus, the service is fast and they deliver. I love the people there too, such a good mixed crowd.
author: evan Y.

description:
After moving to my current apartment, I found it necessary to immediately locate the nearest, most delicious Chinese restaurant that delivered. 

My roommates and I are nearly connoisseurs of Chinese delivery food at this point, and have always managed to find something that suited us in each of our previous residences. I have to say, we were very disappointed. We ordered orange chicken, Mongolian beef, and the Hong Kong pan fried noodles with seafood. 

The orange chicken was terrible. It came with the sauce on the side, so when I initially opened the chicken I noticed that it appeared as if it had been frozen and then thawed for this occasion. The sauce was thin, and tasted synthetic - almost like a citrus household cleaner. Honestly, you can get better frozen asian-style chicken from Trader Joe's. The beef was nothing to write home about - not terrible, but not good either. I've definitely had better before. The noodles seemed to be half pan fried. The top edges were crispy, but the bottom was soggy. There was no sauce or flavor to the dish. 

While the food was mostly lackluster, there were some upsides to the meal. The delivery service was right on time, and the food was hot. It was also very convenient to order online. In addition, we received free BBQ pork buns with our meal, and those were fairly good. 

Overall, I would say that there is definitely better Chinese food out there. It might just be that we happened to order the wrong dishes and missed the real gems at Red Jade. However, from my experience, I would say that you're better off eating elsewhere.
author: Lisa H.

description: Best takeout in SF. Classic dishes, never too greasy. They deliver and usually give you a free appetizer.
author: Michelle R.

description: Twice must be nice... ok that was corny, but if you're reading this then at least I got your attention. Each time I've visited here, I've always had the best customer service. That's a nice surprise for a Chinese restaurant. Now to the important stuff- THE FOOD.. My group of 5 ordered 6 dishes, and we ended leaving with a smile like the fat Chinese food god they place at the front of any Chinese restaurant. I recommend the tasty lettuce wraps and General Tso's Chicken. Other than that, I've had better Chinese food for cheaper. Don't order the vegetables over birds nest if you're also going to order another vegetable dish because its the exact same shiet, only one has an edible bowl, and that wasnt even tasty. Minus 1 star... It tastes pretty Americanized to me, so I think it'll be the last time I come here, even though they've got great service. But more power to you if you like it because they sure are nice here..
author: Thomas L.

description: Red Jade is a good place for lunch specials. Especially ones with seafood. Other than that, its just any other chinese restaurant. The location is decent for Lower Haight, Deco Ghetto residents as we dont have to run all the way to Chinatown.
author: Sav B.

description: It was decent.  I thought I'd give it a try and I wasn't disappointed but I wasn't impressed either.  I would do take-out there again, I feel like I can't really go wrong with it...makes for plenty of left-overs, good value. I wouldn't get the beef tomato chow mein again though, that was just ok.  I feel like I've been describing this place in a bored tone but that was unintentional :).
author: Debbie Y.

description:
the epitome of "meh".

pros: the kind of appetizers you are craving (bbq pork buns, egg rolls, scallion pancakes), brown rice, you can order from delivery.com (feels shady but i didn't have a problem).

cons: very low quality meat... makes the whole ordeal feel like a gastronomic mistake.
author: Kris P.

description:
i order delivery from this place about once per week.  

it's affordable and fast.  of course, it's not gourmet chinese food - but works when you're a couch potato.

i recommend the potstickers (full of ginger), yang chow fried rice (i'm a bit biased towards any fried rice dish), and combination wor wonton soup.
author: kim n.

description: Good fresh food, fast delivery. All you could ask for in Chinese cuisine. I have actually never eaten in the restaurant. I love that they don't use styrofoam for their delivery and actually some of their containers you can keep for storage. I also love that if you order a certain amount they throw in pork buns and they are yummy! love love this place.
author: Erin O.

description: Considering that I haven't had decent chinese food since I moved to San Francisco (how ironic, and from no lack of trying) I have to give the slighty above medocre meal here props. Combined with rock bottom prices, a decent atmosphere on a sunny afternoon by the window in castro, dope bottomless jasmine tea, and friendly and attentive service and you've got a four star combination.
author: M L.

description: Have heard such good things about this place so I thought I would give it a try for the first time last night. I came there pretty late last night and ordered their famous onion pancake appetizer as a starter. It was more enjoyable than I thought they would be! Extra cripsy and loaded with flavor. Also ordered the spicy eggplant, seafood combination bird's nest and the combination chow mein. The spicy eggplant was hands down the best dish of the night! It was loaded with eggplants, basil, chicken and shrimp in a tangy, spicy sauce! The seafood combination bird's nest dish was good as the seafood was fresh, BUT the bird's nest itself tasted old and stale and was made out of wonton skins rather than the more traditional egg noodles. Last but not least, the chow mein. I love chow mein - let's just say I wouldn't miss much if I never ordered their chow mein again. Overall, the food was good, the location was ideal, the ambiance was nice, BUT the service...
author: J T.

description: This place is cool. Delicious Lemon Chicken and Sweet and Sour Pork and they brought sesame balls with the fortune cookies at the end of the meal. The servers were all very nice and the whole place stayed open late for us. Good food, good people.
author: Alyssa J.

description: The food here ranges from a 3 to a 4 however the restaurant is very conveinent and delivery is always fast and orders arrive correctly so the people at Red Jade deserve a 4 at the very least.  I am a big fan of their Crispy Salty Sparerib and Seaweed Tofu.  It's nice that they bring you hot tea complementary with the meal when you eat at the restaurant and a nice red bean paste sesame bun with your fortune cookie.  Unfortunately they are not open very late so it's not convenient for late night workers who are hungry for Chinese.
author: Michael D.

description: The price is right, but the food is wrong. Inauthentic: spicy garlic pork was not spicy, and was inexplicably dark (soy sauce?) and sweet; vegetarian delight was over-salty (though the vegetables weren't too bad underneath; MaPo Tofu was OK, but I didn't write home.
author: Patrick M.

description: This place is great! Fast delivery and everything is packed well and arrives hot. Great pot stickers and fresh veggies. Keep in mind this is not a gourmet spot. it is a fast good fresh delivery.
author: Tyler S.

description: Clean, warm, reasonably priced, friendly and fresh food!!!  They are the only Chinese restaurant that have all these qualities.  They don't rush you out of the restaurant, they tend to your needs. and the food is consistent. Great service too.  It's a family run business and you can tell as they put their hearts into it.  We always defer to Red Jades when we need our Chinese food fix even when we're not in the immediate district.   Bathroom (ladies) room is clean.  Parking can be challenging though.
author: Ali L.

description:
I need a bi-weekly dose of south jersey style chinese (americanized, but not nearly to the point of being panda express-esque), and this place really fits the bill.  The only thing they could do to make it more jersey would be to call the "scallion pancake," "chinese pizza."

I've had this, something like kung pao tofu, Sichuan beef, General Tso's chicken, and pretty much every other embarrassingly white dish on the menu.  Everything I've had tasted great and the portions are huge for the price, particularly at lunchtime.
author: Mark S.

description: For the price, one of the better places I've been to.  Friendly atmosphere and staff.  Tasty mango chicken and sweet and sour pork!  I know that's a total American choice but I always get it and it's a good measuring stick for a place's quality.  Overall a good experience.
author: Argonaut A.

description: Not bad for a late night delivery.  I must say I have a weakness for the deliciously fired salt-n-pepa shrimps and the rangoons.  I mean shite, fry it with some shrimp and cream cheese and how can you go wrong?
author: Chard M.

description: Friendly, reliable, fresh and awesome Green Onion Pancake...
author: aynne v.

description:
So this place rocks.  Monica mentions the heavy use of black pepper in the hot and sour, I agree it was a touch much, but it had great ingredients, seemed really fresh, and was a nice consistency, and the spice did not come from the black pepper.  The potstickers were very good though not ground shaking.  I was with a crew, so we tried a bunch of things.  
Spicy beef and broccolli was very fresh, though most of the "extra spicyness" we asked for was extra red pepper flakes....This seems to be a theme.  None the less, it was very good with the rice, which was not too anything, but good chinese restaurant rice.  
The moo shu pork was awesome, very fresh vegetables, a little light on meat, but great flavor and good pancakes and sauce.  General 
Tso's Chicken was great, small pieces of meat with medium frying but a great sauce.  
We also had cold beer and warm sake, both very enjoyable with friends and red jade's yummy food.

Atmospherewise, great for friends, not the most romantic for a first date, but could easily become a regular.  And if I lived in the area they would be my go to...
author: Grant B.

description: It's fine, but honestly I am kinda over it. Hot and Sour soup is pretty good though.
author: A W.

description: I've never been this hunger in my entire life.  Everything I ate from this joint tasted fantastic because it was flavored with my consumming hunger.  Insanely fast delivery (yes I am a lazy bum), and they included free pork buns which was a nice DELICIOUS surprise.  I got my favorite, lemon chicken, and brown rice.  Everything tasted fresh as if I had eaten it inside the restaurant.
author: Tiffany L.

description: "Veggie" dishes have nasty rubbery chicken bits in them!  DISGUSTING!! service is extremely rude
author: Nana W.

description: I've been there twice and the food was quite tasty.  However, I am giving it three stars as I am super picky about Chinese food.  RJ's Chinese food is more Americanized which is considered very good for Americanized Chinese food.  I have my craving for Americanized Chinese food from time to time, and I always go to RJ.  They do a really good job on fried chicken dishes like sesame chicken, orange chicken, general cho chicken...etc.  Chicken corp egg soup is really good.  Not sure if they use home-cooked pork/chicken stock or they just use lots of msg.  I always feel so thirsty after dinner.  haha.  Overall, RJ is a good place to eat.
author: Alex L.

description: This place is pretty good.  I have been a few times, but last time I went with four men, who all got very excited when the waiter mentioned the prospect of spicy food.  Nice decor.  During the meal, everyone starting talking about what they would rate this restaurant on yelp.com....I think yelp may take over.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Love it!  A lot of fantastic entrees occupy space on the menu.  The prices are cheap.  The surroundings are clean.  You never have to wait for a table.  This is one of my favorite places for Chinese food.

The sweet and sour is way better than most.  The beef with garlic sauce is really great.  The spicy tangy chicken is fantastic as well.
author: t l.

description: 4 Stars strictly based on service, cleanliness and affordability.  The food is alright but far from great.  They're open late enough and a few blocks from where I live so it's super convenient.  That 5th star requires them to remove that funny taste from their beef and pork...
author: Clay K.

description: As you all know there are hundreds of chinese restaurants in San Francisco so we are fortunate in this respect. But I have to say that I enjoy Red Jade more than most. First of all I like the way this place looks, how I'm treated by the wait staff and of course the food. I would say though as a preface to this review, there are some items on the menu that I've tried and not especially liked. I'm not sure if this is my own preferences or what. Anyway these are my favorite dishes at Red Jade for sure. Try the Green Onion Pancake. It's the best I've ever had. Then the Fried Crab Meat Rangoon, as well as the Pot Stickers. The Combination Plate Appetizers is amazing too if you want to share with others. My favorites on the entree menu are Walnut Prawns With Honey Dew Melon, House Eggplant Special, Peking Duck Special (order first thing), Original Dry Fried Chicken and any scallop dish. I like all the different Fun plates as well but they're pretty fattening if you're on a diet. Most of the other entree-type items are good but of course I haven't tried them all yet. Also I would advise that you go to this place during the week if you can because weekends are fairly crowded and the kitchen can't always keep up with the demand. I really enjoy this place for sure, and recommend it to all my family and friends. I hope you like it too.
author: Tony G.

description: Dire service, the waiter was talking on the phone while he took our orders, and handed our food.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Hands down the worst Chinese food I have ever had anywhere. I'd rather open up a can of Chung King than eat here. Chinese food for the clueless...hence the place is always full of people. AWFUL!!!
author: Kenny G.

description: I get delivery from here all the time.  Love the place.  So quick too.  I always eat General Tso's Chicken.  Their twice cooked pork is delicious and love all of their noodle dishes.  You want fast, good delivery?  Call them!
author: Lisa O.

description: I have cured many hangovers with Red Jade's delivery.  The pot stickers are made of perfection and I love the free mini-pork buns when I order larger amounts.
author: Johanna w.

description: It's cheap.  Huge portions.  A great place to go with a group of people after a few drinks.  Or for lunch with a buddy, or whatever.  You're hungry... but don't need AMAZING food, and you don't want to spend much.  All the veggies are always crunchy and good.  It's fast, too.  It's a consistently yummy place I know I won't be disappointed.
author: S S.

description:
originating from new york 
i am very cranky about chinese food in cali
something is just never quite right
but it can't be expressed in words

red jade makes me forget my annoyance for a while
author: saru s.

description: At one point I gave them a great review, but now the lady on the phone argues with me that delivery is a $15 minimum - a month ago it was a $10 minimum, which I know because I ordered delivery regularly, and never ordered anything other than 2 appetizers and 2 cans of soda. No, I will not order more food. I just want the rangoon, which I will now get delivered from elsewhere.
author: Cheryl J.

description: Great Chinese Cheap Eats -- Food tastes great and you can request all white meat!  Always friendly -- and want to help almost too much.  Not a place for atmosphere -- but if you want a good option for no special reason -- definately worth trying.
author: Anneliese G.

description: Disappointed.  I was in their restaurant the other day and the waiter bordered on rudeness and I hated the tofu dish I got.  I left without tipping and not eating my meal.
author: M K.

description: So good and so cheap! Admittedly I've never eaten at Red Jade when they've been very busy, but I've never had to wait more that 10 minutes for my order. The hot and sour soup is SOOOO good and the stir-fried dishes are crispy without being greasy. My personal favorites include General Tso's Spicy Boneless Chicken, Spicy Chicken with Basil, and Chinese Broccoli with Scallops and Beef. Also the complimentary tea is extremely enjoyable.
author: Liz W.

description: Good decent Chinese food.  We always order here for delivery -- have tried a couple other chinese places, but always come back to Red Jade.  Food is always fresh and delicious (mango ostrich, chow fun, general tsao's chicken) and the delivery is always faster than what they quote. Overall:  Consistent quality (no playing the mystery meats guessing game), reasonably priced and yummy in the tummy
author: melissa w.

description: Great for cheap food and fast delivery. Their appetizer combo was solid-- crispy spring rolls and perfectly browned potstickers-- Yum!  Their lunch specials were a great value-- huge portions of food and rice as well as soup.  Prawn with Lobster Sauce was tasty (FYI they add pork to the sauce).  Sesame Chicken was slightly below average as it wasn't crispy and the meat was all fatty dark meat. Egg flower soup was also pretty good. Like most other reviewers, loved the free sesame balls. For $19 worth of food delivered, I am stuffed but have barely put a dent in the food.  I'm thinking leftovers for a week which is perfect since I'm laid up with a broken leg.  Will order again.
author: Larissa W.

description: The only reason this place got a 3 instead of 2 stars is that the food is somewhat decent. The Singapore Rice Noodle is very good, a must-try. This place always gives you complimentary sesame balls and pork buns. No other restaurant does that. But this review is about their delivery service. The reason why they get a 2 star from me. No silverware! No kidding! No forks, spoons, not even a shred of napkin. They can't be that cheap. I ordered food for a party of 5 people. This means 5 dishes, plus 2 appetizers, $45 worth of food. You'd think that it's obvious this food is meant for more than 2 people? But no, 2 fortune cookies! Are you kidding me? I will probably order food from them in the future, but not without making sure I have napkins and silverware ready.
author: S K.

description: Moving is always stressful. But in order to move, one must have a yard sale(in my case, a sidewalk sale), so I asked my long-time friend John to help me set up and amuse the passerbys. Five hours later and $60 bucks richer, I wanted to treat him to lunch and we found ourselves at an old neighborhood favorite, Red Jade. I swear this place has been here for as long as I have lived in S.F. It has undergone several face lifts over the years but the food is still pretty decent and..inexpensive. We split a giant bowl of Yee War Wonton with fresh chicken ($6.95), almost a meal in itself, and the combo appetizer for two($6.95) which consisted of two crunchy,not-too oily egg rolls, crab mat Rangoon (tasted mostly like cream cheese to us), pot stickers and dry, fried chicken wings. We slathered everything with chili paste and hot oil so it was pretty good. I've had better and I've had worse in other Chinese restaurants. The staff is quite attentive and efficient and the atmosphere is very relaxing. AND they deliver! For $15.75, it was a good little meal. Thanks John!
author: michael s.

description:
Hi,
I have ordered from Red Jade many times and ever went to the restaurant on the dog walk. Problem is I mistakenly went to another restaurant once with a "Red" in the name and their food was extremely salty. Then I realized tonight when I did a search and could not find the Ostrich Mango (which is delicious) that I had the wrong restaurant. So the reviews from people that said the food was salty might have made the same mistake.
I always eat the sesame balls first and the dim sum appetizer are tasty. I live across Market Street in Hayes Valley and delivery is really fast - unlike most other Chinese restaurants. I rate them a 4.0 and .5 with the freebies round it up to a 5.
author: Mark D.

description: these folks totally just overcharged me. so annoying and DISHONEST.
author: Audrey T.

description: Fast, Pretty and Tasty (... the food is, Silly!)  You don't have struggle with parking in China Town.  This undiscovered treasure has the flavor of Hong Kong down (I've been there!)  Try the Spicy Salted Spare Ribs,  Prawns in Jade greens and great (Yee) wanton soup.  The combination Dim Sum Platter in a meal when you don't know what you want to eat.
author: Jerz Z.

description: Red Jade is great for lunch but their food is sometimes not consistent. Especially the hot and sour soup. The prices are more than reasonable and the service is fast, but unfriendly.
author: Mike K.

description: If you want good, cheap Chinese this place is it.     Lunch specials are around 5 bucks and come with soup and tea and the portions are huge.  I really don't understand how they make any money with cost of doing business in sf.  The place is clean and service is efficient. The decor is nice, nothing fantastic, but it doesn't have that fast food feel.
author: Jimmy M.

description: Reliably tasty meals served at a price that will not break the bank.  Good enough for that staple "I just got back from work" take-out restaurant, but can serve as a sit-down for the out-of-town guests in a pinch.  Their soups are great, I'm a fan of the hot and sour and yee wor wonton.  Excellent pot stickers. Chicken chow mein and chop suey deserve honorable mentions.  Incredible lunch special bargains.
author: Marc S.

description:
It all started one fine day 3 months ago at my front gate, someone from red jade was kind enough to leave a take out menu at my door step. That person is my new best friend.

The first time I ordered, I was hung over and just needed the healing powers of Chinese take out. (Americanized Chinese and a sprite = no more sucking at life.) I really didn't expect much. But DANM!!! the food was great.

Probably the best Americanized Chinese food I have ever had. 

Look, I love going to china town (Oakland) and getting a real deal Chinese meal. But this is the best take out I have ever had in SF.

Fast forward to last night. I decided to get some Chinese food with some friends and we wanted to go out to eat, I decided to give the red jade dine in experience a try.

Another great idea.

I love this place, I mean $2.50 beers, 20 bucks for a bottle of wine and the food was fresh out the kitchen. The service was great, super friendly and totally on top of the water situation. 

Red jade you have done me right, dine in or take out this place is on point.
author: Derek d.

description:
I'm super surprised this place has such high reviews... maybe we just picked the wrong dishes but i was extremely disappointed.
I ordered the vegetarian chow mein, which basically just tasted like soy sauce (though the veggies were crunchy and fresh) and the walnut prawns, which were so mayonnaisey it was gross. 
The only redeeming dish was the egg rolls, and the actual walnuts from the walnut prawn dish were munchable, but even the fortune cookie I got was off. 
The servers were friendly but practically hounding us to order and after we finished to pay the check that had been sitting at our table for about five minutes. Sad cause this place is right around the corner...
author: Leah H.

description: I come here for lunch quite often. when it's a 1 on 1 or just a few  of us, we order off of the lunch menu. You'll get the usual american tourist options of sweet and sour pork over rice, mongolian beef over rice, shrimp fried rice, beef chow fun, etc, but it's all pretty good and inexpensive.($5.95 or so) if we take a coworker out for their birthday or some other big celebration like a promotion, we'll order the family style dinner/lunch of orange chicken, garlic egg plant, brown rice, bbq beef, some kinda "jean-mean", walnut shrimp, and vege plate. all of the plates are good but the bbq beef is so-so and kinda tough. i've never tried the onion pancakes. probably the only thing i don't like is when the bill comes, there's no breakdown. all they have is what you order, and the total amount. they say the tip isn't included even with a party of 6 or more, and there's no "tax" line. not bad enough to stop going back, but this practice is questionable.
author: Hagow C.

description: Top notch Chinese food in Duboce Triangle / Castro area. We moved to a new area, but still come back for their food. I see the same waitresses and waiters each visit which leads me to believe it is family owned. Service is quick and efficient, and the food is served fresh and piping hot. The wait staff takes care of filling waters, removing empty plates from all tables ensuring that no table is left unattended. The only problem I have  when I am here is to stop from eating. The food is so delicious that I tend to forget that I am full and I am just eating because the food is incredible! Check this out, it is a great spot and the prices are very reasonable!
author: Michael Y.

description: I have been going to this restaurant for years (even before it became Red Jade).  The food is consistently good and fresh.  Although this is not a "high end" restaurant for atmosphere, the value is exceptional for the quality of food.  I was pleasantly surprised to see the panel on "Check Please" give this a thumbs up.  Hopefully a rave review will not go the owners' heads, since this is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in SF!
author: Mark L.

description: Consistently decent Chinese food. My wife and I often order delivery from Red Jade. It's not the best in the city but it's decent quality, and affordable, and fast.
author: Joe C.

description: my current favorite chinese delivery place.  their general tso's chicken is the best of any place that delivers to me, and they always throw in some free food.  of course, i don't know if that qualifies it as good chinese food, but it works for me
author: Steve S.

description: While the food is OK, just OK, my mother in law used a credit card for an order only to have it used to buy everyone's meal that night to the toon of thousands.  Obviously there was a thief on staff that was pulling a scam, but the management was totally unhelpful or in the least bit apologetic!  We now boycott this crooked establishment!
author: Andrew L.

description: I have many food allergies and have a hard time ordering food by phone. Red Jade is very good about listening to what I really need and preparing food the way I ask. This makes them tops in my book. Only 4 stars because the food is good but not great. Still their prices are good, their service fast and friendly and everything is always tasty.
author: Nan B.

description: Got delivery after I saw it on Check, Please.  It was alright, but not hugely great.
author: e g.

description: This place is great! I eat here at least once a week, ordering from their ridiculously cheap lunch menu. Soup, brown rice, entree, tea, sesame cookies (made onsite) for $5.50! I like that the menu has many spicy dishes and they are not afraid to turn up the heat if you ask. The lemon chicken, twice cooked pork, spicy salted spare ribs, Mongolian beef, moo shu pork, and dim sum are all winners. The staff is friendly and efficient. And the bathrooms are always spotless which says tons about how they run the restaurant. And when I saw my Chinese plumber having lunch there with his work crew, It reinforced my belief that this place is the real deal.
author: Jimmy R.

description: hmmm. sunday night - lazy just returned from hong kong and still wanted chinese food. scanned yelp for some recommendations and i found RJ. i ordered and an hour later, my food arrived. i DO NOT rec general tsao chicken, though the potstickers were good (and too much ginger comment was right), good hot sour soup) and thats about it. it was a little greasy but delivery in this city is hard to come by. not recommended though...
author: Hilary H.

description: Enjoyed the food. Not greasy. Service is quick, prices are very fair and the portions are a good size.
author: Jenny A.

description: this place delivers the best kung pao chicken i've had in the city thus far.  it's always spicy, and with a good balance of sauce, chicken and vegetables.  plus, they don't skimp on the peanuts!    the staff is very friendly, and food delivery is prompt.  other recommendations:  general tso's chicken, mango beef, mongolian beef, sweet & sour pork.  for under $6, including soup & sesame balls (love that lotus paste), i can't think of a better deal.
author: Patricia M.

description: used to be better, now mediocre. good lunch specials and probs better than average chinese but seriously, who do you have to fuck around here to get some decent, fresh chinese food that's not swimming in grease?
author: Mary V.

description: Good food at decent prices, though parking can sometimes be difficult.  Pot stickers, green onion pancake, and noodles are all recommended.
author: Bentley L.

description: The General Tsao is TDF!  (to die for...duh!)  and so are the rangoonies, just like delicious fried balls of ecstacy!  Seriously though, it's good stuff people, trust me.
author: Jesse W.

description: cheap asian food. i forgot what i got, but whatever it was it was a 3 star rating. we sat there for like an hour after dinner just drinking the free tea for some reason. we got really bored.
author: Victor B.

description: My first one star review -- I'm not sure how this place gets decent reviews. This has got to be the worst chinese food I've had in some time. Usually, it's hard to make bad chinese food. I make better chinese food than this place. As my girlfriend can attest, I'll eat pretty much anything...but I was unable to finish a bowl of rice with the food that we got. It was incredibly bland and the meat was pretty low quality. I don't think I'll order from thie place ever again.
author: Luke F.

description: not really authentic chinese food, more like amerinese food.
author: Pickle R.

description: Inexpensive, generic Chinese food.  It's nothing exceptional but it is very reasonably priced.  Food is consistent and service is always very fast.
author: Jeff S.

description: solid chinese food takeout -- it's the only place we order from.  and, the lunch special is UNBEATABLE.  for $6 (includes tax & tip), you get tea / water, soup, rice, and your choice of over 20 dishes on the lunch special menu, with fortune cookies for dessert.  as a bonus, it's fast --they get you in & out in under 30 minutes.
author: Jan W.

description:
This place was once the Hong Kong Cafe and it was exceptional for different kinds of Chow Mein and its Wor Won Ton Soup.  Since Red Jade has taken its place, the decor has been upgraded and the food has never come up to the level of HK.  I decided to give them another chance and went in for some seafood chowmein.  The calimari was like rubber, so tough that I could not bite through it.  The rest of the seafood was ok but some of the crispy noodles were burnt.  I took the squid out of the dish and sent it back to the kitchen asking that he return with the calimari redone.
They did not do this and tried to minimize how they had ruined the dish with squid so tough that it should not have been plated!
For great noodles in that block, go to CHOW for Smiling Noodles which is what I will do in the future.  
For great seafood noodles go to Broadway/ Columbus and they will not disappoint.  They have a great sculpture right on the corner which you can watch while you are eating.  It is motion activated and has many books in the air that light up when someone is near.  On the ground on the cement are many words, some foreign.  This sculpture leaves me with a loss for words--it must be experienced.  Enjoy
author: L H.

description: I had lunch at Red Jade with my hubby and 2 kids for the first time on Sunday. They are super friendly (which almost always makes me a fan...) and were very accommodating. We have a 2 yr old boy and a 6 month old boy. They helped us get set up at the table and helped us store our stroller away out of the main dining area. For all parents with young kids out there, this place is very kid friendly. The waitress brought an extra free bowl of soup for our son, even though we only ordered 2 lunch specials. The food is pretty good - not the best chinese I've had but for the price? Definately worth it. Plus they give you kick ass sesame balls and fortune cookies at the end of your meal. Forget the fortune cookies - just give me the sesame balls!
author: Jo A.

description: This is the only Chinese place I frequent anymore.  Conviently located in my old hood (Church and Market) they deliver to my new hood (Glen Park) and they have the best-ever General Tso's Chicken.  Now, I hate to say this, but I discovered the General at a Safeway in Seattle several years ago, and have since tried every General Tso's I come across.  This dish, from Red Jade, is something I get every, every, time I eat Chinese, and every, every time I eat Chinese I eat Red Jade.  Sometimes I call in and order General Tso's and brown rice, and I swear they know who I am from the order.  If I stop in to get an order to go I sit and drink a Tsing Tao beer and revel in the busy atmosphere.  It's an all around great place for delivery, take-out, or dining in.  And in addition to the General Tso's, the Walnut Prawns are absolutely delicious.  You owe it to yourself, at least once in this life, to indulge in the wonder that is Red Jade.
author: Marc O.

description: This place was terrible.  After walking around the city for 4 hours or so we decided to hit up a place back near our apartment only to wish we'd stopped anywhere else during the four hour walk.  The service was prompt but to the point of annoying where we had 3 separate people come up to our table within the first 2 minutes of being there to ask us if we were ready to order, not even giving us a chance to look at the menu.  We then preceded to order an entire array of 6 dishes so that we could share and experience all the food.  None of them were good.  The food was either bland, or oily, or just downright inedible.  I will NEVER go back to this place and I'm extremely upset at the fact that I just dished out that much money to eat awful food and regret ever setting foot inside.
author: Michael S.

description: sorry, i just don't get it. kinda chewy pork (how can you make pork taste bad?), kinda oily flavorless green beans, and i don't even remember what the third dish we got was. meh. if you're ordering here cuz they deliver for free, well, i can't fault you for that. but, like your motivation to leave the house, your expectations should be similarly low. sadly, that's how society punishes the lazy.
author: D M.

description: real good azn food. lunch special is key and goes till 5pm. mongolian beef is all i get here and it's the bomb. their hot and sour soup tastes like butt the first 3 times you go and smells like an old antique shop. then after that you cant get enough of it. real cheap
author: Wats C.

description: stayed in staurday night and watched bad tv. i was starving. i was craving chinese food. now, i typically order from jasmine tea house or yum yum, but i decided to give this place a shot since it was only about 2 blocks away from me and i thought maybe it would be delivered in a flash! so i ordered what i thought was a dish that is pretty damn difficult to screw up - spicy chicken basil. however, i was wrong. typically, when i order this dish at other places it usually does not contain "mystery" meat. i mean, i think it was chicken, but it was all dark meat and very fatty and just not very good at all. also, there was hardly any basil in it and it was in this soupy brown gravy-like sauce. gross. i also ordered the hot and sour soup and i found some pieces of beefy like meat in it. i didn't know hot and sour soup even contained any meat in it. so yeah, i did not have a very good experience with this establishment. but don't take my word as scripture, i mean, everyone else seems to like it. perhaps i ordered the wrong items. i think if forced to eat here again, i'll go with the vegetarian dishes.
author: James J.

description: we ordered from here on recommendation from yelp, and were seriously disappointed. it was flavorless, and the meat was bottom of the barrel. the wontons were funky and old, and i barely even ate one... usually i can eat unlimited wontons, so this is saying something. go elsewhere!
author: e j.
